item.title: Sales Representative - Detroit Converting
item.description: Details: Pratt Industries (Detroit Converting Division) is currently seeking a Sales Representative for the Metro Detroit territory (includes a radius of approximately 45 miles from the Livonia facility). Pratt Industries is America’s 5 th largest paper and packaging company with more than 4,000 highly skilled employees dedicated to the environment and sustainability. The company operates three of the most modern, cost effective paper mills in the country, as well as a series of sheet and box plants strategically placed throughout the United States offering a wide range of creative packaging solutions. Pratt Industries is committed to recycling and the environment by “harvesting the urban forest." Pratt Industries offers competitive compensation plans with incentive opportunities, full benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, FSA, All State, Pre Paid Legal, and 401(k) with company match, paid vacation, and paid holidays. Job Role & Expectations will include: •Prospecting and developing new business •Actively pursue new business opportunities in the Metro Detroit marketplace •Professionally create, maintain and increase sales •Maintain robust “Funnel Velocity" by prospecting and developing cold calls into sales •Develop and maintain strong relationships with targeted customers •Represent the company in a positive manner including adhering to all company, and industry regulations & guidelines •Meet or exceed sales objectives •Travel within Metro Detroit territory daily Core Skills: •Planning & organizational Skills •Self-motivated and & self-starter •Tenacity; ability to have the strength to sell even when facing rejection, with inner courage and determination •Strong decision-making and problem solving skills •Initiative and “Drive" (enthusiasm, energy, creativity, and resourcefulness) •Strong written and oral communication skills •Strong presentation and project management skills •Computer literacy is required with above average proficiency in latest business software programs, including Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint •Strong Operating Principles: Business Ethics, Values, and Customer Focus In order to apply to this position, please visit www.prattindustries.com and click on Careers. Apply to position number 29091400001727. EEO/AA/Vets/Disabled

item.title: Manufacturing Project Controller
item.description: Details: Let Vaco help you get the advantage over your competition! We have direct access to hiring managers & HR departmnets. Currently, we have an excellent opportunity with a leading company for an Interim Controller and Finance Manager with at least 7 years of cost accounting and financial management experience. This is a project opportunity with potential for internal hire. As project Controller, you will be responsible for cost accounting, inventory management, month-end close, forecasting, and process improvements. managing financial reporting, GL reconciliations, JEs and GAAP compliance. You will also be in charge of the Month-End Close and SOX documentation. Other responsibilities include: Managing physical inventory process Preparing book to physical adjustments Overseeing the inventory accounting process to ensure compliance with company policy and US GAAP Performing monthly inventory excess & obsolescence reserve analysis Validating accuracy of inventory balances and costs in all systems Requirements: BA/BS Accounting or Fiannce CPA/MBA highly desired Expertise in manufacturing operations and strategic leadership Experience in distribution a plus Proficient in SAP Spanish fluency a plus

item.title: Operations Supervisor
item.description: Details: BeavEx is recruiting for an Operations Supervisor in Houston, TX Schedule: Monday to Friday, 5:00am - 2:00pm The selected candidate's responsibility will include employee and operations supervision, dispatch, and warehouse duties. Operations Schedule and dispatch Vendors or Independent Contractors to appropriate locations according to customer requests, specifications, or needs, using radios or telephones. Consult with managerial personnel in order to meet operational goals. Receive, input, and distribute On Demand work orders, proof of deliveries (PODs), and manifests, and prepare reports as required by management. Serve as contact person for all Vendor/ICs within route territories and inform them about traffic problems such as construction areas, accidents, congestion, weather conditions, and other hazards. Manage contracts with Vendors and Independent Contractors to ensure all new and existing routes are covered as needed. Record and maintain files and records of customer requests, work or services performed, charges, expenses, inventory, and other dispatch information. Expedite package, freight, or product sorting, moving, bagging, palletizing, loading, unloading, and various other warehouse duties. Determine response needed to effectively and appropriately deal with emergencies, accidents, and breakdowns. Communicate Chain of Custody standards as required by Beavex customers. Resolve Vendor/IC problems or grievances and refer to IC Liaison. Evaluate importance of incoming telephone calls and prioritize accordingly. Ensure that the policies and procedures as defined in the BeavEx Inc. Operations Manual and Employee Handbook are consistently followed. Other duties/tasks as assigned. Customer Service Provide excellent customer service by ensuring timely and efficient courier service for customers according to route schedules and On Demand requests. Confer with customers or supervising personnel in order to address questions, problems, complaints, and requests for service. Keep customers notified of changes with route schedules. Maintain appropriate customer data, including key contacts, address changes, etc. Technology Use electronic mail, telephones, scanners, mobile phones, two way radios and other communication tools effectively on a daily basis. Demonstrate or explain use of equipment, technical devices, computer software, etc. to provide cross training for other Beavex employees.

item.title: District Manager - Surgical - Territory covers all of Missouri except KC, N. to Decatur & Springfield IL, E. to Murrary, KY -Coo
item.description: Details: Medical Product Manufacturing Since 1963, Cook Group companies have been among the leaders in developing healthcare devices that have improved lives around the world. COOK remains at the forefront of medical research and worldwide sales of products for endovascular therapy, critical care medicine, general surgery, diagnostic and interventional procedures, bioengineered tissue replacement and regeneration, gastroenterology and endoscopy procedures, urology, and obstetrics and gynecology. COOK is a global company with a global focus - and a global future. We have an immediate opening for a highly motivated and driven District Manager in our Surgical Strategic Business Unit. Surgical concentrates on the use of biomaterials for General and Colorectal surgical applications. This is an excellent opportunity to join a fast growing, well-established, and respected medical device industry leader. The territory offers substantial growth opportunities for a professional salesperson that brings the required skills. The ideal candidate will have experience in the Operating Room and medical device sales or support experience. We’re looking for exceptional people dedicated to high performance and personal excellence. General Job Description The primary purpose of this position is to establish relationships with and sell medical devices and related equipment and services to physicians, hospitals, and outpatient facilities. Job Functions/Duties (may include other duties as assigned) Develops new business and expands existing business Develops, maintains and executes an annual business plan for the territory Meets and exceeds projected sales goals Works independently and adapts to a changing environment Participates in national, state, and regional sales exhibits Maintains timely expense reports Keeps current on the managed health care environment Educates customers, through conversations, presentations/in-services and literature Complies with all policies within the Cook Employee Manual, Cook Code of Conduct, HIPAA Regulations and Cook Field Guide for Interaction with Customers Must travel overnight as needed Work Experience Experience in verbal and written communications Experience in problem solving Experience in working independently with little direct supervision Education Bachelor's degree in a related field preferred Knowledge of Microsoft software, e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint Physical Requirements Frequently lifts product sample cases, weighing between 20 and 50 lbs Works under general office environmental conditions. Sitting for extended periods, utilizes close visual acuity for working with computers, etc. Our Benefits: Base salary Teamwork bonus and performance bonus 401(k) retirement savings plan with company match Profit sharing Medical, dental, and vision Life insurance Paid time off Flexible spending account Educational assistance/reimbursement Company car, including gas, maintenance, and insurance Company laptop computer Company cell phone We are proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer for men, women, protected veterans and disabled individuals. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing as permitted by law.

item.description: Details: Volt Workforce Solutions is seeking a Accounts Receivable Manager. Responsibilities: • Attract and qualify prospects, while exemplifying exceptional communication, customer service and presentation skills, before allowing other team members to analyze their business needs and provide new opportunities for growth. • Achieve monthly, quarterly and yearly sales goals measured against recurring revenue. • Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from direct response marketing activity. • Work closely with marketing department to drive traffic to website/downloadable material. • Build sales pipeline through proactive efforts including but not limited to lead generation, regional networking, and cold calling. • Manage and maintain sales activity within a CRM System (Salesforce.com). • Identify prospects in a buying cycle, interest in our full value proposition. • Qualify prospects by identifying company’s profile and needs. • Collaborate with Sales Manager to determine necessary strategic sales approaches. • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple prospective clients and issues simultaneously. • Excellent communication, able to deliver full value proposition message and set the right expectations for prospects

item.title: Construction design Manager / real eastate(Chinese speaking preferred)
item.description: Details: About Wanda Group Dalian Wanda Group Corporation Limited is a Chinese conglomerate company with activities in real estate, tourism, hotels, and entertainment. It is headquartered in Beijing, China. As of June 16 2014, Dalian Wanda owned 88 Wanda Plazas, 55 five-star hotels, 1,247 cinema screens, 78 department stores, and 84 karaoke centers throughout China. In 2013, the company’s assets totaled 380 billion yuan ($62.8 billion), its annual income reached 186.6 billion yuan ($30.8 billion) and net profits exceeded 12.5 billion yuan ($2.06 billion). In June 2013, Dalian Wanda planned to invest USD $1.1 billion to develop a five star hotel in London. The new hotel will be built by the Thames river in Vauxhall, South London as part of the Nine Elms regeneration. The move was welcomed by the Mayor of London. In June 2013, the company purchased Sunseeker International Ltd., a U.K.-based maker of yachts used in the James Bond movies, for $500 million. Job Description Represent us in all project design meetings with design consultants. Review all plans to ensure our standard finishes. Solicit proposals from, contract with, and coordinate ADA, pool, material testing, and interior design consultants. Assist development manager with the coordination of electric, phone/cable, and gas utilities. Maintain and update our Design Manual. Maintain project design checklist. Review all project’s RFI’s so that design errors can be caught on current and future projects. Review and approve interior design scheme, furniture layout, and the furniture. Review comments from accessibility consultant and insure the comments get incorporated into the construction plans. Generate and issue construction cost request to GC in coordination with development manager. Coordinate AV, low voltage, and access control with consultants. Assist in final walks of units with Project Managers when necessary.

item.title: Operations Supervisor (Supply Chain/Logistics)
item.description: Details: Description Position Summary: Provide operational leadership, individual contributors, and hourly workforce to ensure the execution of daily tasks and activities including driver deliveries, loading/unloading of trailers, cross docking and customer service operations in a manner consistent with company services and cost objectives. Supervises most processes directly including workforce and equipment scheduling. Responsible for making corrective action and disciplinary decisions up to written warning level. Involved in the hiring process and customer meetings as necessary. Reviews truck runs based on location of accounts, volume, costs, customer requirements and private fleet utilization. Review daily orders for additional private fleet opportunities based on above requirements. Major Responsibilities: People: -Communicate performance standards that are specific and measurable, Interview hourly associates and provide recommendations for hire, Monitor attendance, productivity, and other performance markers and provide counseling and/or recognition to associates as needed. Operations: -Supervise logistics operations including customer service, freight loading and unloading, dispatch and proper documentation and procedure control, Evaluate and recommend changes in preferred work methods to increase productivity of dispatch/warehouse operations. Assist in new associate training, Provide relief coverage for operational duties when associates utilize time-off or are absent from the shift, Have a through working knowledge of the site's operating systems in order to ensure operational compliance and correct exception resolution, Complete all necessary records and reports in a timely and accurate fashion. Finance: -Ensure compliance with financial policies and procedures such as inventory accuracy and control, returns, damages, etc, Understand the relationship between decision-making and profitability, Closely manage associates' working hours and activities to minimize overtime and to meet or exceed productivity targets. Safety: -Ensure day-to-day management and associate activities are in alignment with the location safety strategy, Provide associates with communication, training, feedback, and direction to ensure safe performance, Ensure compliance with all applicable regulatory agencies and company policies and procedures. Growth / Customer Experience: -Understand the location-specific customer goals & objectives, Ensure the customer knows that we are committed to helping them meet their objectives, Determine areas that could benefit from Continuous Improvement efforts. Fleet/Assets: -Properly plan work assignments to ensure effectives use of fleet/warehouse equipment, Work with hourly associates to ensure they understand safe and efficient operation of equipment. Other projects and tasks as assigned by supervisor Qualifications -2 - 4 years related functional experience -High School Diploma or equivalent required -Bachelors Degree preferred - Strong written/oral communication and organizational skills are required -Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint required -Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening -The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The associate must regularly lift and /or move up to 25lbs/12kg, frequently lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this Job, the associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. Penske Truck Leasing Co., L.P., headquartered in Reading, Pa., is a joint venture among Penske Corporation, Penske Automotive Group and General Electric. A leading global transportation services provider, Penske operates more than 200,000 vehicles and serves customers from more than 1,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. Product lines include full-service truck leasing, contract maintenance, commercial and consumer truck rentals, transportation and warehousing management, and supply chain management solutions. Visit www.GoPenske.com to learn more about the company and its products and services. Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer Women and Minorities are encouraged to apply

item.title: OR Program Director
item.description: Details: ... Respecting and responding to the choices of people in need of supports. Dungarvin understands each person's need for autonomy and self-determination. Where barriers exist, we believe a responsive service provider must work creatively to change limiting environments and promote an individual's decision-making power. If you want to make a difference, join our team! Program Director We are currently searching for a Program Director to oversee the daily operations of various programs in Eugene/Springfield. In this position you will direct a team of professionals and skilled Direct Service Professionals providing residential, day program, and other supports to children and adults with developmental disabilities. Responsibilities: The Program Director is responsible for the overall daily operations of the program including supervision of staff, scheduling, financials, and payroll. Areas of responsibility include hiring, ensuring orientation and ongoing training, retention of high quality staff, and assurance that all aspects of the program are developed, implemented, coordinated, and monitored to the highest degree possible. Qualifications: Position requires experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities and autism. A bachelor's degree in the field of human services, psychology, education or related field is required and/or as determined by the Senior Director a combination of significant education, experience and abilities. Prior experience in developing and implementing individuals programs, budget implementation and in supervising others is desired. Must have good decision-making, time-management and communication skills. Top candidate will possess strength in administration, finance, DD programs, leadership, communication, and teamwork. Competitive compensation and excellent benefits package. ________________________________________________ Equal Opportunity Employer ________________________________________________ Our Mission: Respecting and responding to the choices of people with developmental disabilities. Dungarvin is a national organization of privately owned companies that are dedicated to providing high quality, community-based supports to people with developmental disabilities. Founded in St. Paul, Minnesota in 1975, Dungarvin has grown to serve approximately 2,125 people in 13 states. Dungarvin provides a variety of individually tailored services and supports under the Medicaid Home and Community Based Waiver. Additionally, Dungarvin provides services in several small homes licensed as Intermediate Care Facilities/Mental Retardation (ICF/MR). We also provide day services, supported employment, case management, supported foster care, children's services, respite care, and supports for traumatic brain injury services in several states. Dungarvin provides quality services that are flexible and responsive to individual needs and choices, while maintaining the fiscal integrity that ensures the long-term stability and security every person expects and deserves. Supporting people with developmental disabilities to achieve their fullest potential improves the quality of their life and that of the entire community. Our Philosophy: We believe each person has his or her own set of aspirations, goals, strengths, and dreams. We work closely with each person, and people close to the individual to discover and understand this unique combination. Utilizing our experience and expertise, we design and provide a constellation of services to support the person in achieving his or her life goals. Dungarvin understands each person's need for autonomy and self-determination. Where barriers exist, we believe a responsive service provider must work creatively to change limiting environments and promote the individual's decision-making power. We believe each person should be fully included in his or her community. Each person must have access to the community's resources and benefits, including the socially valued roles of being a citizen, neighbor, worker, and friend. Above all, we believe each person has a right to control his or her own life and destiny. All human beings, including people with developmental disabilities, have the same basic needs for physical comfort, security, a sense of belonging, love, and fulfillment. We will provide a unique combination of support, assistance, education, and encouragement that will enable the person to satisfy these needs and triumph in the fulfillment of his or her life goals. As a responsible service provider, we are committed to offering quality services that are flexible and responsive to the individuals we support. Dungarvin's fiscal soundness assures the long-term stability and security every person needs. Helping people with developmental disabilities achieve their full potential improves the entire community's quality of life. Dungarvin is proud to be a part of this enriching process. Read more at: www.dungarvin.com

item.title: Senior Accountant (JS)
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 04310-115917 Classification: Accountant - Senior Compensation: $70,000.00 to $85,555.99 per year There is a prestigious company in Richmond, Virginia that is looking for a senior accountant with SEC reporting experience. This role is responsible for various SEC reporting activities including compilation, analysis and editing of quarterly and annual footnote disclosures for the company, a master limited partnership formed in 2014. The senior accountant role includes preparing and/or reviewing GAAP disclosure checklists, preparing and/or reviewing related workpapers and supporting the external audit process, preparing and/or reviewing appropriate accounting guidance to ensure appropriate disclosures have been made, and interacting with the companys service providers (e.g., external auditors) to facilitate the completion and filing of SEC reports. The senior accountant is responsible for the XBRL reporting process to ensure timely and accurate filings. Supports other transactions carried out by the company, including capital market transactions (debt and equity offerings), acquisitions, and joint projects. The senior accountant role is also responsible for researching complex accounting areas related to the company. Researches and documents accounting/reporting issues regarding new guidance and/or transactions that have occurred or are being contemplated. The senior accountant performs accounting and reporting research in connection with new/pending guidance, summarizing research findings and presenting known effects and alternative options to management. Maintains a sound control environment that is SOX compliant. Provides analysis and other ad hoc requests to support the business, as well as parent company analytical needs. Perform other duties as required. This role is a high visibility position with excellent growth potential.

item.title: SAS Database Programmer
item.description: Details: Our client has a 6 month+ contractor opening for a Clinical Database Programmer. The Database Programmer is responsible for producing standard and custom reports for use by the Clinical Data Managers in their data review and cleaning efforts, developing transfer specifications with vendors for external data sources, performing Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) conversion programming and Quality Control (QC) and handling all other ad-hoc data requests by project team members for assigned studies. Responsibilities: * Extract clinical data from the clinical data management system and produce standard and custom reports, primarily in SAS. * Program reports and listings as requested by project team members for ongoing studies. * Develop transfer specifications with vendors for external data sources. * Perform consistency checks on data transferred between Client and external parties to ensure completeness and accuracy of data contained transfers. * Perform programming to convert raw, clinical trial data to Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) format. * Perform Quality Control (QC) on programming work performed by fellow Database Programmers. Requirements: * Minimum of 5 years of clinical SAS database programming experience in the pharmaceutical industry. * Experience in SDTM conversion

This company is a large wholesale firm and they are seeking Receptionist/Clerical Assistant to join the South LA County team. The Receptionist/Clerical Assistants responsibilities include answering multi-line phones, transferring calls to appropriate staff member, taking messages, greeting any incoming guests into the office. This individual will also be responsible for all general clerical responsibilities, including, heavy filing, copying, faxing, preparing all incoming and outgoing mail, ordering office supplies and keeping track of inventory. This individual will also assist staff with any specialized projects when needed.

item.title: Sales/Marketing Coordinator
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710944 Classification: Secretary/Admin Asst - Junior Compensation: $15.00 to $18.00 per hour Are you seeking a Sales/Marketing Coordinator role within a fun, team oriented environment? This company specializes in manufacturing and is seeking a Sales/Marketing Coordinator for their office in South LA County. This Sales/Marketing Coordinator will assist the Executive Vice President with sales and marketing matters as well as assist the Sales Administration manager with multiple products. The Sales/Marketing Coordinator will also be responsible for answering phones, tracking sales consultant reports, providing summary reports for division managers, assisting with data collection, and distributing mail. This person is also responsible for ordering office supplies, maintaining parking logs, maintaining conference room schedules, scheduling travel, and maintaining master files.

item.title: Sales Administrator
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710945 Classification: Secretary/Admin Asst - Junior Compensation: $11.00 to $13.00 per hour Looking for a great opportunity to use your background as a Sales Administrator within dynamic company that promotes from within? This company is a distribution firm that has offices in over 40 offices throughout the country and they are seeking a Sales Administrator for their South LA County location. This Sales Administrator will be responsible for collating, copying, printing, scanning, faxing, and binding marketing materials for the sales team. Additional responsibilities include maintenance of a company vehicle, maintaining copiers, shipping and receiving through FedEx and UPS, ordering binders and shipping supplies, and sorting and distributing mail. This person will also support the office by re-arranging furniture, and setting up conference rooms. Seeking an individual that is multi-tasked, takes initiative, and has strong customer service skills.

item.title: Human Resources Assistant
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710949 Classification: Personnel/Human Resources Compensation: $13.00 to $16.00 per hour Do you have previous experience as an Human Resources Assistant. and a strong passion to stay in the industry? This commercial construction company services clients throughout the United States and is located in South LA County and they are seeking a Human Resources Assistant. The Human Resources Assistants responsibilities include, assisting in updating and preparing employee files, reconciling benefits statements, performing general clerical responsibilities, including, filing, copying, faxing, scanning. Also, this individual will be working extensively in Access to update and streamline all Human Resources information through an Access database. This individual will also cover the reception desk for lunches, breaks and back up. Seeking someone who is flexible to assist with a variety of tasks, willing to learn new information and adaptable to changing policies and procedures.

item.title: Office Coordinator
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710948 Classification: General Office Compensation: $10.00 to $13.00 per hour Are you looking for an Office Coordinator in a professional office environment? This international professional services firm provides high quality, experienced professionals to clients on a project basis and they are seeking an Office Coordinator for their North Orange County Location. This Office Coordinator requires active involvement in the companys file system, and other responsibilities include maintaining files, inputting information into the database, archiving files and documents, as well as maintaining the files. Also, individual will be trouble-shooting and assisting the staff as needed.

item.title: Customer Service/Sales Assistant
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710951 Classification: Customer Service Compensation: $16.00 to $19.00 per hour Do you have a solid Customer Service/Sales Assistant background? This manufacturing company specializes in manufacturing custom corrugated packaging and has been supplying products exclusively to brokers and distributors for over 20 years and they are seeking a Customer Service/Sales Assistant for their North Orange County location. The Customer Service/Sales Assistant will be responsible for: making calls to new clients, generating new accounts, taking inbound calls from customers, entering orders into the system, following up to ensure orders are filled in timely manner, handling any issues related to product and continuing to build on existing accounts. This individual will serve as the main point of contact for accounts, will inform customers of new products and help to up sell on existing orders.

item.title: Receptionist
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710947 Classification: Receptionist/Switchboard Compensation: $10.00 to $13.00 per hour Have a strong receptionist background and looking for a great opportunity to keep busy for a temporary project? This company has been in the bankruptcy business for over 20 years and offers clients case administration and fiduciary management solutions for not only Chapter 7 trustees, but also to Post-Confirmation Trustees, Receivers, Disbursing Agents, and Assignees for the Benefit of Creditors. A Receptionist is needed to cover for approximately 4-5 weeks for their North Orange county Location. The Receptionist with be responsible for: answering multi-lines phone system, greeting all guests into the office, ordering supplies and keeping track of inventory, general clerical duties such as, filing, copying, faxing as well as data entry. Also, this individual may be required to create occasional letters, memos and various correspondence as well as assist with special projects as assigned.

item.title: Customer Service Representative
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00750-9710950 Classification: Customer Service Compensation: $13.00 to $16.00 per hour Have a strong customer service representative background and looking for an excellent opportunity to work for company that value their employees. This company specializes in the production of specialized equipment for the restaurant industry and they are seeking a Customer Service Representative is needed to join the team in North Orange County immediately. The Customer Service Representatives responsibilities include, making a high volume of outbound calls to perspective clients, providing customer service to inbound callers, confirming orders, updating clients on shipments, educating callers on products and services provided.

item.title: Recruiter - Outbound Calls - $12.00 to $14.00 per hour
item.description: Details: The Job Store is looking to hire a FULL TIME Recruiter to make outbound calls on Careerbuilder.com and Indeed.com. You will be calling off of resumes and applicants who have applied to job postings. Must have GREAT communication and sense of urgency. You will be making over 100 outbound calls per day giving job applicants information on jobs they have applied to. Apply to this job positing for immediate consideration. Better yet! Come in to our office and meet with the Manager for immediate interview: The Job Store 2140 Stringtown Road, Suite 2128 Grove City, OH 43123 (614) 444-9675 OFFICE Position starts immediately! ***Located behind Fazolli's off of Stringtown Road - by the Post Office.

item.title: Manager of Medicare Compliance & Corporate Responsibility
item.description: Details: This position will report to directly to the Associate General Counsel andCorporate Responsibility Officer for HealthSpanPartners. Interaction withsenior management staff of HealthSpan Partners, HealthSpan, Inc.,HealthSpan Integrated Care and HealthSpan Physicians(collectively referred to asHealthSpan), the boards of the respective organizations and any affiliated organizations asrequired. The Manager of Corporate Responsibility is a crucial role responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining an effective compliance program, including the administration, investigation and enforcement of the organization’s compliance plan and policies. The Manager of Corporate Responsibility will be responsible for HealthSpan’sMedicare Advantage and Part D (MA-PD) compliance program and compliance with the organization’s Federal EmployeesHealth BenefitsProgram (FEHBP). The Manager of Corporate Responsibility will have direct access to all employees, executive management team, including affiliatedpartners. The Manager of Corporate Responsibility will make reportsof compliance-related activities. This position provides technical and professional consultation as necessary to HealthSpan and affiliated organizations on compliance issues related to day-to-day communications from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and the Office of Personnel Management (OPM), required filings with CMS and OPM, and requests for information from business units on CMS and OPM requirements.

item.title: Project Developer
item.description: Details: At Ingersoll Rand we are passionate about inspiring progress around the world. We advance the quality of life by creating comfortable, sustainable and efficient environments. Our people and our family of brands—including Club Car® , Ingersoll Rand® , Thermo King® , Trane® , American Standard® Heating & Air Conditioning and ARO® - work together to enhance the quality and comfort of air in homes and buildings; transport and protect food and perishables; and increase industrial productivity and efficiency. We are a global business committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. For more information, visit www.ingersollrand.com . Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including individuals with disabilities and United States qualified protected veterans. Responsible to manage the teams and processes necessary to develop the sale of Contracting projects to the ultimate satisfaction of the customer. The Project Developer could be responsible for Acquisition Support and development of Design-Build Turnkey, scope development and pricing for customers. This position requires mastery of acquisition, technical aptitude and project management skills. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other functions may be assigned. • Directly execute the Project Acquisition process for Design-Build Turnkey opportunities. • Provide team leadership and guidance. • Establish strong teams utilizing both internal Trane personnel as well as external teammates. • Audit an existing mechanical system and recommend solutions to improve. • Ability to understand construction methods/practices and communicate and direct subcontractors in an effort to obtain critical proposal information. • Ability to use appropriate manner, personality, and outlook to effectively work with customers to solve their problems. Selling skills a plus, but not necessary. • Knowledgeable and skilled in Project Management and its processes. Ability to recommend plans for staffing PM/CM locally on-site and oversee projects through construction. • Serve as a role model in consistently utilizing and advocating the Trane Policy Guide, related tools and systems. • Continually validate the effectiveness of the Design-Build Turnkey and PC processes and identify and develop improvements. • Responsible for secured customers from Project Development through project transition. • Assist and support all efforts of acquisition and customer satisfaction. • Support Territory Leadership on an as-needed basis for efforts including training, consulting and business direction. • Provide marketplace feedback, including competitive information, customer expectations, industry trends, etc. • Provide sound “business judgment.” Weighing risk and reward in conjunction with the Territory Leadership team. • Travel required. • Demonstrate ability to cope with stress and maintain a pleasant and cooperative temperament with internal and external customers. Additional Requirements: QUALIFICATIONS: Working knowledge of financially guaranteed contracts, the operation of energy management systems, commercial HVAC systems, temperature controls, and process control systems. Experience and knowledge in using Project Management Tools (CPM, PERT, Gantt Charts) is required. Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Primavera Expedition and P3/Suretrak required. Educational Requirements – Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Construction Management preferred with a minimum of two years of experience or six years of construction industry experience; or two year degree from technical college in related field with four years of experience in the construction industry or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. We are committed to helping you reach your professional, personal and financial goals. We offer competitive compensation that aligns with our business strategies and comprehensive benefits to help you live your healthiest. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture that engages as well as values the different backgrounds and experiences of our employee, which, in turn, spurs innovation, generates creative solutions and enhances our customer relations. If you share our passion for inspiring progress—for bringing about bold shifts in how people, economies and societies operate—then you belong with Ingersoll Rand. Progress begins with you.

item.title: Sr. Field Service Engineer
item.description: Details: Job Summary: Responsible to provide Professional Services for SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL customers including technical site analysis to resolve customer issues and to perform field service duties on SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL’s complete range of single-phase and 3-phase equipment. Fundamental knowledge of electrical distribution systems, basic test and measurement equipment, in-depth knowledge of electrical code and IEEE requirements, and in-depth knowledge of electronic principals is required. A high level of customer service skills is required as well as the ability to travel extensively. Essential Responsibilities: • Perform Startup/Commissioning on all SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL equipment across the entire SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL product line on single module and multi-module systems. • Perform Preventive Maintenance on all SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL equipment across the entire SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL product line on single module and multi-module systems. • Perform Unscheduled Maintenance on all SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL equipment across the entire SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL product line on single module and multi-module systems. • Perform basic Power Audits of customer’s distribution systems, working with Sales to complete Availability Assessments. • Document all required information for each site visit performed • Work with other team members to complete custom and large installation projects • Properly document, label, and return all defective parts utilized in the repair of SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL equipment to the designated disposal/repair location. • Educate SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL customers on basic operation of their equipment. Inform customers of issues which they may have experience with their equipment in a way which is beneficial to the customer as well as SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL • Assist SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT MISSION CRITICAL Service Partners in site visits, evaluating technical and professional performance. • Perform other duties as assigned Skills Required: • High level of technical knowledge of electronic/electrical component theory. • Must be able to perform duties with general direction, receiving only general guidance with respect to overall objectives. Work is usually quite independent of other team members • Must operate within division policy guidelines using independent judgment in achieving assigned objectives • Must comply with all safety policies, practices and procedures • Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business procedures, professional documents, technical procedures, and governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and customers. • Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of algebra and geometry. • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables • Proficient personal computer skills including electronic mail, record keeping, routine database activity, word processing, spreadsheets, graphics, etc. • Handle multiple tasks simultaneously • Must be able to stand, walk, and sit for extended periods of time. Must be agile and mobile with respect to finger, hand, arm and leg movement. • Must be able to communicate (speak and hear) effectively to various intellectual levels • Must be able to lift and carry heavy objects up to 50 pounds • Must be able to see and focus clearly up close as well as short distances. Education and Experience: • Associate degree in electronics/electrical with at least 1year of related experience, or have 4-5 years equivalent experience in a related field, or equivalent combinations of education and experience. • Prior experience as an electrician preferred • Prior High Power UPS experienced preferred

item.title: Refund Specialist - Hospital Central Business Office
item.description: Details: Description As a Refund Specialist, you will process billing refunds with the goal of account accuracy and customer satisfaction with every encounter. A successful Refund Specialist works to facilitate resolution of refunds through attention to detail, problem solving initiative and a dedication to efficient service for patients and insurance companies. Key Responsibilities Researches, audits and processes refunds to patients and insurance companies Answers customer questions regarding the refund and billing process Provides written response to insurance companies regarding documentation and billing information Reviews refund documentation for accuracy and completion Ensures compliance with applicable laws, HIPPA regulations and company policies Contributes to improvement of billing procedures and processes Escalates problem accounts to management as required by circumstances Completes assigned training and education Performs other duties as assigned

item.title: CALL CENTER SALES AGENT - GILBERT, AZ
item.description: Details: With more than 2,200 locations nationwide, Public Storage is the leader in the self-storage industry, and given our number of tenants, we may very well be the world's largest landlord. We've experienced unprecedented growth over the past four decades, and it's in no small part due to the dedicated team that has helped us become an S&P 500 industry leader, the country's largest real estate investment trust (REIT), and the most recognizable name in self-storage. Now is your chance to check out a career opportunity with America's self-storage leader. We are currently looking for Sales Agents (Full-Time) to join our team in Gilbert, Arizona . Sales Agent’s will be the first point of contact for our Customers. To be successful in this role, one must have excellent communication skills, be able to explain and sell the Company's products and services, handle Customer inquiries in a positive and professional manner, meet / exceed Call Quotas on a periodic basis and have the ability to work Full-Time shifts, which include evenings, weekends and holidays. New Sales Agents are provided a six-week training program in which our dedicated team of Training Professionals will provide one-on-one instruction, development and coaching. Sales Agents will begin at $13 per hour during training. Upon successful completion of training and meeting graduation criteria, pay will increase to $15 per hour. Employees will be eligible to participate in the call center bonus plan effective first day of employment. Bonus plan details will be provided during training. Position Responsibilities: Receive inbound calls from Customers and assess their storage needs. Locate available storage unit space appropriate to that given Customer. Use computer systems to obtain and relay information such as price, location and size. Make recommendations to Customers based on their storage needs, geography and unit availability. Book reservations. Provide exceptional customer service and professionalism to our Customers each and every day. Comply with all company policies, procedures, regulations and applicable law(s). Participate in on-going training, coaching and development programs / classes. Meet periodically with Peers and Supervisors regarding sales performance goals and metrics. Other duties as assigned.

item.title: OR Program Director
item.description: Details: ... Respecting and responding to the choices of people in need of supports. Dungarvin understands each person's need for autonomy and self-determination. Where barriers exist, we believe a responsive service provider must work creatively to change limiting environments and promote an individual's decision-making power. If you want to make a difference, join our team! Program Director We are currently searching for a Program Director to oversee the daily operations of various programs. In this position you will direct a team of professionals and skilled Direct Service Professionals providing residential, day program, and other supports to children and adults with developmental disabilities. Responsibilities: The Program Director is responsible for the overall daily operations of the program including supervision of staff, scheduling, financials, and payroll. Areas of responsibility include hiring, ensuring orientation and ongoing training, retention of high quality staff, and assurance that all aspects of the program are developed, implemented, coordinated, and monitored to the highest degree possible. Qualifications: Position requires experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities and autism. A bachelor's degree in the field of human services, psychology, education or related field is required and/or as determined by the Senior Director a combination of significant education, experience and abilities. Prior experience in developing and implementing individuals programs, budget implementation and in supervising others is desired. Must have good decision-making, time-management and communication skills. Top candidate will possess strength in administration, finance, DD programs, leadership, communication, and teamwork. Competitive compensation and excellent benefits package. ________________________________________________ Equal Opportunity Employer ________________________________________________ Our Mission: Respecting and responding to the choices of people with developmental disabilities. Dungarvin is a national organization of privately owned companies that are dedicated to providing high quality, community-based supports to people with developmental disabilities. Founded in St. Paul, Minnesota in 1975, Dungarvin has grown to serve approximately 2,125 people in 13 states. Dungarvin provides a variety of individually tailored services and supports under the Medicaid Home and Community Based Waiver. Additionally, Dungarvin provides services in several small homes licensed as Intermediate Care Facilities/Mental Retardation (ICF/MR). We also provide day services, supported employment, case management, supported foster care, children's services, respite care, and supports for traumatic brain injury services in several states. Dungarvin provides quality services that are flexible and responsive to individual needs and choices, while maintaining the fiscal integrity that ensures the long-term stability and security every person expects and deserves. Supporting people with developmental disabilities to achieve their fullest potential improves the quality of their life and that of the entire community. Our Philosophy: We believe each person has his or her own set of aspirations, goals, strengths, and dreams. We work closely with each person, and people close to the individual to discover and understand this unique combination. Utilizing our experience and expertise, we design and provide a constellation of services to support the person in achieving his or her life goals. Dungarvin understands each person's need for autonomy and self-determination. Where barriers exist, we believe a responsive service provider must work creatively to change limiting environments and promote the individual's decision-making power. We believe each person should be fully included in his or her community. Each person must have access to the community's resources and benefits, including the socially valued roles of being a citizen, neighbor, worker, and friend. Above all, we believe each person has a right to control his or her own life and destiny. All human beings, including people with developmental disabilities, have the same basic needs for physical comfort, security, a sense of belonging, love, and fulfillment. We will provide a unique combination of support, assistance, education, and encouragement that will enable the person to satisfy these needs and triumph in the fulfillment of his or her life goals. As a responsible service provider, we are committed to offering quality services that are flexible and responsive to the individuals we support. Dungarvin's fiscal soundness assures the long-term stability and security every person needs. Helping people with developmental disabilities achieve their full potential improves the entire community's quality of life. Dungarvin is proud to be a part of this enriching process. Read more at: www.dungarvin.com

item.title: Data Analyst
item.description: Details: Role: Compliance Project Analyst Assignment: Quality Operations Compliance and Accreditation Analyst Location: Miramar, FL Healthcare isn’t just about health anymore. It’s about caring for family, friends, finances, and personal life goals. It’s about living life fully. At Humana, we want to help people everywhere, including our associates, lead their best lives. We support our associates to be happier, healthier, and more productive in their professional and personal lives. We encourage our people to build relationships that inspire, support, and challenge them. We promote lifelong well-being by giving our associates fresh perspective, new insights, and exciting opportunities to grow their careers. At Humana, we’re seeking innovative people who want to make positive changes in their lives, the lives of our members, and the healthcare industry as a whole. Assignment Capsule Be a part of Compliance – Use your business knowledge to help analyze and develop policies, procedures and programs supporting our compliance initiatives? Humana is seeking a Compliance Project Analyst to provide research and analytical support to a team of associates during the design, development and implementation of Humana’s compliance programs. Analyze project requests, maintain timelines, determine requirements and feasibility, and document process workflow for all services. Interface with internal, external resources to ensure the successful completion of all projects. Prepare presentations and communication materials on behalf of the project team. Experience with medical claims data, data mining, developing and executing statistical studies. Key Competencies Accountability: Meets established expectations and takes responsibility for achieving results; encourages others to do the same. Builds Trust: Consistently models and inspires high levels of integrity, lives up to commitments, and takes responsibility for the impact of one's actions. Interpersonal Effectiveness : Understands oneself, effectively manages emotions, listens and communicates with respect, and builds trusting relationships. Pursues Excellence: Seeks out learning, strives to develop and expand personally, and continuously helps others upgrade their capability to contribute to Humana.

item.title: Associate Firstline Technician - Phoenix, AZ
item.description: Details: As an Associate Firstline Technician with Diebold Inc, you will provide Firstline maintenance for ATM's, maintenance on retail point of sale equipment, plus related PC and PC peripherals. Additionally, provide scheduled cleanings and other basic maintenance on conventional products such as locks, vaults, etc, and special projects, as needed. Perform basic installation and minor repairs on all Diebold products and services. This position may require the use of basic hand tools, limited parts and a basic understanding of PC, PC peripherals and network connectivity. Some essential functions of this position include: Basic trouble shooting to include: Prioritize and plan service calls Contact customer with the estimated time of arrival Escalate problems when appropriate Reassign calls when appropriate Accurately report service data Interact in a professional manner with customers to foster positive customer relations Follow key/alarm/combination control processes in assigned area of responsibility Support service technicians in performing preventative maintenance inspections on conventional products Maintain effective communication with Business Management Team and Service Technician Team members Provide 'First Line Maintenance' on ATM's and retail products and devices to include: On-site diagnosis of problem Other technical fixes such as clearing paper jams, card jams, bill jams, etc Perform some minor maintenance on ATM's (e.g. replacing light bulbs, card reader belts, air filters, etc.) Develop working knowledge of all operating standards, practices, and procedures Complete equipment cleanings as specified by Diebold contracts Perform basic installation functions (e.g. pulling cable, mounting devices, installing Mas-Hamilton locks)

item.title: Fleet Maintenance Manager
item.description: Details: Fleet Maintenance Manager Ted Hosmer Enterprises Rochester, New York Visit our web site at www.tedhosmer.com Opportunity: We are looking for an experienced Fleet Maintenance Manager to join our team. Are you a self-starter with a strong work ethic? Do you have a passion for leading and directing team members while being committed to excellent service? We offer a solid compensation package including great pay, bonus, medical insurance, 401k, and the best part – a great place to work and a great team to work with. At Ted Hosmer Enterprises we provide year round property maintenance and landscape services to both commercial and residential customers. We proudly serve the Upstate New York area – and have been serving this area for over 25 years. We are locally owned and committed to quality service and environmental stewardship. You will be responsible for managing the activities of employees who repair and maintain our fleet vehicles, trucks, heavy equipment, lawn and landscape equipment and trailers. We are a growing company – looking for a ‘hands on’ Fleet Maintenance Manager to be a key part of that growth. Your responsibilities include (but are not limited to): Supervision of 4-6 employees who handle the repairs to auto bodywork and other mechanical equipment Maintain detailed records on equipment repairs and maintenance schedules Monitor service issues while maximizing time, productivity and performance Oversee the fabrication of pieces of equipment using various welding and assembly procedures. ​ Plan, schedule and assign work on a daily basis. ​ Ensure compliance with established safety standards and other operating policies and procedures. ​ Train employees on the repair of heavy equipment. ​ Demo nstrate proper techniques and safety regulations. ​ Maintain a parts room and order parts and supplies as necessary. ​ Maintain a clean and orderly facility May perform other duties as required. ​

item.title: Truck Driver - CDL Class A/Touch Freight - Penske Logistics
item.description: Details: Description Position Summary: Penske Logistics is looking for qualified CDL A truck drivers to become part of an excellent team. This is a great opportunity to continue your career with one of the nation’s largest logistics companies. This is a touch Freight position Route/Activity – Drivers are responsible for delivering product to customers Complete vendor backhauls as directed. You will average 2 1/2 stops per day, 260 miles a day, , You will be delivering product to CVS Stores in the area. Shift – All shifts. Monday - Saturday. Equipment – 48’ & 53’ Liftgate Dry Vans Compensation – Activity Base Pay Benefits - Penske values the well-being of our employees and their families. That’s why we offer competitive wages and a wide range of benefits, including medical and dental insurance, 401K and pension plans, flexible dependent care and medical spending accounts, spouse and child life insurance, employee referral bonus, and discounts with Penske partners. Responsibilities: -Loading, unloading, or assisting in loading and unloading truck. -Maintain driver logs according to I.C.C regulations. -Compliance with safety & DOT Regulations, continuous training and customer service. -Ensuring compliance with applicable federal and/or state laws, regulations, and/or agency rules, standards and guidelines. -Report vehicle defects, accidents, traffic violations, or damage to the vehicles before and after route. Qualifications -At least 23 years of age required -CDL Class A required -2 years of verifiable tractor-trailer driving experience in the last 5 years required -2 years DMV/MVR record with 2 or less moving violations -High School Diploma or equivalent required -Driving school and or safety certifications preferred -Dealing with people skills, reliable and customer oriented, and ability to work independently required -Ability to work in non-climate controlled environments required -Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening -The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The associate must regularly lift and /or move up to 25lbs/12kg, frequently lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this Job, the associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. Headquartered in Reading, Pa., Penske Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Penske Truck Leasing. With operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia, Penske Logistics provides supply chain management and logistics services to leading companies throughout the world. Penske Logistics delivers value through design, planning and execution in transportation, warehousing, international freight forwarding and carrier management. Visit www.PenskeLogistics.com to learn more. Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Part Time NABISCO Merchandiser - St. Louis MO
item.description: Details: Mondelēz International’s portfolio includes several billion-dollar brands such as Nabisco, Oreo and LU biscuits, Cadbury and Milka chocolate, Jacobs coffee, Tang powdered beverages and Trident gums. Mondelēz International has annual revenue of approximately $36 billion and operations in more than 80 countries. For more information, visit www.mondelezinternational.com and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational . Primary Role: The Mondelēz Global Sales Service Representative role is designed to build a world class Direct Store Delivery (DSD) business at the retail level by fulfilling the merchandising needs of the customer. The Representative is responsible primarily, though not exclusively, for merchandising Nabisco brands. Areas of focus will include full shelf conditions, neatly merchandised displays and shelves, building display point of sale in all areas of store, properly rotated product, and accurate price tags / point of sale in all departments. A major objective of this role is to establish and maintain rapport with key store individuals while providing outstanding customer service. This role will be responsible for maintaining a timely and accurate call schedule. Further, this role will be responsible for identifying and communicating individual store problems and opportunities to the appropriate Mondelēz Global personnel.

item.title: RN Case Manager (FT/Days)
item.description: Details: Responsible for coordinating and assuring optimum care delivery to an identified patient caseload. Identifies physical and psychological factors that could potentially increase the patient s morbidity/mortality. Monitors resource consumption and evaluates cost/benefit to assure effective and efficient utilization of hospital resources. Promotes and provides for optimum patient outcomes through use of Case Management concepts. Utilizes community resources to facilitate meeting the demands of the patient/family or significant other. Participates in the coordination of the development of the Clinical Case Management program.
