item.title: Cerner Patient Accounting Analyst
item.description: Details: AHS Information Services (AHS-IS) is a 600+ person department of Adventist Health System. AHS-IS maintains clinical and business systems dedicated to providing a secure, effective, integrated patient care delivery system that continually improves outcomes, reduces costs, increases efficiency and enhances patients’ experiences. AHS-IS provides technology systems and services for 32 of Adventist Health System’s 45 campuses, supporting caregivers at those facilities in extending the healing ministry of Christ to patients. This position is responsible for the analysis, planning, implementation, evaluation, and support of software applications and initiatives to support hospital and AHS strategic goals. They act as leader on simple to medium projects as assigned. They develop information technology expertise and application knowledge and translate that expertise into solutions for customers. They work with application software users to identify opportunities for improvement and solutions to business problems using automation. In cooperation with users, they develop test plans, and perform application tests to ensure accuracy, integrity, inter-operability and completeness to achieve desired results. They may also prepare and conduct training for end users.

item.title: ERP IT Senior Finance/Supply Chain Developer
item.description: Details: The Senior PeopleSoft Developer will support financial and supply chain applications running in an Oracle RDBMS, Linux, and Windows environment. The developer is responsible for full system life cycle support of PeopleSoft FSCM modules including system analysis, programming, testing, and production support. A successful candidate should be able to work with functional business analysts, business process owners and other technical team members for a given requirement or process. This includes taking part of the process design, propose a solution, soliciting feedback and documenting the information associated with any enhancement. This person will also work with the PeopleSoft SAs/DBAs on performance tuning, enhancements, maintenance patches, and production support. Responsibilities: • Develop, test and support high quality software solutions using PeopleTools and related technologies. • Work as an individual contributor while mentoring other developers and application analysts. • Able to write maintainable application code which effectively and efficiently implements business requirements. • Identify problems and/or potential issues and formulate systemic solutions or propose business process alternatives to meet business requirements. • Understands system and industry security and controls requirements (COBIT v5). Works with functional team, security team, and internal audit to ensure system security and data integrity. • Author and peer review software requirements specifications, design and other technical documentation. • Provide appropriate documentation of application customizations, issues, and fixes for support and maintenance. • Follows department standard methodology and procedures, including change control. • Manage communication to customers on assigned tickets, track issues, ensure their timely resolution, and manage expectations. Assists in prioritization of functional requests. • Provides off-hours support as needed. • Coordinates and/or participates in application releases and upgrades. • Participates in conversions and deployment of systems/modules, supporting functional and technical teams. • All other duties as required or requested.

item.title: Help Desk Technician Level 1
item.description: Details: Job Summary The Level 1 Help Desk Technician is responsible for resolving incoming telephone requests for technical assistance on standard commercial and proprietary applications. Consistent customer care, quality standards, and reporting requirements are core competencies of the position. Ability to quickly adapt to changing priorities and fluctuations in workflow are requirements of the Help Desk Technician role. All Help Desk Technicians are subject to shift changes to adapt to the business needs of the Help Desk. SHIFT - Help Desk hours of operations vary by team with most open from 7am - 12am Mon - Fri and various weekend hours. Shift flexibility is requested. Principal Responsibilities: (Essential Function) Shift Schedules • Adhere strictly to shift schedule. Timeliness a key requirement. • Flexibility to changes in shift schedules, as dictated by Management, is required Call Handling • Provide comprehensive technical support services to support center customers • Work within Service Level Agreements, including but not limited to Average Speed of Answer, Average Talk Time, Abandon Time, Hold Times, etc. • Take all steps to troubleshoot issues reported to them and resolve or escalate to the appropriate contact. • Use all available Knowledge Management Tool during the call • Take all necessary steps to ensure customer satisfaction at the end of the call Call Logging • Create and submit detailed call logs documenting customer interactions. Accuracy, thoroughness, and timeliness are key call logging components • Confirm and update customer profile information as needed Escalation • Promptly notify management of any potentially “dissatisfied” customers • Follow all documented escalation procedures, including hand off times, for issues requiring 3rd party intervention Open Calls • Follow all documented procedures to handle open calls, including monitoring open call queues, placing follow up phone calls, etc. Knowledge • Proactively seek and possess business acumen for all clients supported • Maintain technical proficiency in all applications utilized by clients supported • Participate in all company organized training events • Contribute current technical information and best practices concerning proprietary applications to the C3i Reference Library or other knowledge distribution channel • Organize and utilize all support resources provided including emails, documentation, contact lists, etc. Other tasks • Perform customer support related tasks and special projects as assigned by management • Liaise as necessary interdepartmentally to seek resolutions to all issues reported • Participate in client events, as appropriate (resource on site, client training, etc.) • . Job Requirements Skills • Excellent verbal and written communication skills • Customer Service Skills • Microsoft Office Suite, Windows Operating Systems, Lotus Notes, and Internet applications • Problem solving skills, organizational skills, and the ability to exercise sound judgment in any customer service scenario Education • BA or Vocational school degree preferred or equivalent work experience • Microsoft Certified Professional certification a plus Experience • Minimum of 6-12 months of previous call center, computer support, or customer service experience preferred Working Relationships Maintain inter-department relationships to resolve client issues Effectively communicate with both internal and external clients Develop communication and working relationship with Supervisor Competencies Adaptability Analysis Customer Service Orientation Functional Job Knowledge Initiative Judgment/Decisiveness Managing Stress Negotiation Oral Communication Persuasiveness/Influence Planning and Organizing Technical and Professional Competence Work Standards Written We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace.

item.title: CLINICAL LEADER 3 SOUTH FT NIGHTS
item.description: Details: Performs the following duties of a Clinical Leader in the assigned Nursing Department. Assists with the general clinical supervision, assigns admissions, and transfers received on the shift, monitors and evaluates the staffing needs of the assigned shift and the following shift. Perform the duties of a Registered Nurse in the delivery of safe, therapeutic and cost effective nursing care on the assigned unit. Uses the standard nursing process of assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation for the following age specific patient population: geriatrics, adult, adolescent and pediatric. Promotes an effective team environment of collaborative healthcare givers providing cost effective, quality nursing care to the patients of Florida Hospital Fish Memorial. Demonstrates the skills of clinical and technical competence, critical thinking component for problem solving and priority setting, use of effective communication skills for conflict and confrontation management and human relationship competencies for team leading and building. Exemplifies the five leadership practices of the nursing department: Challenge the Process, Inspire a Shared Vision, Enable Others to Act, Model the Way, and Encourage the Heart. Effective use, support and supervision of the FHFM Superior Service Standards in the clinical and hospital setting. Responsibilities include the assurance that the supervisor and their staff adhere to the Florida Hospital Fish Memorial Corporate Compliance Plan, to the rules and regulations of all local, state and federal agencies and to the standards of all accred iting bodies. Is a graduate of an approved school nursing. Current registration with the Florida Board of Examiners. Must maintain a current Basic Life Support (BLS) card. Must maintain a current Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) card for the Intensive Care Units. Must have a minimum of two years of experience in the assigned nursing units with an additional two years of charge nurse experience.

item.title: HR Generalist / Recruiter
item.description: Details: 1. Proactively source candidates using internet resources, social media, employee referrals, direct-sourcing techniques and other creative methods. 2. Manage the recruiting process through sourcing, screening, and selection. Responsible and accountable for filling assigned positions with qualified candidates and within target timeframes 3. Maintain high level of customer service and add value to Scholastic Book Fairs’ services by advising and partnering in the decision making process as the subject matter expert (SME) for the entire hiring process 4. Provide hiring managers with dedicated expertise to assist them in identifying sourcing channels, assessing, evaluating and hiring people internally and externally utilizing intuition, interpersonal and sales skills, as well as managing the recruiting process to conform to corporate guidelines 5. Work closely with management and other Scholastic Book Fairs employees to identify their specific client (personnel) needs for their department (regular, temporary, and/or contract positions), job specifications, job duties, qualifications and skills 6. Advise on most appropriate recruiting solutions. Ensure that all open positions are posted internally and ensure that internal interview process is followed 7. Manage the overall staffing process for managers and candidates; source qualified applicants; review resumes, screen and interview candidates for specific job openings, and refers qualified candidates to hiring managers for interviews. Ensure that all candidates (both internally and externally) follow the recruiting and hiring process and that the employee referral process is followed accurately. Coordinate travel itineraries with out-of-town candidates, as needed 8. Conduct thorough reference checks for each individual considered for a position within Scholastic Book Fairs 9. Manage relationships with Hiring Managers as within the organization. Confer with Hiring Manager on the candidates interviewed, and as a collective team effort, determine appropriate candidate to extend an offer to 10. Leverage diversity recruiting strategies with other company-wide diversity activities 11. Manage 3rd party recruiting vendors and resources to ensure optimal quality candidate flow from a variety of sources 12. Maintain Tracking Logs for job openings and candidate-records 13. Understand work eligibility concepts and engage appropriate legal and HR partners as needed 14. Create and analyze staffing metrics/measurements and recommend improvement opportunities #LI-CC1 15. Ensure Applicant Tracking System is updated with quality data to comply with OFCCP regulations 16. Coordinate and arrange for initial orientation of newly hired employees 17. Maintain confidentiality relative to company programs, activities, records, lists, financial information, drug testing results, and personnel records 18. Other duties and projects as assigned

item.title: Immediate Packing Positions in Jefferson City
item.description: Details: AccuForce Staffing Services in Morristown, TN is currently recruiting for Immediate Packing Positions in Jefferson City. *Must have ability to stand 8-10 hours *Must have good hand/eye coordination *Must have good attendance To apply for these positions, please complete our online application at www.AccuForce.com and go to the Job Search tab. Once application has been submitted, the next phase of our screening process will be a phone interview, so please list the best number for you to be reached.

item.title: Project Manager
item.description: Details: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES The Project Manager is accountable for managing moderate size and complexity project orders (customer, affiliate, recall, etc), from start to finish, so that it is completed on time and within budget. This includes initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing of customer projects. Individual in this position confirms customer requirements, which includes drawings, specifications, job site requirements, bill of material alignment with specifications & clarify exceptions. Manages complete project process from order preparation, thru manufacturing release, product shipment, post shipment support and financial reconciliation utilizing a base knowledge of Schneider Electric products and their use. Documentation, communication, and customer facing skills are critical to this position 1. Ensure all Schneider Electric safety policies and requirements are met at any onsite project locations. 2. When requested, provide upfront sales support during project quotation and preparation phase to ensure specification compliance from an execution standpoint. 3. Takes ownership for validating the project’s statement of work and contract terms with the customer, including both technical and commercial elements, becomes lead contact for customer for balance of project order. (Project Initiation). 4. Develops a project schedule and communicates with the customer to ensure expectations are being met. Direct engagement wit internal manufacturing facilities and third party vendors. (Project Planning). 5. Monitor the execution of the customer’s project order, verifying execution of the project through kick-off meetings, communication to all parties and exchange of technical requirements and project plan information. Coordination of all Schneider Electric onsite activities including subcontracting. (Project Executive) 6. Lead the monitor and control of the performance of the customer’s project through its lifecycle. Key activities include task completion verification, project team monitoring, managing the exchange of project updates across the project team members, schedule reporting, issue resolution, and contract administration. (Monitor and Control Project Work) 7. Lead the closeout of the customer’s project to include financial reconciliation, verification of job site equipment arrival, installation, start-up, and training support completion through review of internal system information, contact with the customer, and coordination with support services such as field services, after-shipment support, and training functions. (Project Close) 8. Compares/differentiates/propose alternate products/ value engineering 9. Solves problems with customer interaction that results in positive feedback and improved relationship. 10. Utilizes a base knowledge of Schneider Electric products and their use and demonstrates an understanding of the fundamental knowledge, processes and terminology needed for effective project management. 11. Ensure each project is executed to meet or exceed the customer’s requirements while also ensuring the project is executed within the financial boundaries of cost and margin. 12. Communicate project risk (technical & financial) and mitigation plans once an issue is identified. Accurately predict the financial performance for revenue recognition to SLM to include original forecast, change orders and for cost forecasts based on incurred costs, and estimate to complete 13. Utilize and offer improvements to the Project execution teams standard process, documentation and tools.

item.title: Commercial Bkg Rel Manager - Cape Girardeau MO / (FT 40 hrs)
item.description: Details: Manages relationships with Commercial Banking, Corporate Banking, or Community Banking commercial customers. Grows revenue as directed by senior management by successfully prospecting for new business and retaining and expanding existing customer relationships. Approves loans within assigned limits, manages loan and portfolio credit quality, sources prospects and develops new customer relationships. Provides financial advice to customers and sells appropriate bank products and services to those prospects and clients. Identifies and successfully capitalizes on cross-sell opportunities and makes appropriate referrals. Your Career is Here.

item.title: Entry Level Production Worker
item.description: Details: A Local Logistics firm is seeking entry level production workers. Our mission is to be a global service provider that is customer driven, responsive, flexible, and cost effective, accomplishing this vision through employee pride and commitment. Job Duties: Operates material handling equipment as required to receive, store, and ship material. Performs receiving and shipping inspections and identifies all incoming and outgoing material shipments to determine: a) quantity is as ordered b) no damage is apparent, and c) documentation is available as required. Performs physical material inventories to establish, maintain, and document the receipt, shipment and control. Loads material into packaged, bulk tanks, bulk containers, and railcars. Unloads pallet trucks, supplies, and raw materials on plant site. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed in this position; they are only the major duties. Benefits Offered: We offer competitive wages with a salary review at 90 days, 6 months and annually. Other benefits include: BlueCross and BlueShield Medical Dental Vision Life Insurance 401K/Profit Sharing Vacation pay Steel Toe Boot reimbursement

item.title: Sales Engineer- Glenwood Springs
item.description: Details: Contech Engineered Solutions is a leading civil engineering site solutions products and services company. Headquartered in West Chester, Ohio, Contech is the only company that can provide bridge, drainage, erosion control and stabilization, retaining wall, sanitary, stormwater and wastewater treatment solutions on a national scale. Contech oversees the activities of more than 100 sales offices, 40 manufacturing facilities and hundreds of sales and technical support specialists. Location: Glenwood Springs Contech Engineered Solutions is seeking a Technical Sales Engineer to support our Colorado market. The Sales Engineer will promote and sell Contech’s products to recognized or potential customers and dealers in an assigned geographic territory. As technical experts on Contech's full line of products, the Sales Engineer will work closely with engineering consultants, contractors and government officials providing engineering expertise and problem-solving advice. Primary Responsibilities: Works as a collaborative member of our sales team to sell company products. Conducts sales presentations and educational seminars. Obtains favorable specifications for our products Manages sales with and through distribution and developing quotes & orders. Provides sales support for multiple projects. Consistently follow up on projects. Provides project support for submittals, production and product delivery during construction. Maintains engineering processes and procedures. Identifies and develops territory potential. With minimal supervision, plans and organizes territory coverage and sales approach to assure most effective development of assigned sales territory in order to meet or exceed established objectives. Develops and maintains statistical data on competitors' products, quality, sales, pricing, production facilities, limitations and marketing procedures. Using established guidelines, negotiates terms and conditions of sales contracts involving sales price, discounts, freight, delivery, rejected or excess material disposition, etc., to assure a profit and a high level of customer satisfaction. Gathers necessary information for determination of credit worthiness by Headquarters. Monitors transactions through completion, including collections, in consultation with inside sales, and assists in resolving any discrepancies or making any changes during the course of the transaction. Investigates customer complaints and claims through on-site visits when appropriate to determine merit and proper action, recommends adjustments or allowances, and advises customer of final disposition. Communicates commercial policies and practices to customers as necessary to assist them or to resolve any problem incident to the sale of Contech products. Contacts established and prospective customers in assigned sales territory to provide close personal service; seeks out and develops new accounts and product applications, and increases market share. Develops information on competitive price situations; verifies and analyzes quotations as to Contech’s ability to meet customer proposals and makes recommendations. Interfaces with customer representatives to ascertain project requirements and provide any necessary technical assistance or service. Gathers pertinent project information, and provides explanations and direction to customer on products and applications. Performs plan takeoffs in conjunction with quotations and orders, prepares quotations, develops shipping schedules, writes and submits orders to Regional Office and/or plants. Maintains contact with plants to coordinate production, inventory, shipping and delivery matters. Continually improves product knowledge through familiarization with all product literature, design specifications, field and laboratory test results, and hands-on experience in the field and manufacturing plants. Other duties as assigned.

Continually improves product knowledge through familiarization with all product literature, design specifications, field and laboratory test results, and hands-on experience in the field and manufacturing plants. Other duties as assigned. .

item.title: Sales Engineer- Grand Junction
item.description: Details: Contech Engineered Solutions is a leading civil engineering site solutions products and services company. Headquartered in West Chester, Ohio, Contech is the only company that can provide bridge, drainage, erosion control and stabilization, retaining wall, sanitary, stormwater and wastewater treatment solutions on a national scale. Contech oversees the activities of more than 100 sales offices, 40 manufacturing facilities and hundreds of sales and technical support specialists. Location: Grand Junction Contech Engineered Solutions is seeking a Technical Sales Engineer to support our Colorado market. The Sales Engineer will promote and sell Contech’s products to recognized or potential customers and dealers in an assigned geographic territory. As technical experts on Contech's full line of products, the Sales Engineer will work closely with engineering consultants, contractors and government officials providing engineering expertise and problem-solving advice. Primary Responsibilities: Works as a collaborative member of our sales team to sell company products. Conducts sales presentations and educational seminars. Obtains favorable specifications for our products Manages sales with and through distribution and developing quotes & orders. Provides sales support for multiple projects. Consistently follow up on projects. Provides project support for submittals, production and product delivery during construction. Maintains engineering processes and procedures. Identifies and develops territory potential. With minimal supervision, plans and organizes territory coverage and sales approach to assure most effective development of assigned sales territory in order to meet or exceed established objectives. Develops and maintains statistical data on competitors' products, quality, sales, pricing, production facilities, limitations and marketing procedures. Using established guidelines, negotiates terms and conditions of sales contracts involving sales price, discounts, freight, delivery, rejected or excess material disposition, etc., to assure a profit and a high level of customer satisfaction. Gathers necessary information for determination of credit worthiness by Headquarters. Monitors transactions through completion, including collections, in consultation with inside sales, and assists in resolving any discrepancies or making any changes during the course of the transaction. Investigates customer complaints and claims through on-site visits when appropriate to determine merit and proper action, recommends adjustments or allowances, and advises customer of final disposition. Communicates commercial policies and practices to customers as necessary to assist them or to resolve any problem incident to the sale of Contech products. Contacts established and prospective customers in assigned sales territory to provide close personal service; seeks out and develops new accounts and product applications, and increases market share. Develops information on competitive price situations; verifies and analyzes quotations as to Contech’s ability to meet customer proposals and makes recommendations. Interfaces with customer representatives to ascertain project requirements and provide any necessary technical assistance or service. Gathers pertinent project information, and provides explanations and direction to customer on products and applications. Performs plan takeoffs in conjunction with quotations and orders, prepares quotations, develops shipping schedules, writes and submits orders to Regional Office and/or plants. Maintains contact with plants to coordinate production, inventory, shipping and delivery matters. Continually improves product knowledge through familiarization with all product literature, design specifications, field and laboratory test results, and hands-on experience in the field and manufacturing plants. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications : BS or MS in Civil or related engineering field; or its demonstrated equivalent, expertise gained through training and knowledge of Contech products and their use. EIT or PE certification preferred but not required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 1 to 2 years experience in site civil projects. Ability to prepare and review standard engineering documentation. Broad engineering knowledge and extensive knowledge of the construction industry with thorough business knowledge in marketing and sales. High level leadership, negotiating and communications skills. Ability to accomplish results through others. Computer proficiency (Microsoft Office, CRM software, basic CAD) Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to travel 50% of the time Valid driver’s license. Contech is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and participates in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, protected veteran status, or status as an individual with a disability. Click here to view information regarding your Equal Employment Opportunity rights and protections: EEO is the Law . If you are unable to apply online due to a disability, contact the Contech Recruiting team at (513) 645-7000 .

item.title: Senior Finance & Budget Analyst
item.description: Details: CRSO Sr Budget and Finance Analyst

item.title: Assistant Property Manager
item.description: Details: Company Overview Cushman & Wakefield is the world’s largest privately‐held commercial real estate services firm. Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Cushman & Wakefield is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, and as such, we hire the most talented professionals and invest in superior resources and technologies. The talent of our extraordinary people and the culture and business approach we foster, coupled with the exceptional, creative services we provide and the results we deliver worldwide for owners, occupiers, and investors are what distinguishes Cushman & Wakefield. Assistant Property Manager – Oakland, CA Job Summary The Assistant Property Manager reports to the General Manager. The Assistant Property Manager is familiar with all aspects pertaining to the daily operation of the assigned property and supports the General Manager in establishing favorable tenant relations, maintaining the property in a first-class manner, carrying out all administrative duties, and quickly responding to tenant requests. The Assistant Property Manager may be called upon to direct all activities at the assigned property in the absence of the General Manager. Principal Responsibilities I. Administration • Draft correspondence to and from owners, tenants, vendors and management. • Assist Property Manager and/or General Manager in the administration of all leases. Respond to and coordinate tenant service requests and inquiries regarding operation of the building. • Maintain orderly property files, including tenant, vendor, insurance, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and property files. • Assure collection of all rent on the first of the month. Generate aging reports and provide updates and follow up on outstanding A/R, advising Property Manager and/or General Manager of collection problems. Assess late fees on collections received after the tenth of the month after consulting with Property Manager. • Create and update Lease Abstracts for each tenant. • Coordinate all deliveries and move-ins/move-outs. • Process all tenant requests for special work. Obtain estimate, provide proposal, order work, and invoice tenant for such work. Coordinate with Engineering department where necessary. • Maintain work order system. • Update and maintain all Property Information Books. • Update, track and maintain Certificate of Insurance lists for tenants and vendors. Request new or renewed certificates as required. • Update, track and maintain Property Contact Information Sheets. • Establish and maintain “Critical Dates” report which lists all tenant anniversaries, lease expirations, options, rent increase dates, etc. II. Financial • Assist with preparation of annual operating budgets. Provide contractor bids for budgeted work, contract services, etc. Complete data entry of budget information under Property Manager and/or General Manager’s direction. • Prepare monthly financial reports. Generate supporting documentation from the accounting system, provide status updates on pending projects and provide administrative support in the compilation of the finished product. Perform variance analysis and complete executive summary. • Prepare annual operating expense reconciliations. • Participate in the processing of all accounts payable. Generate purchase orders per company policies. Match invoices to PO’s, and complete invoice data entry. Oversee data entry function for certain properties in the case where data entry is performed by others. • Responsible for calculating and processing tenant bill-back for submetered utility consumption. • Review Pre-Posting Report for accuracy prior to posting of rents to tenant accounts. Generate and review rent statements and sundry billings, and ensure delivery of accurate rent statements on or around the 22nd of every month. III. Tenant Relations • Visit with primary tenant contacts and provide ongoing communication to create and maintain favorable relations between tenants and management. Maintain tenant relations log. • Responsible for day-to-day tenant calls. Follow through to 100% completion on all tenant requests. Coordinate all tenant events. • Coordinate Fire/Life Safety Procedures training for tenants. • Coordinate move-in of tenants. Provide Welcome Package, keys, coordinate move. Arrange for welcome gift. IV. Building Operations • Be familiar with the terms and specifications of all building service contracts. Continuously monitor the performance of vendors and service contactors and conduct regular meetings with contractors to ensure optimum performance. • Conduct regular inspections of the property. • Periodically review service contracts and prepare and administer all bids for services. • Relay complaints, problems, special cleaning projects, etc. to Janitorial Foreman; follow up to ensure task completion. • Conduct and document periodic inspections with Janitorial Supervisor. Ensure that the property is being maintained in a Class-A manner. • Issue keys, card keys, parking access cards, etc., utilizing building-specific software program. • Maintain dialogue with Engineering department to ensure that all service requests are addressed in a timely manner. • Follow through on repairs and installations to 100% completion with little to no supervision. • Direct Engineers in the completion of building maintenance. Set priorities for the staff and report to General Manager on progress. V. Tenant/Building Improvement Supervision • Coordinate tenant improvement work and building alterations as directed by Senior Property Manager. • Coordinate access to building for contractors. Attend construction meetings as directed by Property Manager. Notify tenants in advance of any construction activity that will impact building operations or the tenants’ conduct of business. Qualifications Associate or Bachelors Degree plus minimum three years’ experience in real estate management required. RPA designation or coursework desired. Real estate salespersons license required. Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and any specific software as required. Proficiency in MRI preferable. Required Skills Exceptional organizational skills; able to balance multiple priorities and projects, keeping all team members informed of progress and issues. Ability to work in team environment as well as work independently when required. Ability to communicate well and interact with all colleagues, clients and tenants. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

item.title: Data & Reporting Analyst
item.description: Details: Company Overview Cushman & Wakefield is the world’s largest privately‐held commercial real estate services firm. Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Cushman & Wakefield is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, and as such, we hire the most talented professionals and invest in superior resources and technologies. The talent of our extraordinary people and the culture and business approach we foster, coupled with the exceptional, creative services we provide and the results we deliver worldwide for owners, occupiers, and investors are what distinguishes Cushman & Wakefield. Job Title: Data & Reporting Analyst - San Francisco, CA PURPOSE OF THE JOB Provide data and reporting analytical expertise to support project management. Produce status, dashboards, and trending report based active and forecasted projects. Perform proactive analysis and benchmarking. Complete monthly data analysis comparisons, reconciliations, and reporting between several data sources for variances and exceptions. PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES • Provide analytical support and leadership for the project management team with project reporting, benchmarks, budget and scheduled controls, and data intelligence. • Support development of strategies to increase efficiency, maintain quality, minimize risk, and add value • Deliver high quality, action-oriented, compelling analysis intended to transform project management techniques • Prepare project reporting such as cash flow forecasting, project status, budget reconciliations, schedule variance, data accuracy, and KPI • Build automation routines to support continuous improvement and efficiency in reporting. • Develop techniques to gather data attribute from multiples sources into a singular data warehouse. • Benchmarking analysis leveraging internal data from C&W and other accounts • Leverage industry research and analysis to give insight into industry trends and cost benchmarks • Support sourcing teams to identify action items for cost savings and supplier management • Deliver high value data interpretation and predictive analysis • Lead responses to patterns, turn data into information, information into action and action into value. • Maintain various data sources and dashboards KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, and/or Statistics • Technical skills in SAP, Excel, Access and other relational databases • Detail oriented with strong logical reasoning and critical thinking / analysis skills • Effective communicator with senior levels of management • Self-motivated and can work independently to find solutions • Ability to build customer relationships at all levels • Ability to handle a large volume of work at once • Knowledge of Commercial Real Estate industry desired • Experience with Earned Value Management and Primavera P6 a plus PHYSICAL CONDITIONS While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to travel from floor to floor and may be required to travel outside between buildings in varying outdoor weather conditions. The employee may also be regularly required to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time; regularly use hands to operate office machinery including, but not limited to, telephones, computers, fax, and photocopy machines; regularly required to walk, talk, and hear. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

item.title: Associate Facilities Manager
item.description: Details: Company Overview Cushman & Wakefield is the world’s largest privately-held commercial real estate services firm. Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Cushman & Wakefield is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, and as such, we hire the most talented professionals and invest in superior resources and technologies. The talent of our extraordinary people and the culture and business approach we foster, coupled with the exceptional, creative services we provide and the results we deliver worldwide for owners, occupiers, and investors are what distinguishes Cushman & Wakefield. Job Title: Associate Facilities Manager Job Summary: Under the supervision of the Portfolio Manager, the Associate Facilities Manager provides day-to-day coordination and supervision of the onsite service staff and contract services, fulfilling the needs and addressing the issues of the client within a leased facility. Primary responsibilities include ensuring client facilities, equipment, offices/rooms, and systems are maintained, cleaned, repaired, and serviced in accordance with client standards and requirements. The Associate Facilities Manager is expected to develop and maintain a strong working relationship with the client and property management team and be accountable for ensuring issues and needs are responded to and resolved by the appropriate individual, department, or service. Duties & Responsibilities: •Acts as the first point of contact for client service calls, work requests and issues. Directs client service requests to the appropriate staff or contract service for resolution including engineering, maintenance, cleaning, or security. •Responsible for the cost-effective management of service contracts. Responsible for all aspects of service delivery pursuant to these contracts, and for periodic and ongoing performance and financial review, and for conducting RFP’s. Assure payments and invoicing match contract pricing. •Proactively inspects the facility, including client work spaces, meeting rooms, IT & Telecommunication closets, restrooms, lobbies, common areas, etc. and reports back any findings or issues to the appropriate individual, department or service for resolution. •Handles tenant move-ins and move outs and updates floor plans. Assists with the coordination of tenant events and orients new tenants on building policies and procedures. •Assists property management with day-to-day operation of the property in accordance with building policies/procedures, management agreements, and client needs. Responsible for obtaining and filing vendor insurance certificates, maintaining client emergency contact lists, issuing and updating building access requests and badges, conducting fire drills and indoor air quality investigations. •Supports the implementation and management of all maintenance programs and capital work relating to the interior work space occupied by the client. •Compiles information necessary to ensure all site-specific documentation and reports are completed accurately and on time, including (and as applicable): Property Information Book, Site Operating Manual, Emergency Procedures Manual, Local Code Compliance Log, ADA Compliance Log, OSHA Log, Elevator Logs, Janitorial Log, Purchase Order Log, Vendor Certificates of Insurance, As-built Drawings, Paid Invoices File, General Files, Contract Files, Annual Property Conditions and Year-end Performance Report, and other reports and documentation as required. • Prepares operating budgets, monthly financial variance reports, Goods & Services Contracts, and funding authorizations. Does coding and processing of invoices and data entry into YARDI accounting system. Produces purchase orders in YARDI for contract materials and services. Assists in providing information and reports necessary for the development of capital budgets for the facility. Requirements: Four year college degree; CPM and/or RPA candidate preferred. • A minimum of 5 years working in commercial or industrial real estate with facility management experience preferred. • Working knowledge and experience in financial accounting in commercial real estate, financial reporting, and budgeting is necessary. • Experience in maintenance, construction, engineering and all facets of property operation and building management is preferred. Ability to read and understand construction specifications and blueprints is needed. • Ability to work independently and to plan, organize and coordinate multiple projects. • Strong literacy in MS Word and Excel. • Highly organized and skilled with time management. • Excellent written and oral communication skills. • Strong customer service skills required. Physical Conditions While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to travel from floor to floor and may be required to travel outside between buildings in varying outdoor weather conditions. The employee may also be regularly required to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time; regularly required to walk, talk, and hear. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Generate and review rent statements and sundry billings, and ensure delivery of accurate rent statements on or around the 22nd of every month. III. Tenant Relations • Visit with primary tenant contacts and provide ongoing communication to create and maintain favorable relations between tenants and management. Maintain tenant relations log. • Responsible for day-to-day tenant calls. Follow through to 100% completion on all tenant requests. Coordinate all tenant events. • Coordinate Fire/Life Safety Procedures training for tenants. • Coordinate move-in of tenants. Provide Welcome Package, keys, coordinate move. Arrange for welcome gift. • Coordinate deliveries and manage the loading dock schedule. IV. Building Operations • Be familiar with the terms and specifications of all building service contracts. Continuously monitor the performance of vendors and service contactors and conduct regular meetings with contractors to ensure optimum performance. • Conduct regular inspections of the building. • Periodically review service contracts and prepare and administer all bids for services. • Relay complaints, problems, special cleaning projects, etc. to Janitorial Foreman; follow up to ensure task completion. • Conduct and document periodic inspections with Janitorial Supervisor. Ensure that the property is being maintained in a Class-A manner. • Issue keys, card keys, parking access cards, etc., utilizing building-specific software program. • Maintain dialogue with Engineering department to ensure that all service requests are addressed in a timely manner. • Direct Engineers in the completion of building maintenance. Set priorities for the staff and report to Property Manager on progress. V. Tenant/Building Improvement Supervision • Coordinate tenant improvement work and building alterations as directed by Property Manager. Attend project meetings as needed. • Coordinate access to building for contractors. Attend construction meetings as directed by Property Manager. Notify tenants in advance of any construction activity that will impact building operations or the tenants’ conduct of business. • Assist Property Manager in maintaining complete and orderly project files and records. VI. Leasing and Marketing Duties • Collaborate with Leasing and Marketing teams to ensure the leasing effort is coordinated with Property Management department. Remain informed of new and prospective leases, upcoming renewals, and other leasing related activities. • Ensure that marketing materials are distributed to all appropriate parties and kept up to date. • Support the development of the building web site, provide information to web developer as needed. VII. Other • Perform other duties and special projects as may be assigned by Property Manager or Director. Qualifications • Associate or Bachelors Degree preferred plus minimum one-two years administrative experience required, preferably in real estate. • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and any specific software as required • Proficiency in MRI preferable. Required Skills • Exceptional customer service skills; strong organizational skills; able to balance multiple priorities and projects, keeping all team members informed of progress and issues • Ability to work in team environment as well as work independently when required • Ability to communicate well and interact with all colleagues • Excellent written and verbal communication skills Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. item.title: Client Accountant
item.description: Details: Company Overview Cushman & Wakefield is the world’s largest privately‐held commercial real estate services firm. Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Cushman & Wakefield is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, and as such, we hire the most talented professionals and invest in superior resources and technologies. The talent of our extraordinary people and the culture and business approach we foster, coupled with the exceptional, creative services we provide and the results we deliver worldwide for owners, occupiers, and investors are what distinguishes Cushman & Wakefield. Job Title: Client Accountant - Emeryville, CA This position reports to the General Manager of the building as well as the Group Financial Manager from the corporate office. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Tenant Relations: Responds to tenant needs and coordinates with Property Manager to resolve invoicing and collection issues. Must have a thorough knowledge of all tenants’ leases and their provisions in order to ensure full compliance. 2. Client Relations: Responsible for making financial and accounting decisions that reflects a "big picture" understanding of the ownership investment strategy for the property. Anticipates and responds appropriately to owners’ needs, concerns and special requests. 3. Financial Reporting and Administration: Responsible for the preparation of accurate, timely and complete financial and accounting reports monthly. Oversees the financial preparation of the annual budget, forecasts and re-projections, and assists the Property Manager with budget variance explanations. Oversees the calculation of all special billings, including escalations, tax adjustments, CPI adjustments, and tenant bill backs. Responsible for Cash Management, as well as monitoring, recording and checking sales reports from tenants and ensuring proper enforcements of their lease provisions. 4. Operations: Maintains all accounting and other financial records. Performs all special projects as assigned by the General Manager, Group Financial Manager, Portfolio Manager and or Building Owners. 5. Lease Administration: Responsible for reviewing all leases and accurate input of the lease abstracts in compliance with client’s abstract and system input policies. Oversees the collection of rent and payment of expenses. Will work closely with the Property Manager in monitoring and complying with all tenants’ lease provisions. REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS The candidate must have a solid understanding of GAAP and know how to handle various aspects of reporting the operations of an office property. A thorough knowledge of CAM, and the ability to read, understand and apply lease provisions is essential. Must be hands on and take responsibility in all aspects of the accounting cycle to issue accurate and timely financial reports monthly. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills to work with client, on-site management team and third parties. MRI experience is essential. Prior retail experience and knowledge of Kardin is also helpful. Commercial property management experience is absolutely necessary. Salary is commensurate with experience. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

item.title: General Manager
item.description: Details: Company Overview Cushman & Wakefield is the world’s largest privately‐held commercial real estate services firm. Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Cushman & Wakefield is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, and as such, we hire the most talented professionals and invest in superior resources and technologies. The talent of our extraordinary people and the culture and business approach we foster, coupled with the exceptional, creative services we provide and the results we deliver worldwide for owners, occupiers, and investors are what distinguishes Cushman & Wakefield. Job Title: General Manager - Emeryville, CA PURPOSE OF THE JOB • Responsible for managing a large scale multi-building investment property in an efficient and value enhancing manner that is consistent with the overall strategic asset plan. Accountable for all business, financial, and management aspects of the assigned properties including preparing, implementing and adhering to the approved strategic asset plan, budgets for the properties, developing and maintaining strong working relationships with tenants, and supervising key building staff/employees. The General Manager is the key leader of the site-based team and has supervisory responsibilities for all operations, construction, and financial management personnel. PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES • Implement the approved strategic asset plan for the property. Has primary responsibility for the day-to-day operation of the property to assure that all site operations are in compliance with established policies and procedures, management agreement, and are consistent with the client’s overall objectives. • Prepare annual budget, monthly financial variance reports, operations analysis reports for the client and that all reports are reviewed and approved by the Director. • Conduct formal site inspections at least monthly in compliance with established standard operating policies and procedures. • Monitor and enforce the terms of all lease agreements, the billing and payment of rents in compliance with leases. Responsibilities include all aspects of lease administration. • Bears primary responsibility for creation and maintenance of all site specific documentation including, but not limited to, property information book, site operating manual and emergency operations manual. • Primary responsibility for controlling the procurement and expenditure processing. • Oversees all construction projects and delegates the administration of specific projects as required to ensure timely completion. • Ensure adherence to the approved budget with primary responsibility for variance reporting, forecast cash flow of property, review real estate tax assessments, and file required municipal reports. • Ensure regulatory compliance and effective management of risk and liability for both C&W and client. • Establish and maintain open relationships with tenants ensuring that all services and needs are met within service level agreements. • Keep current of all developments in commercial real estate market affecting current or potential value of asset. • Oversee completion of project and capital improvements consistent with local codes to ensure timely completion within planned budget. • Hire, train, and supervise a qualified engineering, management and maintenance staff to promote efficient and cost-effective operation. Responsible for employee administration, including performance management, salary reviews, setting goals and motivating subordinates to meet goals. • Participate in the negotiation of service contracts with outside vendors to achieve the highest levels of performance at the lowest cost all in compliance with C&W values, standards and guidelines for business conduct. • Support and provide leadership in a commitment to achieve C&W’s vision and mission and extol its values in the day-to-day conduct of business. Establish and be consistent in the application of expectations of appropriate professional behavior to ensure that the values of the firm or exhibited by the actions of the staff. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE • College degree plus RPA or CPM designation preferred in addition to degree. • A minimum of 10 years of experience in Property/Facility Management with a minimum of 5 years at the level of Senior Manager or other similar capacity with experience in leasing, construction, engineering and all facets of property operation and management. • Highly organized with superior verbal, written and presentation skills. • Ability to function within various disciplines (i.e., construction, information systems, and accounting) • Ability to communicate company vision effectively • Proven ability to effectively manage and lead cross functional teams to achieve a common goal PHYSICAL CONDITIONS While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to travel from floor to floor and may be required to travel outside between buildings in varying outdoor weather conditions. The employee may also be regularly required to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time; regularly use hands to operate office machinery including, but not limited to, telephones, computers, fax, and photocopy machines; regularly required to walk, talk, and hear. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Administration • Draft correspondence to and from owners, tenants, vendors and management. • Assist Property Manager and/or General Manager in the administration of all leases. Generate aging reports and provide updates and follow up on outstanding A/R, advising Property Manager and/or General Manager of collection problems. Assess late fees on collections received after the tenth of the month after consulting with Property Manager. • Create and update Lease Abstracts for each tenant. • Coordinate all deliveries and move-ins/move-outs. • Process all tenant requests for special work. Obtain estimate, provide proposal, order work, and invoice tenant for such work. Coordinate with Engineering department where necessary. • Maintain work order system. • Update and maintain all Property Information Books. • Update, track and maintain Certificate of Insurance lists for tenants and vendors. Request new or renewed certificates as required. • Update, track and maintain Property Contact Information Sheets. • Establish and maintain “Critical Dates” report which lists all tenant anniversaries, lease expirations, options, rent increase dates, etc. II. Financial • Assist with preparation of annual operating budgets. Provide contractor bids for budgeted work, contract services, etc. Complete data entry of budget information under Property Manager and/or General Manager’s direction. • Prepare monthly financial reports. Generate supporting documentation from the accounting system, provide status updates on pending projects and provide administrative support in the compilation of the finished product. Perform variance analysis and complete executive summary. • Prepare annual operating expense reconciliations. • Participate in the processing of all accounts payable. Generate purchase orders per company policies. Match invoices to PO’s, and complete invoice data entry. Oversee data entry function for certain properties in the case where data entry is performed by others. • Responsible for calculating and processing tenant bill-back for submetered utility consumption. • Review Pre-Posting Report for accuracy prior to posting of rents to tenant accounts. Generate and review rent statements and sundry billings, and ensure delivery of accurate rent statements on or around the 22nd of every month. III. Tenant Relations • Visit with primary tenant contacts and provide ongoing communication to create and maintain favorable relations between tenants and management. Maintain tenant relations log. • Responsible for day-to-day tenant calls. Follow through to 100% completion on all tenant requests. Coordinate all tenant events. • Coordinate Fire/Life Safety Procedures training for tenants. • Coordinate move-in of tenants. Provide Welcome Package, keys, coordinate move. Arrange for welcome gift. IV. Building Operations • Be familiar with the terms and specifications of all building service contracts. Continuously monitor the performance of vendors and service contactors and conduct regular meetings with contractors to ensure optimum performance. • Conduct regular inspections of the property. • Periodically review service contracts and prepare and administer all bids for services. • Relay complaints, problems, special cleaning projects, etc. to Janitorial Foreman; follow up to ensure task completion. • Conduct and document periodic inspections with Janitorial Supervisor. Ensure that the property is being maintained in a Class-A manner. • Issue keys, card keys, parking access cards, etc., utilizing building-specific software program. • Maintain dialogue with Engineering department to ensure that all service requests are addressed in a timely manner. • Follow through on repairs and installations to 100% completion with little to no supervision. • Direct Engineers in the completion of building maintenance. Set priorities for the staff and report to General Manager on progress. V. Tenant/Building Improvement Supervision • Coordinate tenant improvement work and building alterations as directed by Senior Property Manager. • Coordinate access to building for contractors. Attend construction meetings as directed by Property Manager. Notify tenants in advance of any construction activity that will impact building operations or the tenants’ conduct of business. Qualifications • Bachelors Degree plus minimum three years’ experience in real estate management required. • RPA designation or coursework desired. • Real estate salespersons license required. • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and any specific software as required. • Proficiency in MRI preferable. Required Skills • Exceptional organizational skills; able to balance multiple priorities and projects, keeping all team members informed of progress and issues. • Ability to work in team environment as well as work independently when required • Ability to communicate well and interact with all colleagues, clients and tenants. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

item.title: Research Analyst-Silicon Valley, CA
item.description: Details: Company Overview Cushman & Wakefield is the world’s largest privately‐held commercial real estate services firm. Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Cushman & Wakefield is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, and as such, we hire the most talented professionals and invest in superior resources and technologies. The talent of our extraordinary people and the culture and business approach we foster, coupled with the exceptional, creative services we provide and the results we deliver worldwide for owners, occupiers, and investors are what distinguishes Cushman & Wakefield. Job Title: Research Analyst Job Summary: Provides accurate and reliable statistical real estate market data to the C&W service lines. Provides an advanced level of research support in ensuring data integrity. To support the Research function on a local and national basis. Provides internal and external clientele with statistical information on office and industrial properties. Duties & Responsibilities: With direction from Research Director is responsible for the generation and compilation of all quarterly market statistics Interact with and directly coordinates communication to all C&W core business units (i.e. Capital Markets, Brokerage, etc.) Participate in design and development of new, enhanced products and services Write about and analyze proprietary market data (both historical and future) Assist in forecasting and economic outlook information for internal and external clients Produce and compile market information into quarterly reports, and local and national projects and reports Serves as local expert on regional and national research capabilities Compile, coordinate and distribute lease and sale comparable information Responsible for total quality control of products/services Oversee Research data on C&W website and CWNow market research information in relation to accuracy and timeliness of deliverables Maintains historical archives of building level data and market/submarket statistics via historical spreadsheet Train and orient core business units and administrative assistants on Research products, databases and services Actively participate in the development, marketing and enhancement of proprietary database to internal clients Assist in identifying new market trends to target for branch relations, C&W publications, etc. Assists in training/orientating new Research hires with use of standard local orientation materials Interacts with Chambers of Commerce, Economic Development, state and local government entities Requirements Basic understanding of commercial real estate fundamentals Writing and analytical experience required BA/BS or equivalent experience Two to three years of research-related experience required Computer proficiency in MS Office, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint Strong attention to detail Excellent organizational skills including the ability to multi-task and prioritize efficiently Ability to work independently on assigned projects Outstanding communication skills and the ability to interact with both internal and external clients. Proficiency in the proprietary database as to input and output Ability to efficiently perform tasks and demonstrate a high level of proficiency in all related software Preparation of absorption for office and industrial space on a quarterly basis Superior knowledge of commercial real estate terms and definitions Excellent understanding of statistical calculations involved in correctly reporting vacancy rates, absorption, construction, rental rates, leasing, sales activity, renovation and proposed activity Personnel and workflow management Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Founded in 1917, it has 253 offices in 60 countries and nearly 15,000 employees. It offers a complete range of services for all property types, including leasing, sales and acquisitions, equity, debt and structured finance, corporate finance and investment banking, corporate services, property management, facilities management, project management, consulting and appraisal. Job Title: Staff Accountant - San Jose, CA JOB SUMMARY Under the direct supervision of Financial Manager, you will be responsible for financial reports, processing a heavy volume of invoices, responding to vendor requests, JE reconciliation, bank reconciliation, mail distribution, Other Accounting duties and support as needed. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES • Receives and reviews invoices from vendors, codes and batches, assembles invoice packages from approval by appropriate managers. Scan invoices into Capture system/Process invoices into Yardi system. • Perform other basic clerical duties associated with accounts payable. • Answer vendor’s inquiries by email and phone.
