item.title: Maintenance Technician I -Chattanooga, TN
item.description: Details: Summary : The Maintenance Technician - I position is responsible for assisting in performing a variety of semi-skilled mechanical work with line set-up, maintenance and repair of components, equipment and systems. They will also perform semi-skilled mechanical and/or electrical work under the general supervision of Maintenance Technician II. Maintenance Technician I’s will take an apprentice role to other Maintenance Technician’s classified as a II, III, or IV in order to observe and learn through on-the-job opportunities to enhance and start to build a solid mechanical and electrical maintenance foundation. Distinguishing Characteristics: Must possess novice skills in both the mechanical and/or electrical trade and possess some experience in either trade with the ability to develop both skill sets. Will be assigned less complex duties relative to their exercised abilities. A Maintenance Technician I has an understanding of most procedures related to RockTenn policies pertaining to troubleshooting, repair, installation, and maintenance. An employee in this classification will generally remain at this level for a minimum of 1 year and until he/she can demonstrate the competencies by practical application skills necessary to complete the tasks listed on the Competency Checklist – Maintenance Technician II and by successfully completing the Fundamentals Learning Plan Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Understanding and demonstrating the behavior that the safety of yourself and other coworkers is paramount Perform safety inspections in manufacturing or repair settings. Perform preventative maintenance (PM) or clean-up tasks. Repair or maintain the operating condition of production machinery. Set-up production lines (Assembly). Operate maintenance vehicles including aerial lifts, personnel transport vehicles, and forklifts. Assist Maintenance Technician’s II, III, and IV in performing tasks in maintenance repair, and installation of equipment and systems. Perform semi-skilled repair of mechanical equipment. Examine parts for defects, breakage or wear. Reassemble equipment after completion of inspections, testing, or repairs. Clean, lubricate or adjust parts, equipment or machinery. Document repairs and maintenance performed. Document parts or materials used and request new parts or materials as necessary. Maintain and repair work tools or equipment. Lubricate machinery or parts. Position, align or level machines or structures. Maintain repair records as assigned. Responsible for the overall Safety and cleanliness of equipment and area. Work in a safe and efficient manner in accordance with company policies and procedures. Overtime is required. Perform other duties as assigned. LICENSED ELECTRICIAN IS A PLUS!!

item.title: Administrative Assistant
item.description: Details: Administrative Assistant Norcross, GA RockTenn (NYSE: RKT) Norcross, GA RockTenn is one of North America's leading providers of packaging solutions and manufacturers of containerboard and paperboard. Over the years, RockTenn has outpaced its peers in growth rate of revenues, profitability, EBITDA and total shareholder return. We’ve done this by creating and following a bold strategy of: exceeding our customers' expectations every time, creating long-term shareholder value and encouraging and rewarding employee excellence. FORTUNE® magazine has recognized RockTenn as one of its Most Admired Companies. RockTenn is also currently ranked at No. 293 on the FORTUNE 500 list. Since our founding in 1936, RockTenn has focused on developing packaging and paperboard products that bring high value to its customers, employees and shareholders. We now operate approximately 200 facilities across the United States, Canada, Mexico, Argentina and Chile. We employ 26,000 employees and are industry leaders in North America for paper recycling, retail displays, pre-print linerboard, containerboard, corrugated packaging, coated recycled paperboard and folding cartons. RockTenn is uniquely positioned to provide end-to-end solutions including a full portfolio of food, beverage and consumer packaging that contains, ships and markets our customers’ products. As a fiber-based packaging company, RockTenn considers sustainability to be a top priority. The industry and others recognize RockTenn for its sustainability efforts. Recently, the company received awards from AF&PA for its sustainability work with customers. And, in Newsweek’s Green Rankings, RockTenn is the highest ranked paper company on the list. A performance-based, data-driven culture helps us continuously reduce costs and increase customer satisfaction. In the past year, our employees increased customer satisfaction to the highest customer satisfaction rating in our history. Administrative Assistant We are seeking an Administrative Assistant for our Folding Carton Sales and Marketing group to be located at our main corporate campus in Norcross, GA (telecommuting is not available). The Administrative Assistant will provide administrative support to one senior vice president and their respective direct reports. Assemble and analyze fairly complex sales and marketing information and data. Describe results in various formats. Use independent judgment to complete activities and operate under general supervision. Oversee administrative procedures and processes for assigned areas. The Administrative Assistant may help with budget preparation and control and may act as an administrative liaison with internal and/or external sources. Responsibilities: Manage incoming telephone calls, mail, faxes and other general correspondence; take the initiative to resolve less complex issues and distribute the rest Maintain calendars and schedules Coordinate travel Coordinate mailings and shipping Compile data based on research techniques involving an understanding of operating unit programs, sales and marketing programs, policies, and procedures Drafts financial, statistical, narrative, and/or other reports or correspondences as requested Arrange and participate in as directed, division meetings and other events Sign on behalf of superiors, as delegated, his or her name to correspondence, requisitions, vouchers, and other forms of consequence Develop system control and reporting procedures and forms, including work and process improvements, methods changes, and computer applications Confer with managers regarding information requirements and cost control procedures; review and report on the budget status of various activities Perform related duties as assigned Qualifications: College degree or equivalent training preferred Knowledge of/ability to use Concur, Sales Force Strong written and oral communication skills Superior knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Proactive and energetic personality Ability to collaborate and interact effectively to accomplish desired results Proactive and action-oriented - ability to perform at the highest level without a lot of direction Reliable judgment and ability to handle and maintain confidential information. Interpersonal flexibility and strong customer service orientation. A self-starter with a strong ability to multitask and manage a variety of issues/projects and deadlines simultaneously. At RockTenn, we seek to be the most respected in the industry. Our employees are committed to exceeding their customers' expectations -- every time. If you enjoy this shared commitment to excellence and discovering value where others haven’t we would like you to consider RockTenn as your employer of choice. Rock-Tenn Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Vet Effective October 1, 2014, all the RockTenn Home Office campuses will maintain a smoke- and tobacco-free campus. No smoking or other use of tobacco products (including, but not limited to, cigarettes, pipes, cigars, snuff, or chewing tobacco) is permitted in any part of the building or parking lot.

item.title: Administrative Clerk - Baltimore, MD
item.description: Details: RockTenn (NYSE: RKT) RockTenn is one of North America’s leading manufacturers of paperboard, containerboard, consumer and corrugated packaging and one of the world’s largest paper recyclers. Over the years, Rock-Tenn has outpaced its peers in revenues, profitability, EBITDA and stock price. We’ve done this by creating and following a bold strategy of: exceeding our customers' expectations every time, creating long-term shareholder value and encouraging and rewarding employee excellence. Since its founding in 1936, Rock-Tenn has focused on developing packaging and paperboard products that bring high value to its customers, employees and shareholders. The company now operates approximately 240 facilities across the United States, Canada, Mexico, Argentina, Chile and China. We employ 26,000 employees and are North America’s largest paper recycler, largest display manufacturer, largest pre-print linerboard producer, 2nd largest producer of containerboard and corrugated packaging, 2nd largest producer of coated recycled paperboard, and 2nd largest producer of folding cartons. Administrative Clerk Baltimore, MD We are currently seeking an Administrative Clerk for our Baltimore, MD facility. The position requires the ability to work independently to provide a full range of clerical assignments of average difficulty as describied below. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Provide a full range of reception services. Pick up, receive, open, date stamp, and deliver mail and/or other materials. Update files, and maintain a variety of records such as addresses, telephone numbers, vacation schedules, attendance and timesheets. Photocopy documents, collate, assemble, and distribute materials. Type or produce reports or correspondence utilizing word processing, spreadsheet, and other business applications. Receive, review, and compare documents, forms, or applications for completeness and accuracy. Responsible for follow-up work to ensure all information is complete with all necessary data and supporting documents. Perform complex data entry tasks for which there is a moderate variation of formats and procedures and with general instructions. Gathers and records statistical information for reporting purposes. Assist with travel arrangements as necessary. Monitor and maintain office supplies and materials. Assist with maintaining data bases as necessary. Assists in scheduling and general set up tasks for meetings as requested. Assist with special projects as assigned. Other related duties as assigned. NECESSARY SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE Ability to work independently and perform clerical assignments with moderate direction. Ability to read, comprehend, explain, and apply written procedures. Working knowledge of business practices, correspondence and typing formats, including correct English grammar, spelling, and punctuation. Working knowledge of filing and record keeping systems. Ability to compare data from two or more sources for accuracy and completeness. Ability to operate office equipment Ability to greet visitors, answer the phone and answer or refer incoming inquiries from the public. Ability to perform complex data entry tasks. Working knowledge of MS Office Suite software and the use of computer systems. Ability to follow oral and written instructions. Qualifications 2 years of professional administrative support experience required, in manufacturing environment preferred. High School Diploma, or an equivalent combination of experience, education, and training related to the essential duties are required Customer service experience Ability to work independently Strong organizational skills Advanced computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook; PowerPoint At RockTenn, we’re not just about making paperboard, packaging and displays. Our 26,000 employees are committed to exceeding their customers' expectations -- every time. We’re about perfecting performance and innovating to provide the lowest cost possible. We thrive on striving to be the best, because nothing less is acceptable. If you enjoy this shared pursuit of perfection, a constant commitment to thinking beyond convention, putting customers first, reducing waste or discovering value where others haven’t, you’re one of us. Join a company that excels in attracting, developing and empowering employees to reach their potential. Rock-Tenn Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce. M/F/D/V

item.title: Maintenance Superintendent in Midland, TX
item.description: Details: BASIC FUNCTION Under the supervision of the District Maintenance Manager, the Maintenance Superintendent assists in maintenance and maintenance scheduling on all equipment and also provides guidance and supervision to the maintenance crew. He is responsible for assisting in the planning of maintenance budget, maintenance staff training, HSE, inventory control, record retention of required Federal, State and local governed regulatory and enforcing all Company Policies and Procedures. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 1. Assists with equipment function checks at the facility. 2. Must possess skills to operate various Company specific equipment 3. Must possess skills to identify, maintain and troubleshoot Company Equipment. 4. Supervises the maintenance staff when the Maintenance Manager is out. 5. Assists in the supervising HSE compliance of maintenance staff. 6. Must possess knowledge of Company purchasing process and policies. 7. May perform basic tasks in the office, facility and within the myNabors system including, but not limited to, Word, Excel, information gathering on vendor websites, Cummins Insite, Cat ET, Pro Link and applications profiled under myRigs (MyMaintenance, MyAssets, MyPurchasing, MyRequests) and able to obtain information from vendor catalogs through Nabors system 8. Takes an active role in assigning mentors to entry and lower level mechanics during repairs. 9. Works under no direct supervision with freedom to act in regards to work methodology. 10. Continually emphasize safety. Participate or lead safety meetings, hazard hunts and ensures JSA’s are followed. 11. Know, follow and periodically review the requirements established by job policy and procedure. Follow established procedures and guidelines. 12. Report unsafe acts, conditions or hazards immediately 13. Follow instructions given by supervisory personnel. 14. Requires maintained eligibility to drive company vehicles. 15. Possesses an understanding of district goals and works towards meeting those objectives. 16. Performs work on his/her own as well as provides motivation and direction to other employees as needed. 17. Ensures that all assigned staff participates in all company or customer provided training.

item.title: Clerk in Kenedy, TX
item.description: Details: BASIC FUNCTION The CLERK is an entry level position that performs various administrative duties under close supervision, for the Division office in any one or more of the functions listed in the Essential Functions section of this Position Definition. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 1. Able to present themselves for work for the duration of the normal work day, 8 am to 5 pm, with one hour off for lunch, Monday through Friday, with occasional additional work during the week and on weekends, to meet process schedules. 2. Able to perform light and sedentary work activities associated with clerical duties. 3. Able to travel overnight periodically to attend business activities such as audits or training. 4. Commit to learning and performing all of the tasks related to their assignment in: • purchasing, • accounts payable • accounts receivable, • time entry, • invoicing, • DOT logs, • Purchasing • receiving goods, • answering phones, • employee expense report validation, • employment processing, • maintaining local personnel files • disbursing uniforms, • updating equipment utilization logs. • creating fuel reports, 5. item.title: Reverse Unit Operator in Snyder,TX
item.description: Details: BASIC FUNCTIONS The Reverse Unit Operator is solely responsible for the safe operation of the Reverse Unit and Power Swivel for performing services on oil and gas wells as specified by the customer. The duties of the Reverse Unit Operator include the ability to read, understand, and independently implement the Customer’s project procedures. S/he must have technical expertise that will enable her/him to make decisions, when the customer is unavailable, to change procedures as the well conditions change. The Operator ensures the loading, transportation, unloading at the job site, operations and maintenance of the Reverse Unit equipment is performed within the guidelines of the Standard Operating Procedures. All duties of the Reverse Unit Operator are to be performed according to the Company operating procedures in order to maximize the safety of all personnel at the work site and to efficiently perform the task. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 1. Ability to perform the decision making necessary to encompass the overall Position Definition. 2. Adheres to Company policies and work requirements. 3. Ensures the movement of the Reverse Unit and associated equipment required for the job. 4. The Operator “spots” the equipment (placed in position), on the location to ensure all suction and discharge lines are hooked up from the reverse unit to the well and from the reverse unit to the pit and tank properly. Reverse units are used to “kill the well,” circulate the hole and fill the hole with fluid. The power swivel is used to drill additional well bore or deepen the well, drill out plugs such as cement, and cast iron bridge plugs. The Operator is required to determine depths, set correct pump pressure, and monitor drilling returns during the drilling operations. 5. Maintains the required knowledge in all applicable DOT rules and regulations and all job related Company, Local, State and Federal requirements. 6. Maintains accurate records and completes accurate work tickets based on the Company’s and customer’s requirements of the work performed. The Operator is responsible for alerting appropriate supervision when mechanical defects are noted on equipment. 7. The Reverse Unit Operator must understand maintenance concepts of all equipment within his/her control. 8. Ensures the equipment within his/her control is maintained and repairs are carried out as required. 9. Requires various types and levels of job related training with respect to the operations of the equipment and Company Standard Operating Procedures and also other specialized training as required by regulatory agencies and the Company. 10. Calculates pump requirements and make decisions concerning the proper equipment to perform all types of jobs.

item.title: Biomedical Technician
item.description: Details: Find more than a job. Find more in yourself. Find your calling. Essentia Health seeks employees who embrace our commitment to patient-and family-centered care in communities both large and small. We’re looking for people who are committed to making patients and their families feel known and understood. People who understand what it means to be Here with you. People who are willing to use their strengths to help others. The Biomedical Equipment Technician Level 1 is an entry level position. Under relatively close supervision, repairs, calibrates, and maintains all types of basic clinical equipment technologies, devices, instruments, and systems. Inspects, installs, and provides preventive maintenance of general clinical equipment. In addition to responding to service requests and completing maintenance inspections, the Level 1 Technician assists the Level 2 and 3 Technicians with minor projects, follows up on equipment recalls, and interacts with medical staff to reduce operator errors and reduce equipment malfunctions. NOTE: Applicants will be considered for a Biomedical Tech - level I, II, or III, based on assessed experience, with added responsibility within each higher level. Essentia Health offers competitive salary and benefits that include medical, dental, life insurance, long term disability, flex spending accounts, retirement plans, paid time off, and continuing education including tuition reimbursement. Our Values Quality Hospitality Respect Justice Stewardship Teamwork Essentia Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran Status

item.title: RN - Home Health - PRN - Granite Mountain Home Care - Cottonwood, AZ
item.description: Details: Bringing Compassionate Care Home At Kindred at Home, we offer a variety of services to patients and clients in their homes or places of residence. Our services range from non-medical care and home health, for patients needing skilled nursing and rehabilitation, to hospice and palliative care, for patients seeking pain management and psychosocial support through chronic and terminal illnesses. Kindred at Home is a growing provider of hospice, palliative care, durable medical equipment, non-medical home care and home health services with more than 100 locations in 10 states. For more information, please visit www.kindredathome.com. IT'S SIMPLE. You want to work in a healthcare setting where you are valued and appreciated - where you receive respect from your superiors and co-workers as well as the patients you treat. You want to be challenged by your job without being overwhelmed by it. You want to play an instrumental role in helping a patient recover, sometimes against strong odds, and go home. What you want is Kindred Healthcare. Our mission is to promote healing, provide hope, preserve dignity and produce value for each patient, resident, family member, customer, employee and shareholder we serve. Join us! Summary: Primary functions of the Registered Nurse are to administer skilled nursing care for clients of all ages in their place of residence, coordinate care with the interdisciplinary team, patient/family and referring agency and assume the responsibility for coordination of care.

item.title: Intern, Curian Sales Desk
item.description: Details: Curian Capital, LLC® has an opening for an Intern for the Curian Sales Desk . Curian Capital, LLC is a registered investment advisor that provides fee-based investment advisory solutions for financial professionals. Curian Capital, LLC is a subsidiary of Jackson National Life Insurance Company® ("Jackson®"). Jackson is one of the nation's largest and fastest growing financial services companies, with over $100 billion in total assets. Please visit our website at www.jackson.com for more information. Job Purpose This position is responsible for utilizing Curian resources and technology to assist the sales team and management. The intern is required to assist in the processing of new accounts in a pro-active manner. The candidate must possess a strong desire to seek a career in the Financial Services Industry. Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities Process new business applications. This includes identifying missing requirements, making phone calls to gather missing information and providing follow-up information to the appropriate sources Handle overflow inbound sales calls from the National Sales Desk on an as need basis and either provide assistance when appropriate or route the call to the appropriate party Use Curian technology proficiently to assist in running proposals, ordering literature, contact management system data entry, etc. Become proficient at understanding Custom Style Portfolios and the Curian Program consistent with Curian's marketing and sales ideology Seek knowledge, insight, and experience from fellow associates and management on a regular basis to enhance effectiveness and productivity Enhance industry and product knowledge in order to effectively communicate and build credibility with Financial Professionals and colleagues

item.title: DOCSIS Engineer III
item.description: Details: Job ID: 8666 Position Description: We are different! At Suddenlink, we respect the individuality of all members of our team and value the richness that diversity brings to our workforce. Join the 6,000 individuals that make Suddenlink truly different. Suddenlink has an exciting opportunity for a DOCSIS Network Engineer III in our St. Louis Corporate Office. Reporting to the Director, DOCSIS Network Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for the testing, design and deployment of our DOCSIS IP access networks. This individual will work with other corporate and regional engineering teams, equipment vendors and cable industry technical organizations as a SME (Subject Matter Expert) on DOCSIS. They will also be accountable to resolve the final level of technical escalation of DOCSIS network operation issues. Excellent communication, relationship building, documentation and reporting, and project management skills are critical for success. Accountabilities •Research new DOCSIS IP access network technologies •Prepare Request for Information (RFI) and/or Request for Proposal (RFP) documents as required •Develop detailed network test plans and execute those plans in a lab environment •Create network architecture designs according to company and industry standards and best practices •Plan and coordinate the deployment of network hardware and software with the regional engineering teams •Develop network provisioning, training and monitoring documentation and assist in the initial deployment of new equipment •Resolve critical level technical network operations escalations from the Network Operations Center (NOC) •Recognize and identify opportunities for improving the performance, cost or efficiency of the network •Participate in cable industry technical organizations such as SCTE and CableLabs •Manage equipment vendor relationships •Develop and produce reports on the performance of the network with respect to defined targets Position Requirements: Job Qualifications / Requirements •Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering or Computer Science •Minimum 5 years experience in DOCSIS IP network development, design and deployment •Minimum 2 years experience in project management •Detailed technical knowledge of DOCSIS including CMTS, Back Office and CPE •Detailed technical knowledge of HFC RF design and operation •Detailed technical knowledge of IP networks design and operation •Experience in Fibre-to-the-Premise (FTTP) technologies such as PON and RFoG an asset •Team player with excellent communication skills both written and verbal •Microsoft office application knowledge (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) •Appropriate valid driver’s license and a good driving record Working Conditions •Working conditions will primarily be in office and lab environments •Field work with travel to regional head end locations is required •Travel to industry shows and events is required We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

item.title: Switch Engineer, Complex Translations
item.description: Details: Job ID: 8662 Position Description: The Switch Engineer - Complex Translations will navigate the various translations tables of the GenBand CS2K and C20 voice switches, completes translations testing and verification. This Engineer will build multiple trunk groups such as SS7, PRI and MF, local, LD, and Toll and also coach and mentor less experienced staff. Other responsibilities of this role include: - Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience - Navigates through translation tables, creates trunk groups, reads and comprehends translations verification tools utilizing GenBand products -Makes appropriate use of available information and data; makes sound decisions with some support from the supervisor; and responsible for specific projects or definable portions of larger projects or processes -Develops and completes concise project plans, and completing projects in a methodical fashion -Acts as an integral part of telephony outages resolution -Researches and assimilates data for translations implementation based on marketing and company needs -Translates new markets to include new NPA´s, new rate centers, and new LATA´s -Troubleshoots call routing and AMA discrepancies -Implements and troubleshoots call features, LNP, E-911 and SS7 Global title -Implements Operator, Directory Assistance and Centrex translations -Routes traffic to local and IXC trunk groups as well as utilizing TNS selectors and OZZ codes -Completes line translations when needed -Executes LERG database queries and maintain data integrity at all times -Ensures that the voice network is optimally engineered Position Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering or Computer Science is ideal or equivalent work experience that includes a Nortel, GenBand, Cisco or Cedar Point certification. 3 to 5 years Switch Operations or Telephony Operations experience 3 to 5 years Translations Nortel/GenBand experience Strong ability to isolate and resolve translation outages Strong ability to translate new markets to include new NPA´s, new rate centers, LATA´s and SS7 global title Strong ability to navigate through translation tables, create trunk groups, read and comprehend translations verification tools utilizing Nortel or Cedar Point products Strong knowledge of E911 Translations to include knowledge of the MSAG & ANI/ALI requirements needed to support E911 Strong knowledge of media gateways and voicemail servers Strong knowledge of VoIP We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

item.title: Direct Sales Representative-Single Family Units
item.description: Details: The Direct Sales Representative (DSR) sells Video, Voice, and Data services to residential customers within assigned territory comprised of single family homes . The DSR’s performance is critical to the achievement of department and company Primary Service Unit (PSU) growth and net gain objectives . To that end, the DSR may perform basic installations as well as auditing. Works independently in the field 90% of the week or more and uses own car for extensive local travel (with reimbursement for travel). Upholds the Region’s Sales Vision: “Flawless execution with every customer, with every initiative, every day” Sells door-to-door in residential neighborhoods using street sheets to identify sales opportunities; ensures that Cox products and services are favorably presented to prospective residents Meets established sales targets. Develops and maintains positive internal/external working relationships Works evenings and weekends to maximize customer contact. May be required to work special events as needed. Effectively works all addresses as assigned to maximize sales opportunities and increase product penetration. Compiles daily reports of sales, contacts, presentations, objections, and other information as required by supervisor. Participates in team sales blitzes. Completes special projects and/or reports as requested. Conducts all business in an ethical manner as outlined in the Channel Sales Standards of Performance and Conduct. Attends and participates in all scheduled team meetings. Maintains current job knowledge through completion of on-going training opportunities, satisfactory skills assessment scores, and attainment of job related certifications, including annual certification renewal/update. May complete basic installation of video and data services for residential customers. May perform audits within assigned territory to reduce and eliminate theft of service in order to drive incremental PSU growth. May collect on bad debt accounts, picks up and returns customer equipment. Performs other duties as required.

item.title: Senior Compliance Analyst
item.description: Details: SUMMARY Cox Communications is searching for a Senior Compliance Analyst to measure the effectiveness of information security practices and technologies to ensure compliance of Cox Communications assets. The position utilizes strong policy and process knowledge as well as technical skills and expertise with a variety of technologies. It involves interaction with numerous departments and business functions. RESPONSIBILITIES • Under minimal supervision or direction, perform all activities within the Security Compliance Program to ensure the protection and safety of information systems assets and to protect data from unauthorized access or use. • Define, maintain and update information security policies, procedures and standards. • Recommend integrated security solutions that will ensure proprietary/confidential data and systems are adequately protected. • Facilitate both internal and external audit efforts related to information security as well as remediation activities with business and IT. • Facilitate assessment of and compliance with information security regulatory and legal requirements. • Assist in the daily administration of the security compliance monitoring and enforcement program. • Perform Technology Risk Assessments on concepts, solutions, products, services or processes • Identify appropriate security controls based on current and future risks, policies and architecture. • Provide consultation and advisement to business groups, projects and other company functions teams data protection issues, risk management and security compliance efforts. • Develop / Enhance / Support information risk and security programs related to system and data protection efforts across the company. • Effectively coordinate compliance activities with other Cox Communications business functions as tasked.

item.title: Senior Billing Application and Process Support Specialist
item.description: Details: Cox Communications is looking for a Senior Billing Application and Process Support Specialist who will participate on a project to launch and stabilize a managed services engagement. This individual will work with the TOMS systems and support teams as well as the Netcracker Customer Advocates to ensure a stable production environment for the TOMS systems and to prioritize and manage escalations of production issues and concerns. Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions • Manage the Netcracker vendor relationship and ensure requests for TOMS hyper, enhancement, and custom code are prioritized and that solutions are delivered in a timely manner • Ensure Netcracker’s service delivery meets contractual agreements • Coordinate collision calendars and communicate TOMS hyper, enhancement, and custom code delivery • Act as Point of Contract (POC) for escalation and communication of TOMS production issues and concerns • Manage vendor service team and facilitate review meetings and activities • Coordinate change management activities • Manage service through monthly service reviews • Coordinate and report on SLA and SLOs • Facilitate communication between vendor service delivery, support, internal customers, and IT management • Review problems and ensure Root Cause Analysis (RCAs) have been performed • Ensure adherence to service level agreements and objectives as well as to the priority • Demonstrate management and leadership capabilities • Support customer needs by responding quickly to incidents based on priority and maintaining a focus on providing excellent customer service • Provide recommendations for operational efficiency and process improvements subject to management review in support of change • Identify customer concerns and resolve or escalate customer issues quickly and accurately within documented timeframes • Effectively communicate with business users and customers • Deliver monthly operational report to peers and senior management • Ensure Netcracker prioritizes, coordinates, and delivers fixes based on Cox needs • Work with Netcracker to deliver and run cleanup jobs on one time or recurring basis • Identify, establish, and implement continuous improvements to hyper delivery • Identify and acquire training and knowledge in areas key to improve customer service, technical ability, and job performance • Enforce all policies and procedures and ensure they are followed as set forth by management • Ensure the prioritization of Netcracker operational support • Ensure the creation of documentation for all procedures in the department • Responsible for the integration of new operational processes and communicating potential impacts to the organization • Ensure all issues are communicated promptly and accurately to the appropriate people

item.title: Senior HFC/Access Designer
item.description: Details: SUMMARY Cox Communications is searching for a Senior HFC Access Designer, to design, coordinate plots and maps, and determine fiber node placement requirements for hybrid fiber-coax (HFC) and FTTH/ fiber optic networks. The HFC Access Designer will create accurate network maps, layouts, drawings, and detailed electronic construction prints. This individual will develops and maintain network specification files. In addition, the Designer will perform cost analysis for trenching, sweeping, node splits and upgrade projects. RESPONSIBILITIES • Update As-Builts as construction is completed and releases the area. • Prepare layouts, drawings, and designs according to engineering specifications using GE Small World, Lode Data and MapInfo. • Provide ongoing support to other departments as needed in the effective use of all peripheral applications. • Make design decisions regarding construction and safety methods according to appropriate Cox, FCC, OSHA, NEC, MESC, VDOT, BOCA, Land Use Manual, and local, state and federal regulations and procedures and may be responsible for creation of design permitting for state agencies. • Independently plan fiber network capacity, and troubleshoot and analyze system fiber utilizing WDM, CWDM and DWDM technologies o Independently view and adjust fiber ring capacity, plan and coordinate projects to ensure backbone is available for launch or product deployment o Process fiber availability requests, estimates and ring capacity checks, engineer’s fiber conversion projects and determines reinforcement requirements. • Calculate forward and reverse RF levels to provide adequate signal for HD and digital services. • Make design decisions and determine equipment requirements based on specifications, cost effectiveness, reliability, planning for future growth and provide detailed material bill of materials for designed projects o Calculate and determine power supply requirements, and proposed locations, for HFC plant utilizing 90 volts with consideration for NIU penetration o May estimate material and labor costs for special projects for fiber and coax up to the patch panel or customer premise. • Train and mentor less experienced designers and assist with development of competency levels in drafting and design. • Support technical staff in troubleshooting plant problems and designing for conflict resolution. • Quality check mapping and network design files to ensure correct and optimum use of RF and Power network components to minimize construction costs, enhance network reliability, and minimize maintenance needs. • Develop and maintain network specification files for different design architectures through the research of component distortion specifications and operating levels to allow for the use of multiple types of equipment in HFC Access design. • Manage special design projects as needed o May plan the splicing of coax and fiber optics as well as the allocation of activation and fiber.

item.title: Senior Manager, Privacy
item.description: Details: SUMMARY The Senior Privacy Manager, under the direction of the Director, Privacy, Identity and Access Management, will support the Director, Privacy, Identity and Access Management with the duties and obligations of the Privacy Office. In addition, the Senior Privacy Manager will be required to establish strong working relationships with key individuals within Human Resources (HR), Legal, HR Legal, Corporate Marketing, Corporate Communications, Corporate Compliance, Information Technology (including the information security areas), the business units, Regional Privacy Officers, and Data Protection Officers. This individual will need to balance policies and practices with different business environments encountered in different business units and in different locations, while being cognizant of new products, services, and business transactions across such a diverse company. RESPONSIBILITIES • Provide assistance in implementing and modifying local privacy and data protection policies and compliance programs. • Assist with the review and guidance for local privacy and data protection compliance programs . • Support the coordination of a community of Company Regional Privacy Officers for the purposes of competency building, collaborating on evolution of this policy, sharing leading practices, monitoring relevant regulations, and consistency of communications between the operating companies and their respective local regulators with policy. • Collaborate with human resources, legal, business units and other functions on privacy and data protection matters. • Provide day-to-day privacy guidance in connection with the review and implementation of privacy and customer preference solutions within consumer marketing and customer service programs across the enterprise, ensuring that adequate procedures are in place to comply with new and existing privacy laws, regulations, and corporate policies. • Ensure continuing adequacy of controls, policies and procedures by monitoring compliance performance and recommending process improvement. • Monitor handling of consumer complaints and inquiries concerning privacy. • Establish and implementing training, scripts, form letters and other support materials and tools for process owners in consumer contact and preference management programs. • Perform special projects as necessary under the direction of the Director, Privacy, Identity and Access Management. • Support the Privacy Office with the corporate privacy and data protection policy and business practice guides. • Understand and keeping abreast of privacy legislation and industry trends, assisting in analyzing impact on business practices, communicating significant impact on business practices in a timely manner. • Perform special projects as necessary under the direction of the Director, Privacy, Identity and Access Management. • Communicate significant or potentially significant privacy issues or changes in policy or regulations to business units in a timely manner.

item.title: In-Store-Bakery Key Account Sales Manager - WEST
item.description: Details: Dawn Food Products is growing their Western U.S. Key Account Management team! As the Key Account Manager you will have the responsibility of cultivating and managing corporate relationships with in-store-bakery decision makers, acting as a consultant and solution provider helping them become successful by assisting and influencing the dollar channel in applying Dawn Food's products to their needs resulting in revenue and profit generation. You should be accustomed to handling account values in the $30M to $50M, and have the ability to travel up to 75% of the time. Responsibilities Partner with internal stakeholders to achieve sales goals Identify growth opportunities to capture market share Direct the activities of technical support individuals Prioritize activities to balance customer and internal time requirements Work closely with R&D teams to bring products to market Attend tradeshows, trainings and plant tours as assigned Monitor weekly/monthly sales and profit results; compile customer business reporting as required Determine go-to-market strategies for Dawn products in support of key customer initiatives Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or 7 years of relevant experience 5 years selling to and managing national or large regional accounts Technical bakery sales experience preferred Proven success working in a team environment is essential Ability to travel up to 75% to customers and events without restriction Close proximity to a major airport Proven ability to establish and maintain profitable, mutually beneficial business relationships Dawn Food Products, Inc. is the world's largest privately owned, bakery supplier with operations facilities located around the globe, annual sales of nearly $2 billion, and over 5,000 people working in more than 70 countries. Dawn's proven recipe for success is built on our Circle of Excellence that includes: outstanding, hard-working People who develop and produce consistently high-quality Products that exceed the expectations of our Customers around the world. Our culture drives global growth by embracing diversity while encouraging constant learning and continuous professional development. Dawn People enjoy great benefits, competitive wages and an excellent working environment. Dawn Food Products is an equal employment opportunity company.

item.title: Distribution Sales Rep - Phoenix
item.description: Details: Dawn Food Products currently has room for a new Distribution Sales Representative in the Phoenix area who has the drive and self-motivation to succeed in a competitive sales environment. Successful Dawn DSRs possess an entrepreneurial spirit, an ambitious sales sense and the desire and ability to develop new customer relationships while growing existing accounts. Dawn provides its DSRs all the tools to be successful in this role, including a company car. The customer base for this territory typically includes bakeries, donut shops, grocery stores, restaurants, hotels, panaderias and casinos. Dawn DSRs are responsible for achieving or exceeding sales goals within a defined territory by increasing sales with existing customers as well as prospecting and securing new customer accounts. Dawn DSRs provide exceptional product knowledge and service ensuring customer satisfaction in all areas of the business. Dawn DSRs work outside of their assigned Distribution Center, reporting directly to that facility’s Sales Manager; they are commissioned team members and are paid within the parameters of the Dawn Corporate commission structure. Responsibilities Personally visit customers and accurately enter, review and transmit customer orders Calculate margins; prepare estimates and bids using Dawn’s pricing models to meet specific customer needs Understand, explain and implement Dawn Foods’ credit policies and terms with customers Identify prospective customers Monitor market conditions, product innovations and competitors’ products, prices and sales Perform administrative duties, such as preparing sales budgets and reports, keeping sales records and filing expense reports Qualifications Minimum 1 year outside sales experience in a commissioned pay structure Possess an outgoing, consultative personality Motivated self-starter able to work independently without direct daily supervision Maintain superior customer service Possess the ability to read, write, verbally communicate and comprehend the English language Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with co-workers and customers Must be able to understand and calculate margins Valid Driver's License Proficient use of Microsoft Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively Bilingual (Spanish/English) capabilities preferred .

item.title: Distribution Sales Manager - Salt Lake City
item.description: Details: Dawn Food Products, Inc. is the world's largest privately owned, global bakery supplier with annual sales of over $1 billion, and over 4,000 people working in more than 70 countries. We have operations in the U.S., United Kingdom, Europe, Mexico, Canada and Brazil. Dawn's proven recipe for success is built on our Circle of Excellence that includes: outstanding, hard-working People who develop and produce consistently high-quality Products that exceed the expectations of our Customers around the world. Our culture drives global growth by embracing diversity while encouraging constant learning and continuous professional development. Dawn People enjoy great benefits, competitive wages and an excellent working environment. Dawn Food Products is an equal employment opportunity company. Our Salt Lake City sales team is currently searching for a Sales Manager who possesses proven leadership skills, drive and motivation to guide a successful team of sales professionals in a competitive market. The Sales Manager works under broad supervision, managing a group of Distribution Sales Representatives and the efforts of the distribution center (DC) to meet or exceed sales goals. This position is in charge of aligning the sales goals and activities of the distribution center with the overall goals for Dawn Food Products. This position is seen as a leader within the DC and local market, and assists in guiding the strategic direction of the DC. Responsibilities Manages the overall activities of the department including the directing, advising, and managing of direct and indirect subordinates to ensure strong team member and team performance. Develops and implements strategic sales plans to align with local and corporate goals Plans and directs the work of Sales Team, including the appointment of work / territory / customers among Team Members, provides training / mentoring as necessary. Directs sales forecasting activities and sets performance goals accordingly Reviews market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates Directs channel development and coordinates sales activity by establishing sales territories, quotas, and margin goals Represents Dawn at trade association meetings to promote Dawn products Delivers sales presentations to key customers in conjunction with the efforts of Distribution Sales Reps Performs other related duties as assigned and requested Qualifications Minimum of three years of food distribution sales management experience, with a proven track record of successful leadership & sales High School diploma or GED equivalent Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience Current driver’s license and excellent driving record are required in order to comply with company vehicle program Must be familiar with Microsoft Office suite of products Two years of management and/or leadership experience

item.title: Distribution Center General Manager II
item.description: Details: Under broad supervision, General Manager – Distribution has full management responsibility for a Dawn Distribution center. This position ensures overall accordance with Dawn Food Products and International Featured Standards - Food (IFS) standards. The GM also ensures the Distribution Center meets or exceeds budgeted sales and income goals, maintains appropriate relationships with key customers and vendors to support sales goals, and effectively partners with other Dawn business units to support Dawn global goals. Responsibilities: Provides leadership by establishing credibility; acts with integrity; shows and inspires commitment; Motivates and guides team to achieve goals Manages the overall activities of the center including the directing, advising, and managing of direct and indirect subordinates to ensure strong team member and team performance Responsible for establishing the gross profit strategy and directions, monitoring and adjusting as necessary Reviews, monitors and implements margin management processes and procedures Participates in hiring, promotion, discipline, and/or discharge decisions of team members as necessary Collaborates with Human Resources on hiring rates, adjustments to Team Member rates of pay/position status, and necessary disciplinary actions to ensure overall adherence to company policy Develops, maintains and administers a sound organizational plan, initiating improvements as necessary Establishes performance expectations, monitors against expectations, and provides necessary feedback to team members to enhance their growth in position and promotional opportunities Plans and administers operations reporting for budgets, production, quality, inventory control, shipping and receiving, supply management, project control, etc. Is responsible for monthly profit forecasting and operating statements Ensures overall operations conform to the organization’s policies and procedures, as well as federal, state and local regulations Works with Operational Peer Review Team to identify and implement best practices Coordinates operations and communications within, between, and among various functional areas ensuring a cohesive relationship throughout all levels and locations Addresses Team Member complaints and participates in investigations, as appropriate, with the assistance of Human Resources, completing required documentation, and providing a timely resolution Creates organizational structure to support best practices in terms of Dawn culture, policies and processes to create consistent Dawn experience for Dawn customers, team members and supplies through and by demonstrating the “Dawn Values” of Team Dawn and the Dawn Circle of Excellence Ensures regulatory compliance with DOT, FOA, Board of health, workers compensation and environmental health and safety programs Responsible for audit and regulatory inspections Provides overall direction and guidance on purchasing and replenishment Oversees satellite branches Minimal travel required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in related discipline; Master’s in a related discipline preferred 5-10 years’ experience managing a Food Distribution facility Has experience managing a field sales team, preferably commission based Familiar with transportation management including DOT compliance and regulations Have had P&L responsibility and demonstrate basic accounting knowledge Credible fluency with modern office technology (MS Office or similar) Proven experience of growing a business

item.title: Marketing Firm looking for Restaurant / Retail / Hospitality Experience
item.description: Details: Restaurant - Retail - Hospitality - Customer Service Full Time Position: Red Bay, Inc. is hiring for entry level candidates looking for a full time position to begin their career in sales and marketing. Ideal candidates have leadership, communication, and management skills. This full time position is Monday through Friday. The position is entry level, so all experience levels will be considered. At Red Bay, Inc., we don’t hire managers from outside, we develop and promote only within based off their performance. We pride ourselves on providing clients with professional in-person representation, collaborating with existing sales and marketing strategies, to increase customer acquisition and customer loyalty. This job involves face-to-face presentations with small to mid-sized business customers. Our talented teams of sales and marketing professionals represent our clients with unparalleled integrity to the business community. This position is entry level and full time. We will cross-train individuals into an executive partnership role within a short amount of time. Due to the strong relationship with our client and our aggressive marketing approach, we have never eliminated a position or downsized. What does this mean to you?....STABILITY! In order for our organization to prosper, Red Bay, Inc. is aggressively seeking talented, enthusiastic entry level individuals who are searching for an opportunity to quickly work their way from entry level client management to a branch management position. This position entails overseeing campaign development for our client and managing a staff of 20+ employees. Our management training program offers an exciting opportunity for entry level candidates to learn all aspects of our business from the ground floor entry level position. This not only instills credibility, but also expertise. Red Bay, Inc. provides: Entry Level Training No glass ceilings Entry level career opportunities A fast-paced, exciting work environment Travel Opportunities

item.title: PSG Management / Sales Training Program 2014 (Entry Level)
item.description: Details: Management Training Program The Paint Stores Group (PSG) Management Training Program is designed to provide you with all the skills necessary for a successful career in management and/or outside professional sales. The Program includes self-study modules, structured on-the-job training, classroom instruction at our regional training facilities, as well as ongoing education throughout your career. Training topics include: paint and associated products, customer service, professional sales and marketing, credit and accounts receivable management, human resources management, profit and loss and merchandising management. Growing a Career in Management: If you think you’ve got what it takes to be a troubleshooter, “marketer”, trainer, systems analyst, creative problem solver, strategist, and an all-encompassing leader of the pack, you could be part of the Sherwin-Williams management team. As a Sherwin-Williams Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to oversee and manage a million dollar business, providing leadership and insight into the development and strategy of “your” store. (Average store sales are $1.5 million.) Click here to explore a "Day in the Life" of a Sherwin-Williams Store Manager. Growing a Career in Sales: Many Management Trainees choose a path that leads to a career in professional sales. Sherwin-Williams’ sales professionals grow the company’s market share by selling to large, commercial users, such as painting contractors, purchasing agents, manufacturers, and other commercial users who need large volumes of our high quality products. Generally, sales professionals apply their trade in specific regions or territories. Management Trainees are eligible for professional sales positions once a track record of success within the stores has been established. To join our Management Training Program, you must have an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrated leadership ability, and work experience in customer service and/or sales. Also, bilingual candidates are welcome, and a willingness to relocate is encouraged. Basic Requirements: - Must have a valid Driver’s License - Must have a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university for employment. You may apply for this position if you have your bachelors degree, or will obtain one within the next 12 months - Must submit to a background screening which may include driving, credit and criminal history - Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status) - Must be willing to work all scheduled hours which may include evenings and weekends, with or without reasonable accommodation Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other consideration prohibited by federal, state, or local laws or by contract. VEVRAA Federal Contractor

item.title: Principal HR Business Partner (Tallahassee/Pensacola)
item.description: Details: Gannett Co., Inc. is seeking a Principal HR Business Partner with experience in serving multi-layered, complex organizations. This professional HR executive will support the HR needs of the Media organizations in Pensacola and Tallahassee, Florida in achieving operational goals and implementing employee development programs. The HR Principal Business Partner will coordinate recruitment and retention initiatives, training opportunities and maintain effective employee relations. Successful candidate must have the capability and flexibility to work with a diverse group of employees. The position reports to the HR Group Director located in Rochester, NY. This Business Partner will need to be located in either Tallahassee or Pensacola but will support both sites in person weekly. Responsibilities: Develop and support in the areas of training, recruiting and HR Generalist responsibilities. Excellent customer service, time management and communication skills. Successful experience with professional presentation and conflict resolution skills. Ability to react productively to change and effectively multi-task is critical. Knowledge of local, state and federal laws regarding employment, wage and hours, OSHA and related laws Excellent interpersonal skills with internal and external customers. Ability to prepare deliverables and reports accurately within time deadlines. Experience with labor negotiations and contract administration. Strong ethical standards and integrity are a must. Qualifications : Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Human Resources or equivalent. Master’s degree or HR certification is preferred. A minimum of 8-10 of experience as an HR generalist required. A working knowledge of employment laws and multi-level recruitment experience. Demonstrated human resources experience, with emphasis on recruiting, training and employee relations. Proficient knowledge/ability with Microsoft Office Applications. Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Asphalt Laydown Foreman - Hutchinson, KS
item.description: Details: City: Hutchinson State: Kansas Postal/Zip Code: 67501 APAC-Kansas, Inc., Shears Construction, a part of Oldcastle Materials Company, is a multi-million dollar heavy highway contractor that was established in 1874, and has multiple asphalt plants, ready mix plants, rock quarries and sand operations in Kansas. Shears is diversified with public, private and commercial work including paving, utility, dirt-grading and concrete flat work. Our valued employees produce quality work and products in a competitive market with safety first at all times. If you are seeking a rewarding career with challenging work, a variety of responsibilities, potential for advancement and looking for benefits of a large corporation with a small company feel, come join our team. Asphalt Laydown Forman: Do you want to work for a company that values your skills? Do you want to work for a company that values safety above all else? Are you looking for opportunities and benefits of a large corporation with a small company feel? Then Oldcastle Materials is the company for you! Apply for the Asphalt Laydown Foreman position today and jump start your career with the Oldcastle Materials family. Job Description Summary The selected candidate will be required to work in a team environment with other co-workers and managers. Supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in spreading, rolling, tamping, patching asphalt or similar material to form surfaces of highways, streets, parking lots, aircraft landing strips, driveways, etc. Supervise and coordinate crew activities, studying production schedules, and estimating work requirements for completion of job assignment with or beating the job estimate Receive daily specific instructions from a Project Superintendent Schedule the mobilization of needed equipment Supervise/ coordinate, train, and coach assigned personnel in the completion of jobs and daily work duties Read plans and set engineering grade stakes to guide equipment operators Supervise equipment operators and laborers to ensure that work is being done according to the field layout and the plans Supervise personnel to assure proper compaction is obtained on the soil or base Perform the duties of a heavy equipment operator when necessary Perform the duties of a construction worker/ laborer when necessary Notify the Project Superintendent when conditions on the job change causing a variation to previous instruction.(Approval should be received from the Superintendent before adjusting plans) Ensure that employees operate and maintain equipment properly Notify the shop of equipment mechanical issues Lead crew in our safety culture and help ensure a safe working environment Maintain time and material records necessary for completing daily job costing Perform other duties as assigned. Work Requirements The ideal candidate will: Pass pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check. Pass a pre-employment “Fit for Work” physical. Be able to provide valid documentation for the I-9 Immigration document. Display a professional and courteous attitude to co-workers, supervisors and the general public at all times. Report to work at the designated start time. Be able to work long hours when required. Strictly adhere to safety requirements and procedures as outlined in the Employee Handbook. Have the willingness to work in a team environment and assist co–workers or supervisors with other duties as required. Must be able to complete safe driver training, possess a valid driver’s license with a good driving record. May be required to have or acquire a CDL as necessary Be at least age 18 years of age. Education/Experience Must be proficient in Microsoft Applications with the ability to learn new software systems as needed. Be able to communicate appropriately with direct reports, co-workers, supervisors, and the general public. Be knowledgeable of materials and equipment needed to perform tasks. Be able to read plans and specifications Ability to use decision making skills for cost effective solutions on jobs in the absence of a superintendent Mathematical understanding in order to calculate grades, slopes, dumps, etc. Be able to calculate grades needed from plans Related experience in construction field, minimum 5 years ( desired ) What Oldcastle Offers You A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion Highly competitive base pay Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs Group retirement savings program Health and wellness programs About Oldcastle Oldcastle has a long and proud heritage as one of North America’s largest corporations. We are a proud reflection of the hundreds of family businesses, local and regional companies and mid to large sized enterprises that together form the Oldcastle family. Oldcastle operates with a decentralized, diversified structure, letting you work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of a large enterprise. Oldcastle is a great place to grow! If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Please complete your online application and profile which will be sent directly to the appropriate Hiring Manager. Thank you for your interest in the Oldcastle family!
