item.title: Retail Sales Associate
item.description: Details: We believe great sleep begins with a great in-store experience, provided by our Retail Sales Associates. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, who have a desire to enter the retail sector to apply! See what our company has to offer: • Flexible work schedules • Industry-leading, paid training program • Aggressive income potential, Base + Commission!! • Continual opportunities for growth and career advancement! • Healthcare coverage, including medical, dental and vision care • Recognition & Rewards Program; earn prizes for performance • Paid vacation, sick and personal days • 401(k) Retirement Plan with company match • Tuition Reimbursement Our vision is to provide 100% customer satisfaction while delivering the healthiest sleep solutions to every bedroom in America. As a leader in the mattress and bedding industry, our name will bring the customers to you! Our aggressive and buzz-worthy advertising campaigns have kept Sleepys current in todays market and have solidified Sleepys as a household name throughout our trading area. Our product selection includes an extensive brand assortment, exclusive products, the latest mattress innovations, and a wide selection of sleep accessories such as pillows, sheets and more to help you complete your selling experience. Combine all this with our ability to offer the very best prices, customers return to usand will return to you again and again. Sleepys Retail Sales Associates are responsible for: Thriving in a self-motivated environment while selling the largest selection of quality merchandise including; mattresses, bed frames, mattress protectors, headboards, sheets, pillows and more! Utilizing Sleepys proven sales techniques to assess, qualify and satisfy the needs of every customer Remaining customer-centric at all times to promote the Sleepys brand and drive sales Help consumers discover their comfort to ensure proper mattress selection and avoid product exchanges Educating the customer about the healthy advantages of a good nights sleep by effectively explaining the features and benefits of each individual product Actively pursuing open customer tickets to ensure order fulfillment Building and maintaining customer relationships to promote customer loyalty, gain referrals and elevate positive word-of-mouth advertising Presenting Sleepys extensive line of accessory products to boost profits and increase commissions Executing sales performance plans to improve showroom objectives as assigned by management Assisting with the set-up and merchandising of showrooms and ensuring that all merchandise is tagged properly Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to: maintaining the professional appearance and cleanliness of the showroom, daily cash management and deposits, communicating with all levels of management regarding showroom merchandise, opening and closing the showroom, ensuring corporate policies are being adhered to at all times and additional tasks as assigned by management. Apply today to be considered for our upcoming sales training class!

item.title: Sales Recruiter
item.description: Details: Sleepys, The Mattress Professionals is currently seeking a dynamic and professional Sales Recruiter to join our team based in Odenton, MD. Imagine the personal reward when helping someone find an exciting career opportunity while directly impacting the companys success This position will be responsible for recruitment of Sales Professionals, Management and Support Staff in a designated region. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: • Screen, interview and recommend prospective employees to management for sales-related positions. Ensure candidates have a complete understanding and realistic picture of job responsibilities, compensation, training, schedule requirements, benefits, growth opportunities and company history/future. • Schedule and coordinate interviews with hiring Managers. Follow-up with candidates upon completion of interviews. Pre-close candidates on available position and processing background checks, when applicable. • Work closely with hiring Managers to understand staffing needs, skills, knowledge and abilities necessary for each open position. • Aggressively search internet databases, including Oracle Applicant Tracking System, for qualified candidates. • Maintain all candidates information within Oracle ATS. Ensure information is accurate, up-to-date and notes are entered for each candidate interviewed. Responsible for preparing new hire paperwork for HR, both manually and in Oracle. • Extend verbal offers of employment. Obtain approvals from management and coordinate start dates with new hires. • Prepare all new hires for training and coordinate hotel accommodations (if needed). • Responsible for recommending changes to online job postings for specific area based on changing business needs and tracking results of said postings. • Field recruiting. Recruit potential employees from competition and/or other companies. Partner with companies that are closing to assist their employees with possible job placement with Sleepys. • Attend job fairs and coordinate open houses throughout an assigned territory. Seek out new career events to help maximize recruiting efforts. • Build and maintain network of candidates/sources through LinkedIn and other networking sites. • Conduct reference checks. • Maintain and create various recruitment materials, referral logs and reports. • Remain in compliance with HR laws and adhere to company and department policies and procedures. • Special projects and additional tasks/administrative duties as assigned by management.

item.title: Director of E-Commerce Marketing and Merchandising
item.description: Details: Sleepys is looking for a Director of E-Commerce Marketing and Merchandising to drive daily, weekly and monthly sales for its web properties, which include sleepys.com and 1800mattress.com. This individual will be responsible for devising, implementing, measuring and optimizing the online merchandising strategies, promotional strategies, content strategies and marketing campaigns that will drive sales to Sleepys rapidly growing online properties. This individual will work very closely with the marketing, creative, merchandising, planning technology and tele-sales teams, and will play an important role not only in driving Internet sales, but also in providing an optimized digital and mobile experience for the Sleepys customer. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: • Devise and own the daily, weekly and monthly digital marketing, promotional and content strategy and calendar for Sleepys online properties • Develop and implement the marketing strategies and website experience, including segmentation, A/B testing, content and creative, that will maximize conversion rates and sales on a daily and weekly basis • Work closely with the planning and merchandise teams to plan and execute site merchandising strategies to include selection, pricing, promotion, product display, product information, on-site search and inventory • Collaborate with corporate advertising and marketing to ensure that the marketing and promotional calendar is at all times coordinated with the corporate marketing calendar in order to create a tight omnichannel shopping experience • Partner with the creative and technology teams to create impactful and customized website experiences for different customers, and continually test offers, messages promotions and creative • Identify and develop strategies to support key customer segments and behavioral opportunities • Additional responsibilities as assigned by Management

Utilizing Sleepys proven sales techniques to assess, qualify and satisfy the needs of every customer Remaining customer-centric at all times to promote the Sleepys brand and drive sales Performing a comfort analysis on every customer to ensure proper mattress selection and avoid product exchanges Educating the customer about the healthy advantages of a good nights sleep by effectively explaining the features and benefits of each individual product Actively pursuing open customer tickets to ensure order fulfillment Building and maintaining customer relationships to promote customer loyalty, gain referrals and elevate positive word-of-mouth advertising Presenting Sleepys extensive line of accessory products to boost profits and increase commissions Executing sales performance plans to improve showroom objectives as assigned by management Assisting with the set-up and merchandising of showrooms and ensuring that all merchandise is tagged properly Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to: maintaining the professional appearance and cleanliness of the showroom, daily cash management and deposits, communicating with all levels of management regarding showroom merchandise, opening and closing the showroom, ensuring corporate policies are being adhered to at all times and additional tasks as assigned by management.

item.title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT / OFFICE ASSISTANT
item.description: Details: Employer is seeking candidates to join our office team, great on the phone, proficient in office tasks and with excellent analytical skills. Full-time position 40 hours/wk Some of the responsibilities include: Providing excellent customer service, Issuing purchase orders, Resolves product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution, Prepare weekly and monthly reports for internal use, Other clerical duties as assigned plus, assist other departments on an as needed basis.

item.title: Global Supply Chain Planning Manager
item.description: Details: Fast Growing Consumer Product Manufacturer in the SE Portland area seeks a Global Supply Chain Planning Manager to lead a team of talented global supply planners. The company is consistently recognized as one of Portland's top manufacturing operations to work for and this particular role is a high visibility opportunity with definite growth potential beyond this role. The company is a publicly traded operation and one of Portland's larger global manufacturing companies. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the daily execution of global finished goods planning for the stocking locations throughout company division. Key responsibilities include direct and indirect supervision of the planners performing the sales and operations planning; daily planning; sponsorship and promotion of best practices; and leading the SAP planning module implementation for current and future acquisitions. DUTIES: Implement corporate wide direction for inter-company, vended products and finished good production planning to ensure company targets are met Analyze planning processes and implement continuous improvement opportunities Develop strategies to optimize inventory levels while balancing marketing and financial interests Challenge forecasting and scheduling teams to create supply plans that meet service and cost targets Supervise and maintain SAP planning processes Provide leadership for projects involving design, specification, upgrade, and implementation Keep up to date with advances in supply chain management enabling technology Provide guidance for various areas to coordinate effects between manufacturing, marketing, engineering, product line, sales, and finance Coordinate with sales, product line, customer service and product development to understand customer and market requirements Provide leadership in developing and communicating operational requirements in support of new product launch and innovation

item.description: Details: Employer is seeking candidates to join our office team, great on the phone, proficient in office tasks and with excellent analytical skills. item.title: A&P
item.description: Details: Qualifications (Must have): - A&P license is a must - Need to have 3-5 years of experience on small corporate aircraft - Must be flexible with shift (2nd, 3rd or weekends) About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Automotive Technician
item.description: Details: Are you energetic and enthusiastic person who's passion is to repair vehicles in a professional environment? Are you searching for an opportunity to grow with a company that promotes success? If so, BELLE TIRE HAS BEEN LOOKING FOR YOU!! You probably already know Belle Tire as an industry leader in tires. What you may not know is that we also offer a full range of automotive services, from brakes to transmissions, performed by state certified technicians (not applicable in OHIO), most of whom hold multiple ASE (Automotive Service Excellence) certifications as well. Currently we have one of the best team of employees anyone could hope for, however we are always seeking the best and brightest to make us even stronger. As we continue to grow in Michigan and Ohio, we are seeking potential team members for the position of Automotive Technicians (or mechanics) to help us to be even more successful. Belle Tire offers an incentive based compensation package, full benefits and a 401k. The Automotive Technician is committed to providing the highest quality of repairs and service necessary to satisfy the customer. They should be self-motivated, dependable, hard-working and work well in a team environment. They must be certified (State of MI/ not applicable in OHIO), knowledgeable and have experience in areas covered by the ASE certification programs (Engine Repair, Transmissions, Drive Train/Axles, Suspension/Steering, Brakes, Electrical, Heating/Air Conditioning and Engine Performance). Responsibilities: Diagnosis of customer vehicles Interaction between employees and/or customers; explaining diagnosis and needed repairs as required to assist sales staff and/or clarify for customers Providing the highest quality repairs to customers' vehicles Staying updated on most current technology, requirements and processes regarding automotive service and repair Maintains an organized and safe work environment The ability to be ready to start work by scheduled time Other duties as assigned by supervision

item.title: Tire Technician
item.description: Details: Do you love cars? Would you love to get the chance to learn to work on them, while getting paid for it, starting with the tires? The Tire Technician is an entry-level position that provides the knowledge and skills required to build a promising career in the tire and automotive service industry. All Tire Technicians will receive one-on-one training in a professional environment in order to the learn duties, processes and responsibilities of the position. If one succeeds in this position, there are plenty of opportunities to be trained to become an Alignment Tech, Auto Tech (Mechanic) and more!! Job Duties: Continuous thinking and sharing of ideas to improve Belle Tire Ability to be ready to begin work at scheduled time Gather and document vehicle information including: VIN, mileage, license plate #, and any visible damage Cover vehicle with protective materials prior to service Drive customer vehicles into & out of service bays Safely lift vehicle onto hoists Inspect vehicles for possible worn parts and tires Dismount and mount tires Clean hubs and wheels of corrosion Repair tires Balance tires Torque lugnuts to correct specifications Load scrap truck Clean shop, showroom, restrooms, and waiting room to include trash removal Other duties as assigned by supervision

What you may not know is that we also offer a full range of automotive services, from brakes to transmissions, performed by state certified technicians (not applicable in OHIO), most of whom hold multiple ASE (Automotive Service Excellence) certifications as well. Currently we have one of the best team of employees anyone could hope for, however we are always seeking the best and brightest to make us even stronger. As we continue to grow in Michigan and Ohio, we are seeking potential team members for the position of Automotive Technicians (or mechanics) to help us to be even more successful. Belle Tire offers an incentive based compensation package, full benefits and a 401k. The Automotive Technician is committed to providing the highest quality of repairs and service necessary to satisfy the customer. They should be self-motivated, dependable, hard-working and work well in a team environment. They must be certified (State of MI/ not applicable in OHIO), knowledgeable and have experience in areas covered by the ASE certification programs (Engine Repair, Transmissions, Drive Train/Axles, Suspension/Steering, Brakes, Electrical, Heating/Air Conditioning and Engine Performance). Responsibilities: Diagnosis of customer vehicles Interaction between employees and/or customers; explaining diagnosis and needed repairs as required to assist sales staff and/or clarify for customers Providing the highest quality repairs to customers' vehicles Staying updated on most current technology, requirements and processes regarding automotive service and repair Maintains an organized and safe work environment The ability to be ready to start work by scheduled time Other duties as assigned by supervision

item.title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT / OFFICE ASSISTANT
item.description: Details: Employer is seeking candidates to join our office team, great on the phone, proficient in office tasks and with excellent analytical skills. Full-time position 40 hours/wk Some of the responsibilities include: Providing excellent customer service, Issuing purchase orders, Resolves product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution, Prepare weekly and monthly reports for internal use, Other clerical duties as assigned plus, assist other departments on an as needed basis.

item.title: Sales/Store Manager
item.description: Details: San Diego's largest retailer of fine home furnishings is seeking an experienced sales/store manager for our location on Miramar Road. Salary plus bonus incentive along with excellent medical and dental benefits.

item.title: Tire Technician
item.description: Details: Do you love cars? Would you love to get the chance to learn to work on them, while getting paid for it, starting with the tires? The Tire Technician is an entry-level position, but one of our most important, that provides the knowledge and skills required to build a promising career in the tire and automotive service industry. All Tire Technicians will receive one-on-one training (computer and on-the-job) in a professional environment. For those who excel in this position, there are plenty of opportunities to be trained to become an Alignment Tech, Auto Tech (Mechanic) and more!! Job Duties: Continuous thinking and sharing of ideas to improve Belle Tire Ability to be ready to begin work at scheduled time Gather and document vehicle information including: VIN, mileage, license plate #, and any visible damage Cover vehicle with protective materials prior to service Drive customer vehicles into & out of service bays Safely lift vehicle onto hoists Inspect vehicles for possible worn parts and tires Dismount and mount tires Clean hubs and wheels of corrosion Repair tires Balance tires Torque lugnuts to correct specifications Load scrap truck Clean shop, showroom, restrooms, and waiting room to include trash removal Other duties as assigned by supervision

item.title: Automotive Technician
item.description: Details: Are you energetic and enthusiastic person who's passion is to repair vehicles in a professional environment? Are you searching for an opportunity to grow with a company that promotes success? If so, BELLE TIRE HAS BEEN LOOKING FOR YOU!! You probably already know Belle Tire as an industry leader in tires. What you may not know is that we also offer a full range of automotive services, from brakes to transmissions, performed by state certified technicians (not applicable in OHIO), most of whom hold multiple ASE (Automotive Service Excellence) certifications as well. Currently we have one of the best team of employees anyone could hope for, however we are always seeking the best and brightest to make us even stronger. As we continue to grow in Michigan and Ohio, we are seeking potential team members for the position of Automotive Technicians (or mechanics) to help us to be even more successful. Belle Tire offers an incentive based compensation package, full benefits and a 401k. The Automotive Technician is committed to providing the highest quality of repairs and service necessary to satisfy the customer. They should be self-motivated, dependable, hard-working and work well in a team environment. They must be certified (State of MI/ not applicable in OHIO), knowledgeable and have experience in areas covered by the ASE certification programs (Engine Repair, Transmissions, Drive Train/Axles, Suspension/Steering, Brakes, Electrical, Heating/Air Conditioning and Engine Performance). Responsibilities: Diagnosis of customer vehicles Interaction between employees and/or customers; explaining diagnosis and needed repairs as required to assist sales staff and/or clarify for customers Providing the highest quality repairs to customers' vehicles Staying updated on most current technology, requirements and processes regarding automotive service and repair Maintains an organized and safe work environment The ability to be ready to start work by scheduled time Other duties as assigned by supervision

item.title: Full Time Customer Service Position Immediate Start
item.description: Details: Are you an energetic, motivated, determined individual looking to find work at a young, vibrant fast growing marketing company? If so, than MC Opportunities is definitely the job for you! Located Downtown New Haven, MC Opportunities has a determination to continue being ambitious in direct sales marketing, growing sufficient ways to market and promote our clients products and services to their future consumers. Face-to-face interactions with consumers allow us to build successful, trustworthy relationships which in turn generate a loyal customer base for our clients.We are looking for several entry level sales and marketing candidates to work alongside our company of motivated and career oriented individuals as sales and marketing consultants. Our Goals: Find the most appropriate candidate to successfully grow into our senior management role.

The Tire Technician is an entry-level position, but one of our most important, that provides the knowledge and skills required to build a promising career in the tire and automotive service industry. All Tire Technicians will receive one-on-one training (computer and on-the-job) in a professional environment. For those who excel in this position, there are plenty of opportunities to be trained to become an Alignment Tech, Auto Tech (Mechanic) and more!! Job Duties: Continuous thinking and sharing of ideas to improve Belle Tire Ability to be ready to begin work at scheduled time Gather and document vehicle information including: VIN, mileage, license plate #, and any visible damage Cover vehicle with protective materials prior to service Drive customer vehicles into & out of service bays Safely lift vehicle onto hoists Inspect vehicles for possible worn parts and tires Dismount and mount tires Clean hubs and wheels of corrosion Repair tires Balance tires Torque lugnuts to correct specifications Load scrap truck Clean shop, showroom, restrooms, and waiting room to include trash removal Other duties as assigned by supervision

item.title: Retail Sales Associates / Retail Manager
item.description: Details: Are you energetic, enthusiastic, customer service driven? Are you searching for an opportunity to grow with a company that promotes success? If so, BELLE TIRE HAS BEEN LOOKING FOR YOU!! You probably already know Belle Tire as an industry leader in tires. What you may not know is that we also offer a full range of automotive services, from brakes to transmissions, performed by state certified technicians, most of whom hold multiple ASE (Automotive Service Excellence) certifications as well. With all that being said, we require a sales team to effectively be able to sell our products and inform the customer of the reasons why. Currently we have one of the best team of employees anyone could hope for, however we are always seeking the best and brightest to make us even stronger. As we continue to grow in Michigan and Ohio, we are seeking potential team members for the positions of Sales Associate, Assistant Manager and Store Managers. Whether you have automotive experience or not (We prefer that you do), we provide the training (classroom, e-learning and hands-on)...and you provide the success. Belle Tire offers competitive base salaries along with incentive based compensation packages, full benefits and a 401k. Job Responsibilities: Sales Associate: Continuous thinking and sharing of ideas to improve Belle Tire Assess customers’ needs and provide Belle Tire solutions accordingly Ability to be ready to start work at scheduled time Meeting and exceeding defined goals and objectives Building customer relationships Managing a cash drawer: cashing customers out Clean shop, showroom, restrooms, and waiting room if needed Pick up tires/parts from stores and vendors if needed Manages and coaches shop employees Other duties as assigned by supervision Retail Management: Executes all of the duties of the Sales Associate at an extremely high level Open and Close the location Assists with/manages coaching and directing employees Scheduling of employees Daily cash reconciliation Other duties as assigned by supervision

item.title: Weekend Manager
item.description: Details: Saint Mary's Manor is accepting applications for the Weekend Manager position. Shift is 7a-7p, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. This associate will focus on customer service and quality of care. Duties will be varied. Applicant must be detail oriented, self-starter and flexible. Good communication skills are a must! Nursing license is preferred, but not mandatory. We offer an excellent starting salary and benefit package. EOE

item.title: Maintenance Technician/Janitorial
item.description: Details: MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN/JANITORIAL JOB DESCRIPTION Maintenance Technician/Janitor Job Purpose: Maintenance Technician Job Purpose: Performs aspects of maintaining property operations, escorting contracts into occupied and vacant units to perform work. Maintains the cleanliness of our multi-site buildings. Maintenance Technician/Janitor Job Duties:  ENSURE MAXIMUM OCCUPANCY Inspect property on a daily basis to ensure all aspects of the property and curb appeal meet LMC standards. Responsible for the completion of all maintenance service requests as assigned. Complete make-ready process of vacant apartments as directed by the Maintenance Supervisor Responsible for 24-hour emergency maintenance service as scheduled. Carry pager/cell phone as required for on-call maintenance. Monitor and maintain all building systems as assigned. Clean building entryways, hallways and common areas and office. Complete grounds work as directed by Maintenance Supervisor which may include picking up trash, sweeping curb and dumpster areas and maintaining landscaping beds and other areas. Responsible for snow removal which may require to be on call. Responsible for alerting the Supervisor of any unusual occurrence and/or damage that have taken place or that may occur. Assure safety standards are used which comply with all company, local, City, State and Federal guidelines Complete the "Preventative Maintenance Program" as directed by the Maintenance Supervisor Maintain a professional courteous manner with all residents, vendors, contractors, and fellow employees. This job requires exerting 50 to 100 pounds of force occasionally, and/or 25 to 50 pounds of force frequently, and/or 10 to 20 pounds of force constantly. Special projects and other responsibilities as may be determined.

item.title: IT Project Manager
item.description: Details: Liberty Mutual Insurance At Liberty Mutual Insurance, doing the right thing is essential to all that we do. Our commitment to building and sustaining a talented and diverse workforce has helped us to become a global leader in property and casualty insurance. As of December 31, 2012, Liberty Mutual Insurance had $36.9 billion in annual consolidated revenue. Our financial strength and profitability rely on the skills, knowledge, and creativity of our more than 50,000 employees in over 900 offices worldwide. As number 81 on Fortune Magazine’s list of the 100 largest corporations in the U.S., we have the resources and training our employees need to drive our business forward and be successful in an ever-evolving, complex world. Liberty Mutual Insurance offers a wide range of insurance products and services, including personal automobile, homeowners, workers compensation, property, commercial automobile, general liability, global specialty, group disability, reinsurance and surety. Liberty Mutual Insurance (www.libertymutual.com) employs over 45,000 people in more than 900 offices throughout the world. Advance your Information Technology (IT) career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company. At Liberty Mutual Insurance, doing the right thing is essential to all that we do. Our commitment to building and sustaining a talented and diverse workforce has helped us to become a global leader in property and casualty insurance. Our financial strength and profitability rely on the skills, knowledge, and creativity of more than 50,000 employees worldwide. As number 76 on Fortune Magazine’s list of the 100 largest corporations in the U.S., we have the resources and training our employees need to drive our business forward and be successful in an ever-evolving, complex world. Liberty Mutual Commercial Insurance IT is actively searching for an IT Project Manager. Commercial Insurance IT supports the Commercial Insurance business group which is the fourth largest commercial insurer in the US. Commercial Insurance IT leverages strengths to continue to simplify operations and invest in new technologies that provide competitive advantage. In this position, you will oversee the planning and implementation of Information Technology projects. Projects will pertain to the delivery of timely, quality IT services and/or relate to improving business effectiveness or efficiency. Responsibilities: Oversees the planning and implementation of multiple IT projects with a defined beginning and end. Partners with project sponsor to define project objectives, scope, schedule, and budget. Establishes project charter and plan, including success criteria. Oversees the evaluation of business and system requirements and project related research on business and technical trends and dependencies Leads and directs project teams to meet project objectives. Reviews, evaluates, baselines, executes and communicates project plans, schedules and budgets. Allocates staff and budget resources to meet changing corporate needs. Identifies and negotiates schedules, milestones and resources required to meet project objectives and success criteria. Organizes and guides project operations through the use of methodologies accepted by the industry. Modifies schedules as required. Provides input into staff performance evaluations and objectives. Provides coaching, mentoring and guidance to project team members and/or others in Project Management roles. Works with client departments to coordinate systems testing, installation, training and support. Directly contributes to the improvement of the Project Management discipline within Liberty Mutual IT. Keeps informed of advances in technology and Project Management. Functions independently with limited supervision from a Manager or Director. Performs related duties as assigned or requested. Potential on-call support required

item.title: Front Office Coordinator - Dr. Van de Putte & Dr. Vargas OB/GYN
item.description: Details: Under the General Direction of the Practice Administrator, the Medical Office Coordinator works directly with the Office Manager in coordinating office personnel and other activities in the work areas in order to provide an efficient operation and to enable the facility to provide the best quality patient care. The Medical Office Coordinator is also responsible for patient flow, scheduling, collection of demographics, check-out, and assists with arranging for any lab or other diagnostic/clinical tests or treatments prescribed by the physician during the patient examination. Assists with administrative duties as assigned by the Practice Administrator and Physicians. Meets the communication needs of the patient/family and medical and office staff. Keeps the flow of communication moving throughout the office. Implements directions from the physicians and nursing staff. Follows through with the patient or their physician offices on outstanding documentation needed to finalize the patient’s chart.

item.title: Marketing / Sales Manager / Customer Service - Immediate Hire
item.description: Details: Marketing and Sales Manager Wanted - Background in Customer Service is a PLUS We are now accepting applications & interviewing for marketing and sales positions with our company. MC Opportunities is a leading provider of marketing and sales professionals in the Greater New Haven Area. Our clients have experience tremendous growth and expansion with our marketing team to lead them. We are currently hiring a full time marketing professional. No experience in advertising or public relations needed. All new employees will participate in a customized training period that will suit their knowledge and experience. Job Description/Responsibilities: - Customer interaction to market product, services and client portfolio - Maintain professional standards in customer relationships and marketing - Participate in daily training sessions and marketing campaign meetings - Contribute to a positive and energetic environment that fosters creativity and growth

item.title: EDI/SAP Analyst
item.description: Details: The SAP EDI Analyst will bridge the gap between SAP/EDI technical expertise and business process knowledge by working closely with business process owners and SAP functional teams to identify and analyze EDI requirements, implement appropriate EDI designs, participate in enhancement projects, and provide on-going production EDI support. Work with a team of business analysts to design, implement and support System Integration requirements. * Bachelor's Degree required with preferred emphasis in information systems, or computer science, or related field. Equivalent work experience considered. * 6+ years EDI Technical Mapping and Business Process design experience * 3+ years of Gentran Integration Suite (GIS) Sterling Integrator experience * Integration Map Development - EDI, Application Files, Database * BPML Design and Development * 3+ years of SAP Experience in SD, MM, IDOCs, ALE * Experience in both implementation and application support is desired. * 2+ years project management experience * Demonstrated perceptual and analytical thinking * High level of attention to detail that translates into a high degree of accuracy in results * Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to translate technical information into language non-technical people will understand * Ability to identify deficiencies in technical work and implementation plans, and to identify schedule conflicts * Strong leadership to lead effective project and staff meetings * Tenacity to set and achieve complex objectives from multiple teams in order to meet business objective, and to effectively manage cross-functional resources * Excellent written and oral communication skills About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Executive Assistant
item.description: Details: Entrepreneurial Chicago Loop based financial services organization is seeking a polished, energetic Executive Assistant to provide a wide range of tasks for this internationally known organization. This position supports two top level executives handling a wide variety of administrative and project work. The ideal candidate will have experience with complex calendaring, international travel, interacting with high profile individuals, creating client reports and assisting with special projects. He or she will also have a strong service orientation, a proactive nature and savvy problem solving skills. The organization offers a base salary of $60,000 to $70,000 + bonus and profit sharing. Assist a dynamic team of professional but fun executives with their busy, growing department Plan, make and verify domestic and international travel arrangements for airline, hotel and ground transportation Manage complex domestic and international calendaring for conference calls, meeting and events Plan internal and external meetings including document preparation, catering, room set-up/tear down Create PowerPoint presentations and Excel spreadsheets for reporting including charts and graphs Write, edit and proofread correspondence; manage, track and report expenses Assist the department and company with additional tasks including identification of departmental efficiencies, assisting with office activity planning and other special projects

item.title: Lead Medical Technologist - Hematology
item.description: Details: Under direction of the Laboratory Administrative Director and the Laboratory Medical Director, accountable for all aspects of Point of Care development, technical supervision, and quality success of Laboratory Services POC program. Helps Laboratory to develop and articulate mission and vision financial and budget targets, and quality measures. Is responsible for ongoing interface and frequent communication with patients, customers, employees and management to ensure customer/patient satisfaction. Effective manage change, facilitate innovation and foster teambuilding to provide the highest quality and most cost effective laboratory/POC product possible. Ensures compliance with all State and Federal regulations and accrediting bodies such as CMS, DNV, CLIA, and College of American Pathology (CAP). This position will specialize in Hematology and maintain quality testing services and prepare for CAP accreditation.

item.title: Merchant Services Sales
item.description: Details: Seeking candidates with proven sales abilities who are looking for an opportunity with a competitive base and unlimited commission potential! Top performers are able to make a competitve salary plus uncapped commission and are making $100k+ per year! Job Description: This is a Merchant Services Telephone Sales opportunity. These sales professionals will be conducting consultative sales presentations with small to medium sized businesses offering the payment processing solutions and services of one of the nations largest and most respected financial institutions. Qualifications: Candidates with 2 + years of experience within a telesales, manual dialing, student enrollment, outbound sales, timeshare sales, cold calling and/ or telemarketing environment are ideal. Seeking candidates with a Bachelor's Degree that have a competitive attitude and a desire to be in a Sales environment/role. Bilingual candidates are a huge plus in this position. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Project Analyst
item.description: Details: Our client is looking for a Project Analyst. This person has the opportunity to stay for a long term contract or even go perm in 2015. This Project Analyst is going to be holding a Project Coordinator role. This resource will help out from a portfolio level and help the Project Managers with certain tasks. This resource should be someone who has an interest in a career path in Project Management. This Project Analyst will help the Project Managers submit purchase requirements and keep track of them. This person will be in charge of keeping track of IT finance and invoice processing to get vendors of our client paid. They will document in the Accounts Payable system. This Project Analyst will also help out with software maintenance renewels and Statement of Work (SOW) contracts. This resource may help out with creating financial reporting so it would be nice if he or she has experience with Excel reporting. They will create scorecards, dashboards, and create financial reports to help measure profit. They will help with financial forecasting and actuals. item.title: Installation Mechanic Technician

item.title: Speech Language Pathologist - SLP
item.description: Details: Accountable Healthcare Staffing (AHS) is currently seeking Speech Language Pathologist (SLP) candidates to join our network of healthcare professionals. Respond to medical referral following standard procedure. Perform evaluation, re-assessment, discharge, etc. in timely manner according to departmental policy. Select and administer appropriate treatment with proper attention to age-appropriate considerations, patient safety and dignity. Collaborate with physicians and other disciplines to obtain maximal benefit from patient treatment. Instruct patient and family in treatment plan, expected outcome, and home program. Produce a quantity of work that is consistent with departmental goals. Work cooperatively with peers to contribute to the overall productivity of the team. Stay abreast of trends and professional issues and reflects this in treatment. Develop and update appropriate plan of care in collaboration with the patient/family and related to the person's age and lifestyle with measurable long and short term goals and a defined discharge plan. Select and administer appropriate assessment and treatment techniques. Follow intervention protocols and revises interventions appropriately. Recommend discharge of patient at point of optimal benefit of treatment, making appropriate provision for continuing services if needed. Meet competency skills for evaluations in area of practice. Work cooperatively with supervisors and peers to contribute to the overall productivity of the team. Utilize support personnel (aides) as appropriate and available. item.title: Sr Design Quality Engineer
item.description: Details: The Senior Design Quality Engineer provides Quality Engineering support to the successful development and commercialization of Covidien combination devices for the treatment of peripheral vascular disease. This individual will apply his/her knowledge of design control principles and quality engineering techniques to development efforts and ongoing manufacturing support as needed. In parallel, this person will also ensure the products are developed and manufactured in accordance with applicable industry standards, regulatory requirements and customer requirements. PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIES • Provide Quality Engineering leadership and execution in design, process, test method, controls development from product concept through commercialization of combination devices for the treatment of peripheral vascular disease • Identify and manage risk throughout the development process through the creation of the risk management file and use of FMECA and/or other risk management tools • Develop master test plans that encompass design verification, design validation and process validation activities • Evaluate test protocols and reports to ensure that the testing is sufficient to meet regulatory requirements and quality objectives • Provide input to design and manufacturing documentation including material specifications, drawings, inspection procedures, and manufacturing procedures, to ensure that the resulting products can be adequately manufactured and tested • Assist with the analysis and resolution of design or manufacturing problems as these arise • Analyze and investigate returned clinical investigation products to determine the cause for return • Contributes to design input requirements from experience with previously reported problems from internal sources (non-conforming material reports, yield, re-work) or external sources (customer complaints), competitive devices and/or other similar products • Participate in supplier selection process and component specification reviews to ensure that purchased items meet Covidien specifications • Specify quality characteristics and inspection plans for components, subassemblies, and finished devices • Evaluate and disposition nonconforming materials and products used in design and clinical builds, to arrive at the most economical disposition, while meeting all quality system requirements • Lead development and implementation of quality system procedures and quality improvement processes (e.g. Design Verification, 6-Sigma, Risk Management, Process Control, etc.) • Own Product and Process Quality System procedures. Ensuring compliance with industry standards and effectiveness in business operations. • Train and develop less senior Quality Engineers in Design Quality Engineering methods • Comply with applicable FDA and international regulatory laws/standards and the Covidien Code of Conduct

item.description: Details: Auto Mechanics, accelerate your career with CarMax! We are currently looking for Night Time Technicians. If you want to work on a wide range of late-model vehicles with state-of-the-art equipment in a climate-controlled facility , we’ve got a great opportunity for you! We are seeking a skilled Automotive Technician to join our service team. At CarMax, we offer a fun, casual work environment which is one of the reasons we’ve been named one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For" nine years in a row. As a member of our team you will also enjoy competitive compensation , comprehensive benefits , flexible work hours , and discounts on cars, cellphones, travel, and more! So what are you waiting for? Get your career rolling on the road to success, apply today! Automotive Technician (Auto Mechanic) Job Responsibilities As an Automotive Technician you will be responsible for diagnosing and repairing domestic and foreign vehicles as well as performing preventative maintenance on them. Specific responsibilities: Examining vehicles, compiling estimates of repair costs, and securing customers' approval to perform repairs Repairing, overhauling, or adjusting automobile brake systems Troubleshooting fuel, ignition, and emissions control systems, using electronic testing equipment Repairing or replacing defective ball joint suspensions, brake shoes, or wheel bearings Tuning automobile engines to ensure proper and efficient functioning Installing or repairing air conditioners and service components, such as compressors, condensers, and controls Repairing, replacing, or adjusting defective fuel injectors, carburetor parts, and gasoline filters Removing and replacing defective mufflers and tailpipes

item.title: Buyer Assistant
item.description: Details: How would you like a unique career opportunity that can provide challenging work, a dynamic indoor/outdoor environment, career advancement, and a team of highly motivated people to help you succeed? You can have all of that when you work at CarMax! As a part of our CarMax store purchasing team, a Buyer Assistant is responsible for vehicle optioning and imaging for the CarMax website, securing purchased vehicles, completing visual vehicle inspections as a part of the vehicle transfer process and working with the purchasing team to hold on-site auctions. A Buyer Assistant will also work with other departments to ensure that the needs of the business are met.

item.title: Inventory Associate (part-time)
item.description: Details: Would you enjoy a job that has you working outside more than in? Do you want a professional opportunity that doesn't have you dressing in a suit every day? As a part-time Inventory Associate, you can enjoy a casual work environment in a team oriented, fast paced environment with a flexible work schedule to fit your busy life! Inventory Associate responsibilities include computerized tracking of inventory, receiving, staging and prepping inventory, quality control checks and facility and ground maintenance.

item.title: Nurse Practitioner
item.description: Details: Job is located in West Palm Beach, FL. In today’s rapidly-evolving health care landscape, no sector is experiencing more growth, or represents more opportunity for skilled nursing professionals than elder care. And with 30+ years of experience specializing in quality, compassionate care for seniors, MorseLife, in beautiful Palm Beach County, Florida, is the destination of choice for clinicians looking to make a real difference. Teamwork. Passion. Impact. Leadership. Quality of Service. These are more than just our guiding attributes. They’re the values shared by each member of our team – and the principles behind our success as a 5-Star, Gold Seal facility. If these describe you too, you may be an excellent match for our ARNP opportunity. SUMMARY Under the supervision of the PACE Medical Director, the selected candidate will provide care and treatment to patients served by the PACE program while in the home, the PACE center, and other health care settings. Responsibilities include: Coordinating with participant's referring/primary physician and serving as the primary care for participants once they are enrolled in the PACE program. Performing comprehensive history and physicals on new referrals. Providing informal clinical education and guidance to clinical staff and collaborating with team, patients and their families to assure quality care is given. Helping to secure medical records to better determine appropriate medical care for participants and managing compliance with medical records procedures, including accurate and detailed documentation, timely dictations, and signatures as required. Participating in 24 hour coverage as required to maintain 24 hour, 7 day/week coverage Serving in community and professional activities and leading specific projects Assisting in the development and implementation of written guidelines and protocols Managing PACE participants admitted to long term care facilities or acute inpatient facilities. to make home visits (a valid Florida driver's license and automobile insurance are also required). A career with MorseLife is more than just a job. Our work is challenging, and we embrace that. Our goal is to set a new standard for excellence – to touch lives, to surpass our patients’ expectations, and our own, at every opportunity. If you’re ready to discover and express your own Inner Greatness, we’re ready to hear from you. Apply now at www.morselifecareers.org !

item.title: Security Officer- St. Louis, MO
item.description: Details: Observes and reports activities and incidents at an assigned client site, providing for the security and safety of client property and personnel. Makes periodic tours to check for irregularities and to inspect protection devices and fire control equipment. Preserves order and may act to enforce regulations and directives for the site pertaining to personnel, visitors, and premises. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Controls access to client site or facility through the admittance process; assists visitors with a legitimate need to gain entry to the facility; screens visitors and client employees in an efficient manner in order to expedite their admittance to the site or facility. Provides an atmosphere in which all client employees and visitors know that the client responds to and cares about their needs; provides a courteous, respectful and pleasant interaction with each client employee and visitor as perceived from their point of view; presents a good image of the client and its security department. Communicates in a manner that is open, honest and responsive in all situations; to the extent authorized, provides information regarding the site and surrounding area as requested by visitors. Monitors entrances and exits; acts to prevent unapproved or unlawful entry; controls entrances, the movement of people and vehicles, and parking; operates a gate and examines vehicle contents; monitors remote entrances using closed circuit television; operates remote access devices; in a calm manner directs persons who cause a disturbance to leave the property. Patrols assigned site on foot or in vehicle; checks for unsafe conditions, hazards, unlocked doors, security violations, blocked ingress and egress, mechanical problems, and unauthorized persons; inspects buildings and grounds using appropriate equipment and protective gear. Protects evidence or scene of incident in the event of accidents, emergencies, or security investigations; sets up barriers and signage, and provides direction or information to others. Prepares logs or reports as required for site; writes and/or types reports and/or enters information in a computer using standard grammar; inspects security control logs and takes action as required. Observes and reports incidents or suspicious activity to client representatives, company management, life/safety personnel or public safety authorities as appropriate for the circumstances and/or as required by the site. Responds to incidents of fire, medical emergency, bomb threat, flooding, water discharge, elevator emergency, hazardous materials, inclement weather, and other incidents or conditions following procedures established for the site, by the company, and/or through training or certification.

item.title: Physical Therapist- Outpatient
item.description: Details: We are seeking a physical therapist for Carolina Orthopedics & Sports Medicine Specialists for a FT position at its busy outpatient clinic in Gastonia. Exciting opportunity. All outpatient orthopedics in a new location. Excellent salary plus bonus and full benefits.Please send resume with cover letter and salary requirements to or fax 888-848-2027.Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.

item.title: Team Lead
item.description: Details: Team Lead Our firm hones in on the development of entrepreneurial skillsets of motivated individuals. We believe in the power of encouraging driven minds to pursue a career in business in order to fulfill and surpass professional and personal goals and objectives. Our firm teaches skills in the fields of business development, business consulting, training and development of others, and sales and marketing. At Athena Marketing, Inc., we pride ourselves on the ability to satisfy the needs of our Fortune 500 clients while simultaneously putting the growth of our team members first by coaching, developing and mentoring throughout their career progression. Benefits: Professional, organized, and structured team environment Team Leads will be involved in our Management Training Program Learn how to lead a team and an office of entrepreneurs Ability to hone in on and further develop leadership skills without being micro managed Job Description: Conduct weekly team meetings Train other team leaders Plan and lead daily motivational meetings Provide coaching and mentoring to team members Sales, marketing, and consulting

item.title: Customer Service Representative
item.description: Details: The nation’s leading bath and shower system manufacturer is seeking an extraordinary Customer Care Representative. Someone who is truly passionate about people, product and customer care is the ideal candidate for the position. The Customer Care Representative will help deliver world-class customer care by developing client relationships while delivering critical product knowledge for our bath remodeling product. The Customer Care Rep is responsible for insuring customer needs and expectations are met. Customer Care Rep will also help to meet daily goals. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Communicate with customers via phone and email. Assist customers in a timely, prompt, and friendly manner. Provide knowledgeable answers to clients regarding product, pricing, and availability. Research and solve customer concerns and problems. Order processing in a fast paced environment. Communicate with other departments to resolve customers problems. Help clients navigate our website and e-commerce to place orders online. Contribute hard work to meeting daily, weekly, and monthly goals.

Acts to ensure that all property removal is conducted within appropriate policy requirements and in accord with client standards; identifies client products or materials among items carried by client employees or visitors. Carries out specific tasks and duties of a similar nature and scope as required for the assigned site.

item.title: Network Security Engineer - Cisco Practice
item.description: Details: We are looking for Senior Security Engineer- Cisco Practice to support our Fortune 500 client projects in east coast/mid-west region. This is a FTE opportunity with our managed services group. Please send resume with salary expectation and contact details to to be considered. Job Description: Sr Security Engineer (FTE opportunity). Candidate can be located anywhere in USA. Will be required to travel (around 30%) at client locations when needed and work from their home office for the remaining time. Responsibilities:Consult on, install, and configure Cisco Firewall, VPN, and other security solutions.Consult on, install, and configure the ISE software and integrate ISE software into MS Active Directory as well as verify the profiling, posturing, and guest services.Knowledge of ISE integration with TrustSec architecture is preferred but not required.Configure and verifying Profiling, Posturing, and Guest ServicesDevelop High Level and Low Level Designs for the Cisco solutionsDeploy Cisco security solutionsImplement Classification and Policy EnforcementRequired Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to apply concepts pursuant to Cisco Security Best Practices and numerous internal processes. Experience with the majority of the following Cisco products is required:Cisco's firewalls: ASA, FWSM Cisco's IPS/IDS solutions. Cisco's ACS and other authentication protocols, TACACS, RADIUSVPN solutions (IPSec, L2L, SSL, Any Connect) using Cisco's IOS or ASA platformsExpert troubleshooting skills with complex enterprise networksPreferred Qualifications:Cisco's NAC, ISE, CSMARS, Cisco's Prime a plusCisco's ISE implementation and delivery experience also a plusEducation and Experience: A bachelor's degree with focus in a related area or 2 years equivalent work experience is desired.

item.title: Bonefish - Restaurant Manager Now Hiring
item.description: Details: Bonefish Grill is now interviewing Restaurant Managers (RM) with Back-of-House experience. This includes all facets of restaurant operations. As a functional expert, the Manager is a member of the 3-4 member store management team. The RM, with limited supervision, is responsible for the daily operations of the kitchen, by providing professional leadership and direction to the culinary personnel by ensuring that all recipes, food preparations and presentations meet the restaurant's specifications and commitment to quality. In addition, the RM is also responsible for FOH activities such as POSI and front of house activities when working at Expo. Our Managers are the face of Bonefish Grill in our communities and is a key position in delivering on the Bonefish Grill experience. We offer competitive pay and a world class health, 401k, meal discount, and paid vacation time benefits. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to grow her/his career with a stable brand.

item.title: Business Sales and Marketing Representative- No Nights or Weekends! Full Time
item.description: Details: Job is located in Cary, NC. We are currently hiring for our business, sales and marketing Account Representative position! To apply for this position you must clearly demonstrate the following qualities: Great interpersonal skills, a sense of humor, and social competency Professional demeanor Effective and skillful communication skills Ambition, a strong work ethic, and an earnest willingness to learn Self-motivated desire to advance Flexibility and the ability to excel in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Ability to effectively collaborate and work in a team-based environment No prior sales experience is necessary, and we train our team to learn a variety of skills from sales and human resources to management and mentor-ship. We are looking for candidates that may be new to the workforce or who have work experience, but are willing to start from the bottom up in order to learn the complexities and opportunities within a new industry. You Must Be: FUN. Outgoing. Confident. Ambitious. Willing to work hard to accomplish your own goals and those of our team. Able to work in a team environment, both as a team member and as a leader. Looking for an entry-level position in marketing, advertising, and face to face sales. A great student with an open mind and sense of humor. Able to take (and maybe even tell) a joke. Someone who doesn't whine or make excuses. We provide full training for the right candidates. A four year degree is preferred but not 100% required for the right candidate. This position is paid on a combination of base, commission, and bonuses. Our sales and marketing firm is the leader in the sales and marketing industry and in tailoring customer service & sales to their needs. Our client wants us to deliver a face to face customer service experience. We do this by taking care of the existing customer base and providing personal care with new customers. Representing Fortune 100 clients, it is a priority for our team to provide the best customer service, professionalism, and to build, land, and maintain quality customer relationship. This job involves in person sales to business owners. This position offers a compensation structure where pay is based upon individual performance.

item.title: Lab Technician
item.description: Details: Position Summary: Currently seeking a qualified candidate for a full-time, permanent Lab Technician position in the Industrial Gas Turbine Industry. We Offer: $16.00/hr Bonus potential Benefit eligible on 1st day of month after 30 days employment 401k eligiible after 90 days employment 15 days paid time off plus 10 paid holidays per year Opportunity for advancement The responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Operate equipment for cutting, mounting, embedding and polishing for preparing the metallographic samples Test LPCS, APS, HVOF, PACK, CVD, stripping, brazing, welding, laser drilling and shaping technologies as directed Operate optical microscopy for analyses of materials Multitasking while performing prep work and analysis efficiently Conduct test on new consumable materials Manage the internal Laboratory warehouse Work with Engineers and other Managers on development projects Working in the Company’s Quality and Safety System context, in accordance with its procedures and requirements

item.title: Assistant Controller
item.description: Details: We are partnered with a solid company whose mission is to uncover the best of science and develop and deliver innovative and meaningful treatments to help people reach their life’s potential. This company is seeking strong candidates to fill an Assistant Controller job in San Diego, CA. As Assistant Controller you will report directly to the Controller with a dotted line to the CFO and Executive Leadership. You will need to have strong leadership skills and the ability to manage a small accounting team ranging from 2-4 subordinates at any given time. For the right candidate, my client will be paying up to $105K/year in base in addition to a strong benefit package. Key Responsibilities for the Assistant Controller job include: • Prepare account/bank reconciliations on a monthly basis • Produce monthly financial statements • Prepare journal entries and record in accounting system • Assist with monthly close • Calculate various monthly allocations • Periodic reviews of job cost data reports and project budget reports • Assist accounts payable with researching • Prepare updated job cost reports • Set up general ledger accounts for new projects • Perform operational analysis and financial forecasting • Prepare/process and review various weekly/monthly reports Minimum Requirements for the role: • Bachelor's degree in accounting, business, economics or a related field • CPA or CPA Candidate a must • Minimum of 3-5 years accounting experience. • Top tier public accounting firm required and industry experience preferred • Accuracy, analytical skills and attention to detail are required • Strong multi-tasking skills; must manage responsibilities under strict deadlines To be considered for the Assistant Controller job in San Diego, CA you will need to submit an updated version of your resume to Cara.K or by going to our website and applying online: www.parkerlynch.com.

item.title: Collections Manager
item.description: Details: COLLECTION MANAGER IN ATLANTA Job Description ●Time management for the assigned team to ensure completion of daily tasks.Reviews update and improve processes for efficiency ●Sets a positive example ●Leads by example. ●Motivates employees and maintains a team environment. ●Ensure all work is performed in compliance with Company / Client Policies as well as local state and federal collections laws and regulations ●Follows up with direct on-going collector training to exceed expectations ●Must possess a through knowledge of and hold staff accountable to all Federal State and local guidelines and laws. ●Responsible for progressive discipline of infringements of company policies procedures and/or standards. ●Perform monthly performance evaluations of team. ●Additional duties as assigned.

item.title: Payroll Manager - Raleigh NC
item.description: Details: PAYROLL MANAGER Our client is a pharmaceutical manufacturer with operations in the Raleigh-Durham area of NC. Reports to: Finance Department | Associate Director, Accounting Operations Purpose: To ensure accurate processing and recording of company’s payroll and provide timely and accurate financial information to various departments. Responsibilities: Perform daily payroll department operations Manage workflow to ensure all payroll transactions are processed accurately and timely Reconcile payroll prior to transmission and validate confirmed reports Understand proper taxation of employer paid benefits Interprets company policies and government regulations affecting payroll procedures. Process correct garnishment calculations and compliance Execute time and attendance processing and interface with payroll Ensures the scheduled deposit of state and federal withholding taxes and the timely preparation of state and federal payroll reports. Process accurate and timely year-end reporting when necessary Addresses and resolves payroll problems with employees Ensures timeliness of transactions and compliance with all Federal, State and Local tax jurisdictions. Develop ad hoc financial and operational reporting as needed Aid in 401K audit Maintain financial historical records by filing accounting documents Complete other tasks as assigned by department supervisor.

item.title: Customer Service | Sales | Entry Level - Full Time
item.description: Details: Do you enjoy talking with people and delivering SUPERB customer service? Determined Marketing, Inc. (Greensboro, NC), one of NORTH CAROLINA'S fastest growing privately owned and operated marketing and sales teams, is looking to fill ENTRY-LEVEL sales and marketing positions. Our team provides sales and client acquisition for Fortune 500 clients. This job involves in-person sales to retail customers. Customer service , sales, marketing, and/or customer retention experience is preferred. Determined Marketing's niche has been our ability to act as the liaison between our major clients and their customers. Through our unique, relationship customer service oriented approach we have been able to provide our clients tremendous results in the areas of customer service, retention, acquisition and increased market share. We pride ourselves on our competitive, but extremely friendly and family oriented work environment. Our culture promotes constant personal and professional growth, based on principles of respect, trust, and challenge. We are now striving to attract and train the most capable and skilled individuals to help us acquire new clients, grow into new markets and develop new campaigns. We provide full training and career advancement in this globally expanding industry. Determined Marketing reviews promotions based upon individual performance. Entry Level Client Managers are quickly promoted into leadership positions in which they are groomed for management. Customer Service / Sales / Customer Retention • Utilizing training materials in a meaningful way that ensures class graduates have a smooth transition into successful, professional Sales / Customer Service / Customer Retention position • Creating a positive, fun, and motivating environment to enhance employee performance and customer satisfaction. • Monitor individual progress to provide coaching opportunities and to understand employee developmental needs. • Participation in morning meetings including: role-play scenarios, product knowledge, and psychology of customer service behavior training. Customer Service / Sales / Customer Retention Position at Determined Offers: • Full Training • No glass ceiling • Free Parking • Compensation based on individual performance • Entry level career opportunities • An enjoyable working atmosphere • Travel opportunities • Our management training program offers an exciting opportunity for entry level candidates to learn all aspects of our business from the ground up. This is not a telemarketing or a call center position.

item.title: Detailer - 2nd Shift (3pm - 11pm)
item.description: Details: Position Summary: Currently seeking a qualified candidate for a full-time, permanent Detailing position in the Industrial Gas Turbine Industry. We Offer: $11.00/hr plus $1.00/hr shift differential Bonus potential Benefit eligible on 1st day of month after 30 days employment 401k eligiible after 90 days employment 15 days paid time off plus 10 paid holidays per year Opportunity for advancement Responsibilities: Prep-work, Sanding, Gritting, and taping of parts Assist Operators and perform duties as assigned by Production cell supervisor Assist Machine Operators Use calibrated instruments to perform critical measurements Enter data into electronic log books using Microsoft Excel/Word

item.title: CASHIER
item.description: Details: When is a job more than “just a job?” •When you know that you are making a difference in the lives of those around you •When you go to work every day looking forward to the day ahead of you •When the decisions you make on the job really matter to those whom you serve Cashier Whether your goal is to begin a fantastic full-time career or have a great part-time job, your talents will be valued and respected at Murphy USA. To be successful as a cashier, you need energy, an excellent work ethic, a great attitude and a smile. You will be the face of our company and deliver the legendary customer service that Murphy USA and our associates are known for providing. Your responsibilities will include: •Providing a prompt, efficient, and courteous customer experience •Responding and resolving customer’s requests and concerns •Assisting customers with purchases and fuel transactions •Operating cash register •Restocking merchandise •Performing job related duties as assigned A job is more than just a job when it’s a career at Murphy USA. Murphy understands that a career is about much more than a paycheck and benefits. That’s why we do our best to provide the most supportive and enjoyable atmosphere possible for our employees. Here are just a few reasons why Murphy USA is a great career choice: Enjoy your work! Murphy USA offers a fast paced environment where bright, talented individuals who are willing to work hard are valued and can make a difference. Flexible Schedule!
