item.title: Business Development Manager
item.description: Details: Nesco Resource is a leading national provider of Staffing and HR Solutions. Through our branch office network, we provide Engineering, IT, Industrial, Administrative and Accounting talent to clients across a wide range of industry sectors. We have a new location in Jeffersonville In which has an opening for a Business Development Manager. This position is responsible for new client business development in the Southern Indiana area focused on the temporary and direct placement for Nesco Resource. Primary responsibilities include client and prospect visits outside office. Responsibilities while inside office include market research, target account planning, cold calling into potential new clients and works to develop longterm, win-win relationships with those clients. If you have previous outside experience within the staffing industry or related service field please send us your resume. Nesco Resource is one of the fasting growing firms in the US and privately owned.

item.title: Automotive Technicians / Service Manager - All Levels
item.description: Details: If you are a seasoned Automotive or Alignment Technician, a student in Automotive Tech School, or a beginner with a high level of motivation, energy, and strong customer service skills, we are looking for you! Captain Kleen Speed Lube in Kennesaw, GA is looking for talented individuals to staff our brand new 5000 square foot 9 bay facility. Captain Kleen has been in business for over 6 years in Kennesaw and is currently in growth mode. Our new facility features separate Fast Lube, mechanical repair, and tire sales departments and is scheduled to open late December 2014. We are an independent shop that is coming to market with a new perspective of what a vehicle maintenance facility should be. We are professionals and maintain a friendly family atmosphere. We strive for excellence and quite frankly won’t accept less from our team. Instead of the bureaucracy that’s common at a dealership or large corporation, you will actually influence what happens in the shop, get treated like the professional that you are, and even have direct access to the owner on a daily basis. We are looking for staff members who will check their egos at the door and establish and maintain friendly relationships with all other team members. We squeeze in time for outside company functions and team building activities because we really want you to love your job. Our company core values and mission dictates that we tell our customers the truth 100% of the time, maintain professional and polite interactions with our clients, and deliver a service that’s superior to our “sell it no matter what” competition. If you have the right attitude and want a “position” rather than just a “job”, then you are exactly who we are seeking. As a new shop, we need all positions filled from Lube Techs and Junior and senior level technicians, alignment experts, all the way to experienced Service Managers/Writers. If you are currently in a tech school we can work with you. If you are best suited for an entry level lube tech position, we will train you. We are just as concerned about your commitment and attitude as we are about your technical skills. We want techs that will come and stay while growing with the company and obtaining more ASEs and we are committed to creating an environment that you will indeed want to remain in. We offer very competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package. Full and part time positions are available

item.title: Customer Service Rep 1
item.description: Details: Aerotek Professional Services is looking for Customer Service Representatives Candidates will be responsible for: -researching and resolving customer order issues post-order -resolve customer issues by issuing credits, charges, via a virtual register -very little interaction with customers by phone, and minimal written communication. -confirmation emails sent to our customers -taking customers calls or responding to emails Qualified candidates please apply today!! About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit Aerotek.com .

item.title: Customer Service Rep - Account Acquistion - Full Time
item.description: Details: Customer Service Representative Wanted Marketing, Sales, and Customer Service Consultants Responsibilities: Meet with new customers about growing their business Consistently meet the needs of current or perspective customers Serve as a liaison to the local community for the client Work closely with the client to facilitate good customer relations We Offer: Paid training and benefits Hands on Training in Face to Face Customer Service Management Development - Marketing & Sales Campaign Sales and Marketing Management - Fortune 500 Clients

item.title: Sr. Property Accountant
item.description: Details: A leading national real estate investment firm focused on acquiring, developing, and managing high-quality real estate is seeking strong candidates for a Sr. Property Accountant job in San Diego, CA. In this role you will have an opportunity to join a dynamic, growing and highly reputable company as they continue to expand their portfolio and presence throughout the United States. The ideal candidate for the Sr. Property Accountant job will have extensive experience preparing the financials for commercial properties. You will be offered a base salary ranging up to $90K/year based on skill set and background. The Sr. Property Accountant job will be responsible for: • Preparing and reviewing monthly/quarterly financial statements • Preparing journal entries for the GL • Perform variance analysis and timely reconciliation of general ledger and balance sheet accounts • Assist Asset Management and Property Management on all accounting, budgeting, reporting, collections, and accounting system matters • Assist external auditors with year-end audits on select properties • Assist external CPA with annual entity tax returns • Prepare lender reports monthly, quarterly, and annually for loan compliance. • Prepare state sales tax returns • Special projects and other duties as needed To be considered for the position you must meet these minimum requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance or a related field • Minimum of 3-4 years of industry experience required. • Yardi or MRI experience is highly preferred. • Must be a team-player having the ability to multi-task and is self-directed. • Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail. • Must be deadline focused, organized, and exhibit problem-solving skills. Able to handle multiple deadlines at the same time. If you believe you have the skills and background needed to successfully perform the Sr. Property Accountant job in San Diego, CA then I would highly encourage you to apply for the position. You can apply by sending an updated version of your resume to Cara.K or by going to our website: www.parkerlynch.com.

item.title: Inbound or Outbound Phone Sales - Call Center Jobs
item.description: Details: Earn up to $100,000 a year and over $100 per package sale! Hiring 30 Vacation Planners and more! Full Time | Day/Evenings Opportunities Available - You pick! Set schedules with weekends & holidays off! Also hiring Inbound Phone Sales (Call Transfer) & Owner Referral Associates! Apply Today for an opportunity to start 12/1! Are you ready to start your dream job by making others' vacation dreams come true? Marriott Vacation Club, part of the Marriott Vacations Worldwide family of brands, is a world premier vacation ownership organization with resorts at destinations around the globe. Join our call center sales team and help deliver unforgettable experiences that make vacation dreams come true. Call Center Vacation Planner Job Summary Introduce and promote the Marriott Vacation Club brand to sell vacation ownership preview packages over the phone. Answer questions about vacation destinations and Marriott Vacation Club resort facilities and services. This job involves checking the availability of accommodations and dates, and suggesting alternatives when the first choice is not available. Vacation Planner sales associates at the call center promote accommodation upgrades and extra nights to drive additional revenue when available. Clearly explain the requirements for purchasing a preview package and attending a vacation ownership sales presentation. Verify individuals or couples meet the Marriott Vacation Club eligibility requirements. Vacation planners leverage guest loyalty to the Marriott International and Marriott Vacation Club brands and to persuade callers to purchase the vacation ownership preview package. Confidently ask the potential owner to purchase the package. Use sales techniques to overcome objections while maintaining a polite and enthusiastic demeanor. Contact an appropriate call center individual, leader or department to resolve guest calls, requests, or problems.

item.title: Mortgage Underwriter
item.description: Details: Our Underwriting team provides our clients with the confidence of exceptional Underwriting and Operations expertise. Recovco Mortgage Management seeks to hire Mortgage Underwriters for our next Underwriting Team in our Denver, Colorado location. RECOVCO, headquartered in East Meadow, New York and with locations in Irving, Texas, Orlando, Florida, Las Vegas, Nevada, Denver, Colorado and Boston, Massachusetts; touches over 10,000 files per month, providing servicing solutions, valuations, quality control, due diligence, underwriting, end to end fulfillment, and auditing services that banks, mortgage companies and insurance companies utilize Recovco to ensure the loans of today and the past are pristine and free of possible repurchase issues and in compliance with all the new laws and regulations. Underwriter responsibilities include but are not limited to; Frontline underwriting origination, conducting credit risk reviews of retail and correspondent loans and apply needed conditions for mortgage submissions to assure loans meet program/product specifications. Executing an appraisal analysis to determine that acceptable collateral standards are met, while completing the necessary research to determine federal, state and company compliance. Communicating credit risk decisions to the partnering individuals within the company, correspondents, or borrowers. Achieving productivity standards and qualitative seller satisfaction targets. Performing due diligence quality review of underwriters, by providing a detailed review of retail and correspondent approved loans, including credit, income, and asset analysis and findings. Additional related duties may be assigned, as required.

item.title: Cook-Medical Facility
item.description: Details: LAST UPDATED: Nov 16, 2014 Quality Medical Facility is looking for a Part - Time Cook to join their Team This is a great opportunity for someone that is looking for 16 to 20 hours a week. The environment is first class, great hours and the team is ready to welcome you on board! You will prepare food for patients, cafeteria, and staff and be provided w/ detailed instructions, procedures and recipes. Your supervisor will orientate you to every aspect of the job. You will have help in understanding the recipes, paperwork, schedules, and dietary plans.. Required Qualifications: One year cooking experience in a volume feeding institution. Must be able to understand written directions or instructions written on the labels, charts, and schedules. General knowledge of cooking and equipment including, stoves, ovens, steamers, mixers, deep fat fryers, blenders, slicers, grinders, and a variety of other small cooking equipment. Must have the skill level to calculate and use measurements to prepare recipes and apply portion control guidelines Ability to learn established procedures for maintaining stock control through proper inventory and issue procedures. Experience using scales in order to check the accuracy of weights when issuing food Excellent Time Management Skills, Problem solving and sense of urgency are a must. (Salary Depends on Experience)

item.title: Risk Analyst (Senior)
item.description: Details: This is a technical analyst role. Must have experience retrieving, automating and protecting data on Microsoft based systems as well as build and analyze complex reports and dashboards to identify business risks and ensure company goals are met. Analyze data and anticipate risks based on knowledge of business trends. Propose solutions and course corrections as well as new processes, ideas and workflows. Analyze corporate data for integrity and implement solutions when necessary. Manage data within PCI standards and requirements.

item.title: Spanish Bilingual STAFFING DISPATCHER / Supervisor LEAD Full Time 7 DAYS A WEEK
item.description: Details: We are a reputable staffing agency that has been in business for 21 years, located in Bolingbrook IL (& other locations). We are searching for a Spanish Bilingual Dispatch/Supervisor for Bolingbrook. The hours are 4:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Monday-Friday, (until approx. 1:00 p.m on Wednesdays) & 3-4 hours on Saturday & Sunday (or until dispatching is complete). We need someone with dispatching/staffing experience, as well as supervisory experience to manage 2-4 people in the office. This position will be hourly to start, & then after 2-3 months move into a salaried position. Please send me your resume today. START DATE: ASAP!!

item.title: Distillation Process Engineer
item.description: Details: Client is a global specialty chemical company with multiple plant operation in the US. This plant located near Savannah, Ga.is a chemical complex that includes one of the largest refineries in the world of chemical intermediates. Due to a promotion and restructuring a need exists to add a distillation Chemical Process Engineer. Reporting to the Production Manager the Distillation Engineer will draw on her/his distillation unit operations experience to support the refinery manufacturing process in meeting department goals of yield, compliance to delivery schedule, quality, cost reduction and up time that includes compliance with all environmental and safety policies and procedures. The process engineer will also drive continuous improvement initiatives including reliability improvements and cost reduction projects.

item.title: Financial Reporting Analyst
item.description: Details: Financial Reporting Analyst Our client, a leading financial services firm located in Boston, MA, is seeking a Financial Reporting Analyst to join their team! In this role you will be responsible for preparing drafts of annual, semi-annual, and quarterly financial statements and forms for registered and non-registered investment companies. ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES Assist with problem solving and issue resolution; escalate issues to senior managers when appropriate Develop and maintain consistent familiarity with applicable laws, regulations and interpretation of governing financial statements and disclosure and maintain awareness of regulatory changes affecting funds Evaluate and suggest automation procedure enhancements to internal systems for financial reporting and compliance purposes Assist in reviewing completed work in regards to internal policies, procedures and systems Respond to and resolve routine client inquiries REQUIREMENTS/EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required; Accounting related concentration preferred 3+ years of mutual fund accounting or related mutual fund experience including prior financial reporting experience on mutual funds Excellent organizational and multitasking skills Strong aptitude for accuracy and attention to detail Strong communication and interpersonal skills Proven ability to problem-solve and work efficiently within a deadline oriented, client-driven environment

item.title: Accountant II
item.description: Details: ACCOUNTANT II - PART TIME - 1 DAY per week JOB SUMMARY: Executes a variety of accounting and financial functions. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Must be prepared to perform essential short term job duties of Accountant in the Accountant’s absence. Must be prepared to manage and execute payroll system functions associated with processing of payroll including timesheet review, data entry and verification, and submission of payroll hours and dollars data to payroll processing company. May also be required to perform additional payroll-related functions in a longer term absence of Accountant. Performs some routine accounting functions including the recording of cash receipts, preparation of bank deposits, maintenance of petty cash boxes, and invoicing of receivables. Performs some general ledger maintenance functions that may include bank transaction postings, accrual and adjusting entries, audits of account activity, and corrections of errors. May also include maintenance and troubleshooting associated with accounting software issues, monthly bank reconciliations, and closing of fiscal year functions. Assists with a variety of general financial, payroll-related, budget, and miscellaneous customized reports as needed. Assists with fiscal year end closing entries and workpapers including preparation of supporting documentation required by independent auditors. Assists with review of and verification of Audit Report numbers and assists in the preparation of supplemental information included with the Audit Report Assists with research, analysis, and calculations to determine budgeted revenues and expenses by account annually. Also performs some budget related calculations that may include expense allocations, Jesuit per diems, and budget to budget comparisons. Assists with preparation of budget-related reports Participates in the installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and upgrading of computer hardware and software. Also participates in maintaining procedures for highly detailed or key accounting/financial processes. Manages or assists with special projects that may involve financial analysis, research of equipment, furnishings, or software purchases, process analysis and revision, benefits related analysis, and any other projects that involve accounting or financial skills.

item.title: Maintenance Technician
item.description: Details: Asa Maintenance Technician you are responsible for the service and generalmaintenance including electrical, plumbing, A/C and heating systems,appliances, flooring, roofing, make readies/apartment turns, and ensuring thehighest level of resident satisfaction/customer service at all times. RequiredExperience •Oneyear or more maintenance technician experience in Property Management is required •Bi-lingualEnglish/Spanish required •HVACcertification preferred •Apositive and customer service oriented attitude •Self-starterwho demonstrates professionalism and can work independently •Mustbe able to perform plumbing, electrical, and HVAC repairs, as well as carpentryand painting, dry-wall repair, and snow removal •Respondto on-call emergencies •Maintainaccurate records regarding preventative maintenance, service requests,apartment make-ready status, work-in-progress, etc. •Excellentcommunication skills •Validdriver’s license Thisis a great opportunity to join a national company with excellent benefits. WorkSchedule: Monday through Friday, subject to change based on the need of theproperty. Rotating on-call duty required. ***Pleasenote: All candidates will be subject to a background check*** EOE

item.title: Manager, Equipment Engineering (W-S)
item.description: Details: COMPANY OVERVIEW: Herbalife is a global nutrition company that has helped people pursue a healthy, active life since 1980. Our nutrition, weight-management and personal care products are available exclusively through dedicated independent Distributors in more than 80 countries. Our Mission is to change people’s lives by providing the best business opportunity in direct selling and the best nutrition and weight-management products in the world. POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Manager, Equipment Engineering will provide management and implementation of activities relating to global Equipment Design/installation/integration Engineering and is responsible for improving operational unit cost control. This position manages the development and execution of equipment/process improvement/cost reduction, manufacturing processes, and packaging technology as well as Lean Enterprise activities in a regulated environment. Simultaneously, the position maintains and continuously improves equipment/operations on a consistent basis pursuant to corporate guidelines and policies. DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES: • Manage the Equipment Engineering operations on a global basis to include both owned and third party locations (when applicable). • Maintain/enhance “Best in Class/World Class” performance through implementation of key initiatives and strategies. • Ensure all corporate/regional procedures and policies are followed and in compliance to internal and external regulatory entities. • Provide direction on new equipment purchases and integration/installation plans as well as new construction opportunities globally. • Provide effective reporting for accountability to performance goals. • Perform and provide accurate data analysis to help drive management decisions to support existing/new initiatives. • Responsible for effective reduction of operational costs and cost of goods. • Participate in/develop programs for setting expectations/standards and to implement continuous improvement/cost savings activities. • Responsible to ensure full support to regional operations/marketing/sales to ensure that existing/new product needs are met in an expeditious manner. • Contribute and/or develop business continuity plans for manufacturing engineering operations. • Complete the construction, installation, commissioning, and validation of the process systems at Herbalife’s focus facilities. • Coordinate with Plant staff development and implementation of operator/maintenance training and SOPs, as well as establishing the required preventative maintenance procedures and policies. • Capture and institute engineering standards based on learnings from previous projects for use in future Herbalife Manufacturing projects.

item.title: Manager, Process Engineering (W-S)
item.description: Details: COMPANY OVERVIEW: Herbalife is a global nutrition company that has helped people pursue a healthy, active life since 1980. Our nutrition, weight-management and personal care products are available exclusively through dedicated independent Members in more than 80 countries. Our Mission is to change people’s lives by providing the best business opportunity in direct selling and the best nutrition and weight-management products in the world. POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Manager, Process Engineering will provide management and implementation of activities relating to global Manufacturing/Chemical Engineering operations. Responsible for improving operational unit cost control. This role will manage the development and execution of process improvement/cost reduction, manufacturing processes, and packaging technology as well as Lean Enterprise activities in a regulated environment. Simultaneously, the position maintains and continuously improves operations on a consistent basis pursuant to corporate guidelines and policies. DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES: • Manage the chemical engineering operations for powders, teas, liquids and tablets on a global basis to include both owned and third party locations (when applicable). • Maintain/enhance “Best in Class/World Class” performance through implementation of key initiatives and strategies. • Ensure all corporate/regional procedures and policies are followed and in compliance to internal and external regulatory entities. • Provide direction on new equipment purchases and installation plans as well as new construction opportunities globally, relayed to processes. • Remain current with new processing technologies applicable to the improvement of quality, cycle time, and cost. • Work in partnership with HLF Manufacturing, Technical Operations, and R&D in order to effectively scale up new formulations and specify processing equipment which is compatible with new formulations and the Manufacturing strategy of HLF operations. • Provide effective reporting for accountability to performance goals. Perform and provide accurate data analysis to help drive decisions to present to management to support existing/new initiatives. • Responsible for effective reduction of operational costs and cost of goods through optimization of manufacturing processes. • Participate in/develop programs for setting expectations/standards and to implement continuous improvement/cost savings activities. • Ensure full Process Engineering Support to regional operations, marketing, and sales to ensure that existing/new product needs are met in an expeditious manner • Participate in the development of business continuity plans for manufacturing engineering operations. • Complete the construction, installation, commissioning, and validation of the process systems at the HIMWS Facility. • Coordinate with Plant staff development and implementation of operator/maintenance training and SOPs, as well as establishing the required preventative maintenance procedures and policies. • Capture and institute engineering standards based on leanings from the HIMWS project for use in future Herbalife Manufacturing projects.

item.title: Technical Support Engineer
item.description: Details: Group: MCIS Clearance Level Needed: None Shift: Day Category: Systems Development Become an integral part of a diverse team that leads the world in Mission, Cyber, and Intelligence Solutions. At ManTech International Corporation, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement. As the Technical Support Engineer, you will review and manage support tickets and process and maintain customer orders. Responsibilities: • Provide customer service through phone calls, e-mails, and submitted support tickets. • Provide timely responses to, maintenance for, and updates to all support tickets. Create new support accounts, and verify existing accounts. • Provide Tier 1/Tier 2 technical support. Escalate technical issues to QA team or Engineering team • Process all new product orders, renewals, and evaluations. Maintain and update open order status. Coordinate with sales and accounting staff regarding orders and evaluations. • Create, review and deliver end of month customer issue reports. • Position Requirements: • 4+ years& experience in technical support role. • Ability to clearly articulate technical and business concepts. • Must be able to communicate with customers and internal departments at all levels. • Knowledge of customer service principles and techniques with the ability to analyze and interpret customer requirements, identify issues and problems, and offer appropriate action plans towards resolution. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Ability to write and execute comprehensive software test plan. • Experienced in all phases of the software development life cycle. • Knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems (Win 7, Vista, Win XP, Server 2008), especially in the areas of the installation and uninstallation of programs, registry settings, and the Windows installed programs environment. Desired Skills • Degree in a technical field: Computer Science or Engineering is a plus. • Interpersonal skills to interact with customers and team members • Organization skills to balance and prioritize work • Analytical and problem solving skills • Ability to work in a team environment Security Requirements: US Citizenship, Green Card Holder or Permanent Resident. Must be willing to undergo standard background investigation

item.title: Commercial Security Alarm Technician
item.description: Details: Top Three Skills: 1) Commerical or small business security alarm installation experience. 2) Low voltage security wiring but at the minimum low voltage wiring i.e. cat5/6 cabling in a Commercial or Business setting. 4) HUGE PLUS - fire panel experience Job Description: ADT is currently looking for three security installation technicians that have experience with commercial/business low voltage wiring and alarm install. Candidates must possess experience pulling wire, pre-wiring and trimming cables, tying up cables neatly, and running wire to the field devices and not afraid of heights. TEKsystems will get this individual licensed as a "Burglar Alarm Installer" in the state of TX if they are not already licensed. Additional Information: Candidates need to have basic cabling tools and reliable transportation. DO NOT NEED FIRE LICENSE BUT KNOWLEDGE OF FIRE PANEL! Work Environment: Field environment. Technicians are responsible to start the day at the office to get their job orders for the day. From there they will be out in the field at businesses. EVP: By working with ADT the installer will gain insight to programming and working with some of the most technological security systems on the market provided to residential customers. Technical Environment: Security panels, access control, CCTV, surveillance Non-Technical Skills: Communication is very important along with reliability an adaptive personality, and problem solving. Hours of OT Anticipated: 5-10 About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: QA Lead
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 01500-9710940 Classification: Quality Assurance Associate Compensation: DOE Robert Half Technology has the perfect opportunity for a Technical QA Lead looking to take the next step in their career! This is the perfect chance for a talented QA Lead to mentor and work on initiatives on a maturing team with a well-respected mid-sized company that emphasizes work/life balance. The ideal QA Lead will have exceptional communication skills as a primary focus in this role will be to help transition existing analysts into a more traditional QA role. A strong background in manual testing working with Quality Center or ALM is a must as this QA Lead will spend about half of their time doing manual testing utilizing ALM (mostly functional and UAT testing) and will spend the rest of their time leading and mentoring both onshore and offshore resources. Come work for a thriving organization that makes their employees the priority! Benefits include a bonus up to ten percent paid bi-yearly, flexible hours, Friday afternoons off, and a competitive salary! For immediate consideration, email resumes confidentially to Kristen Williams, Lead Recruiter, at K today!

item.title: Lead Commercial Services Technician
item.description: Details: This technician will be an installation tech for ADT's Commercial customers. Technician will work mon-fri and will be supporting Dallas/Fort Worth area and will only need to come into the office once a week to load inventory and drop off customer paperwork. ADT Contract technicians typically are assigned jobs based on where they live and will work in and around the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Technician needs to have previous experience doing commercial security installation, troubleshooting, and testing of the systems and panels. The desired candidate will have previous experience with troubleshooting security monitoring systems in small and large businesses. Some of these responsibilities include CCTV, surveillance cameras, access control systems, card readers, motions, strobes, smoke detectors, and wireless keypads.(Fire Certification Highly Desired.) The technician will be acting in a lead capacity and will need to be able to instruct a job helper at times while working as an "all in one" technician. At times this person may be running inspections on fire systems as well so a Fire Alarm License is required to perform this work. This candidate must be comfortable driving their own vehicle as they will not be provided a service vehicle. Desired candidate needs to have a mechanical aptitude and an adaptive personality. Technician must maintain required inventory levels as inventory is collecting once a week from the ADT office and the technician is responsible for the inventory for the entire week. Inventory counts are on a monthly basis. Technician can be dispatched from home or office based on where the job is and what parts are required for job. Training: This technician will train for a few week on "ride a-longs" with current full time ADT commercial technicians. Nice to have: "fire alarm license", Experience with Surveillance camera installation or "Pulse systems", and programming of security panels (All brands). About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Representative – Customer Relations Center (at Central Maine Power (CMP)
item.description: Details: CLICK HERE TO BEGIN THE APPLICATION PROCESS! Company: Central Maine Power (CMP) Department: Customer Service Job Title: Representative – Customer Relations Center Reports to: Manager – Customer Relations Center Location: Augusta, ME Cross Company Responsibility: None CLICK HERE TO BEGIN THE APPLICATION PROCESS! Description Scope of Work - Main duties, settings, geography, reporting relationships, other relationships: Handles all phases of customer inquiries received by telephone or by correspondence (written or electronic); processes applications for service and extension of facilities. Responds to customer inquiries and complaints (i.e. bill payment, usage inquiries, account updates, service, credit and collections) in a customer focused manner. Responds to maintenance concerns and emergencies during storm restoration. MAJOR ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (Scope of work - range of responsibilities): 1. Adheres to procedures and policies, which include regulatory guidelines (customer may include: attorney, collection vendors, and/or insurance companies). item.title: Nurse RN or LPN
item.description: Details: Hiring for first, second, and third shifts. Direct Supervision • Directs and supervises the daily work assignments of the Resident Care Assistants • Is the first point of contact for the care associates regarding assignment questions or concerns. • Closely mentors, guides and directs the Lead Resident Care Assistants in all aspects of their job. Resident Care • Coordinates care needs with community providers via an effective case management process • Measures and accurately records vital signs (temperatures, pulse, respiration, blood pressure weight and height) where appropriate as per state regulations • Effectively balances service demands with supporting resident independence • Accurately assesses, communicates, and documents residents’ status • Observes and reports any significant changes in resident behavior and health to the DON, physician, family, RCA’s, and Executive Director per state regulations • Successfully implements the plan of care • Recognizes and assists in the prevention of elder abuse, neglect, and exploitation (financial and other) and reports to appropriate sources per state regulations • Responds to emergencies and personal emergency response system and knows when to call for backup • Effectively handles difficult resident behaviors • Reacts calmly and effectively in emergency situations

item.title: Heavy Duty Truck Shop Manager / Supervisor
item.description: Details: Louisville’s # 1 Fleet Repair / Maintenance Shop Truck Shop Manager / Supervisor Excellent Pay and Benefits Package!! Are you looking for a rewarding new career with an established and well respected company? At Nationwide Truck Service we understand that our employees are our greatest asset. We treat our Team Members with politeness and respect which facilitates a great working atmosphere. If this sounds inviting, then your owe it to yourself to send us your resume or call to schedule an interview. Job Responsibilities: Serving customers is a key to success in this position. Combining your in-depth repair knowledge with your exceptional people skills, you'll manage customer relationships and frequently serve as a liaison between technicians and customers. You'll also select, coach, lead, train and supervise vehicle technicians while assisting with the purchase of parts, materials and equipment. Daily Responsibilities: 1. Create and assign work orders to our technicians and manage the entire repair process. 2. Ensure safe work practices are followed and work closely with other branch team members to create an efficient, safe service operation. 3. Ensure we perform high quality repairs on time and on budget. 4. Ensure outstanding customer service. 5. Ensure a positive, productive work environment. Provide a positive and constructive feedback to team members. Assists employees in correcting job-skill deficiencies. 6. Create customer repair estimates. 7. Assist Technicians in Identifying and resolving difficult technical problems.

item.title: Commercial Technician Helper
item.description: Details: ADT is currently looking for security installation technicians that have experience with commercial/business low voltage wiring. Someone who can pull wire, pre-wire and trim cables, tie up cables neatly, and run wire to the field devices. This person will be onsite to help and support the lead service technician with whatever he needs to complete the security installation. For safety most jobs need two techs present to help with ladders/lifts, etc. The majority of this persons job will be pulling wire, hanging conduit, and hanging cameras, and supporting lead with terminations. TEKsystems will get this individual licensed as a "Burglar Alarm Installer" in the state of TX. This is a great opportunity for a commercial cable technician to learn security installation business and transition to higher paying roles in the security installation/service field! This technician will be paired up with a full-time TEK security lead technician. Some days they may start a job with a differnet technician and/or some days they may go back to a site to pull all the cable on an existing job. This technician will be driving their own vehicle and using their own tools. Requirements for the job: 1) (10 year background check lived/worked/educated, and a lab based drug test). This person will need to be able to pass an FBI fingerprint check as they'll be getting a security license. 2) Preferred experience with low voltage security wiring but at the minimum low voltage wiring i.e. cat5/6 cabling in a Commercial or Business setting. 3) Someone with a good work ethic and is reliable. This is a Monday to Friday 8-5pm schedule supporting jobs in the Dallas metro area. It is a great chance to get started with a great company! About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Home Furnishing Sales Coworker - Market Place
item.description: Details: ABOUT THE JOB An IKEA co-worker’s main task is to maximise sales and profitability in his/her area of responsibility using knowledge of the IKEA product range, local market conditions and the needs of customers. No other position in the IKEA store is more hands-on in terms of customer contact. Together with thousands of colleagues around the world you will help to ensure the continued global success of the IKEA Concept – a concept that serves millions of satisfied customers each day. YOUR ASSIGNMENT Your tasks will include: Maximising sales and profitability by ensuring your area of responsibility is clean, tidy, fully stocked and correctly priced. You also ensure your products are in perfect condition at all times. Being passionate about the products you sell and actively learning about their features and benefits. You then want to share this knowledge with customers and colleagues. Actively approaching customers who you see need additional help, and advising them on the best solutions for their homes in order to sell more. Preparing your area of responsibility for stock replenishment and next day’s business. Understanding your department’s action plans, and supporting the goals and targets set by your manager. YOUR PROFILE Your knowledge, skills and experience include: You are confident about approaching and talking to people in a polite and friendly manner. You are enthusiastic about working with others in a team. You have a flexible approach to work and are open to change. You have an interest in home furnishing and people’s everyday life at home. You can prioritise and organise your own work to make efficient use of your time. GROWING TOGETHER IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global marketplace. And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.

item.title: Operations Administrator
item.description: Details: Description: This full time position will be trained to process payables,process and reconcile the corporate Amex credit card transactions that willneed to be completed on a weekly basis, travel expenses, check requests, andPurchase Orders to assist meeting the month end close deadline. Responsibilities: Creates purchase orders for the acquisition of material and subcontracted services. Match invoice prices/quantities and specific terms to purchase order when invoices are received. Prepare Accounts Payable Vouchers, entering and processing approved vendor's invoices, subcontractor's invoices, employee Travel Expense Reports, and Reimbursement check requests for AVT and sister company SimStaff. Answer all A/P vendor, subcontractor inquiries. Responsible for weekly filing of all check payments and stamp "PAID" clients invoices for payments received. Process and maintain VAT claims. Apply check payments to customer invoices. Print payment notifications from "My Invoice" government website and apply payment to customer invoices. Verify "pay when paid invoices" to pay subcontractors once payment has been received by the Government. Record non AR Misc. Receipts. Identify delinquent accounts and notify Contract Administrator. Support transition from Deltek FMS to Microsoft NAV System Staffing/Hiring Payroll HR benefits data processing Proposal Cost and pricing Establish and Maintain Corporate Policies & Procedures ISO Certification, CMMI processes Employee relations, policies & procedures.

item.title: Full-Time Dining Room Server
item.description: Details: POSITION: Server FLSA Status: Non-exempt RELATIONSHIP The Server reports directly to the Dining Services Director. PURPOSE The Server serves food and beverages to residents in accordance with established Benchmark policies and procedures. S/he performs duties under the direction of the Dining Services Director, to assure that quality food service is provided to meet the needs of the residents. PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Accountability Demonstrates attention to detail Administration & Training Completes Benchmark forms, reports, etc. as required. Attends in-service programs, seminars, and workshops as directed. Must attend two hours of orientation. Assists the Community Sales Team, led by the Executive Director, with sales and marketing programs and initiatives Communication Advises supervisor when supplies diminish for reorder Communicates effectively with supervisor and kitchen staff Food Service Takes food and beverage orders from residents and serves meals on a timely basis that are both presentable and appetizing in appearance. Sets up and delivers meal trays and food carts to the dining room as instructed. Handles requests from residents who require assistance with meal selection or have specific needs. Serves well-presented meals on a timely basis Sets up dining room for the next scheduled meal. Performs other general server duties as assigned. Equipment & Supplies Assists in inventorying supplies. Obtains or replenishes necessary dining room supplies before the next scheduled meal. Checks room service trays before distribution. Public Relations / Marketing Represents the community with a positive attitude and pride when interacting with potential residents and families Develops and practices the “30-second commercial” and uses it to greet visitors Safety & Sanitation Follows safety regulations and precautions at all times. Follows established Infection Control procedures when performing daily tasks. Ensures that all food service areas are maintained in a clean and safe manner by assuring that necessary equipment and supplies are properly maintained. Reports all hazardous conditions and equipment to your supervisor. Reports all accidents to the Dining Services Director or the Executive Director. Disposes of food and waste in accordance with established policies. Assists in daily or scheduled cleaning duties Cleans tables, chairs, refrigerators and freezers, etc. Carries soiled dishes, cups, glasses, and utensils to proper storage areas. Keeps work areas clean, dry, and free of food, beverages, etc. Returns used food trays from food carts, dining room, etc., and delivers to the dishwashing area.

item.title: Production Supervisor
item.description: Details: Wanted: Bold thinkers. If you thrive in a challenging environment and are attracted to the opportunities available in a global company, APC may be the place for you. We are looking for bold thinkers who can help us incubate new ideas and develop innovative products that will improve the lives of animals worldwide. The APC story began in 1981 when scientists identified the powerful role functional proteins play in helping support and maintain normal immune function in piglets. Inspired by this discovery, we were first to initiate research on the benefits of plasma-derived functional proteins for animal nutrition. Since then, APC has grown into the world's largest producer of functional proteins. Today we are a leading manufacturer of high-quality ingredients and complete, user-ready products that optimize animal nutrition. APC has an immediate opening for a Production Supervisor (1st shift) to join our Sublette, Kansas operations. Under the direction of the Plant Manager, this position will supervise and coordinate production team members and their work activities, ensuring the safe production of a quality product processed in accordance with mandated and established company procedures. JOB DUTIES: Production Process Knowledge and ability to analyze forecast and plan production objectives. Coordinate production area workflow including: The unloading and blending raw products. Packaging the raw product. Maximize production efficiencies and machine utilization Troubleshoot the production process including: Assist maintenance/utility person with repairs on equipment/machinery breakdowns or notify appropriate personnel to coordinate outside repair services. Ensure the flow of production, redirecting production employees to areas of the process needing immediate attention. Work with employees to ensure we are maximizing our yields with all products by conducting formal and thorough inspections of the plant. Identify potential yield improvements that can be made at the plant, necessary changes needed to implement the improvement, and work with the Plant Superintendent and Manager to quantify cost and an implementation timeline once approval is granted. Check to make sure the system is running to its full potential and, if not, bring it to the Superintendent or Plant Manager’s attention so the issue can be evaluated and a solution implemented. Ensure that all raw product and finished product inventories are accounted for on your shift and that the corresponding paperwork is completed for quality control tracking purposes. Utilize an accurate tracking/paperwork system to ensure that the oldest product is run first. Training & Development Provide safety training, including all mandated sanitary policies and regulations, according to established procedures. Conducts and provides Quality and Production training for production personnel. Coach team members in areas identified as weaknesses on the performance review. Management Responsible for the discipline of production personnel according to company policies and procedures. Maintain a clean production area for safe working conditions. Ability to work in a team environment and implement continuous quality improvement. Willingness and ability to assist in other work related areas as requested. Ability to remain calm and professional during peak periods. Ability to maintain good employee work ethic and provide a positive attitude among employees. Provide Plant Superintendent with input for hiring production personnel and work performance evaluations. Assist with team member performance evaluations. Attend all Supervisory and Safety meetings at the designated times. Comply with and ensure team member compliance with APC’s Respectful Work Environment policies as well as all other company policies.

item.title: BI/DW Lead
item.description: Details: Lead BI System and Data Warehousing JOB DESCRIPTION 1. Full functional knowledge of BI Systems and Data Warehouse concepts, development, and design 2. Provides technical expertise to the development and implementation of solutions using basic dimensional modeling techniques. 3. Ability to develop and support data extracts, data transfers, and load jobs 4. Development of ETL solutions for legacy and new development from multiple sources (internal transactional databases, external daily transaction files from suppliers, Authorize.net API, etc.) including database tuning 5. Provide business expertise for the development of Business Intelligence solutions. 6. Provides technical support for existing Data Warehouse ETL processes. 7. Assures quality of design and implementation of projects. 8. Trouble-shoots application software/hardware problems as they apply to design, implementation, or installation activities. 9. Team up with business owners and internal counterparts in order to successfully identify requirements and employ technical and analytical solutions. 10. Must also have development experience with one or more of the following languages: php, Java, python, Linux Shell 11. Experience with hosting services in the cloud and integrating with AWS. 12. Experience with Agile processes and methodology. 13. Schedules and coordinates application maintenance activities. 14. Researches, evaluates, and tests new software and DW related tools and facilities as they pertain to the existing DW environment and applications. 15. Monitors current DW applications and develops procedures, where necessary, to improve the DW environment as required. 16. Identifies and supports quality improvement initiatives and evolve current DWH platform and maturity model 17. Performs other assignments to comply with the corporate purpose and mission to add business value, increase revenue, decrease costs, improve productivity, and support the strategic initiative/directive. 18. Complies with all security and audit standards. 19. Creates scripts to automate the reconciliation of data from different sources and reports 20. Supports and mentors business owners to use tools and create reports through third party reporting tools JOB REQUIREMENTS 1. item.title: Director of Labor, Market and Statistics
item.description: Details: Our client is seeking a Director of Labor, market and analysis. The individual selected will manage the production, analysis, and delivery of Florida’s official labor market statistics such as employment, unemployment, and wage data. • Works cooperatively with the U.S. Department of Labor, Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) and the Employment and Training Administration (ETA) to meet over 300 federal contract deliverables. • Oversees 60 staff members with a budget of almost $5 million. • Participates actively within the federal/state cooperative statistical system with other states, the Workforce Information Council (WIC), policy councils, work groups, the LMI Institute, the Analyst Resource Center (ARC), the Projections Managing Partnership (PMP), the Estimates Delivery System (EDS), the Census Bureau’s Local Employment Dynamics (LED), and the National Association of State Workforce Agencies (NASWA). • Provides data and analysis for the Governor’s Office, the Legislature, the DEO Executive Director and Communications offices. • Works closely to meet the data needs of CareerSource Florida, the 24 regional workforce boards, Enterprise Florida, local Economic Development Councils (EDCs), the Florida Chamber of Commerce, the Florida Economic Development Council (FDEC), and Education (the university and college systems, post-secondary education, and private post-secondary institutions). • Prepares monthly press releases and supporting documents to release new labor statistics to the media; prepares responses for media requests; and hosts press conferences, as needed. • Demonstrates strong customer service values in terms of response time, meeting due dates, and data accuracy. • Makes public presentations serving as a keynote speaker at conferences, workshops, and before the Legislature. • Improves and enhances internet data delivery applications for labor statistics; continues to build, enhance, and market the new Occupational Supply/Demand system. • Promotes state capacity building through training, interaction, and outreach with other states and partner organizations; promotes strong software skills and analytical capabilities of staff.

item.title: Manager Trainee- FULL TIME
item.description: Details: Manager Trainee Program No matter if someone wants to pursue a career in Leadership, Coaching, Office Management, Financial Management, etc.; everyone is required to complete the first two phases of our entry level program. The first two phases build a foundation of skills and provides thorough training on proper systems. ______________________________________________ Presentation/Communication and Self-Management Skills As our clients and customers to our ever growing plate, we train our entry level team on the basics of account management; professional presentations, negotiation and persuasion to make them more effective leaders. The foundation of leadership is communication, this phase is a mix of textbook, classroom and hands-on training; giving anyone an opportunity to learn the proper systems to consulting. Leadership, Delegation and Management Skills The demand for our services requires that everyone in our company learn the fundamentals of leadership long before learning management techniques and procedures. An organization is only as strong as its leaders. We use a wide variety of resources from seminars, textbooks, expert trainers and guest lecturers coupled with hands on application opportunities to develop a well-rounded “Executive Ready" partner. Business Management and Executive Training Now that someone knows our business, how to teach train and develop; it’s time to learn the business end of things. At this level someone is put into a position to work directly with Fortune 500 Clients. They will be trained on the basics of Corporate Finance, payroll, human resources, public relations, web design, graphic design, and brand development. After the training is complete we will figure out which career track will be most exciting to the candidate and beneficial to the team.

item.title: Big Data Developer
item.description: Details: The Big Data Developer works closely with the Big Data / Solution Architect and Data Analytics staff and the support staff of enterprise applications to create specific designs for the linking or movement of data between various enterprise applications and the DW environment. The Big Data Developer should be very familiar with the capabilities of relevant Hadoop tools, be they specialized tools (e.g. Pig, Hive, Map Reduce, etc), data integration methodologies and tools, (MS SSIS, Informatica, Datastage, etc), generic database functionality (Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server, etc) and also the techniques for dealing with various Big Data structures. The Big Data Developer will perform or work with: * Business Analyst(s) to understand informational requirements * Data Administrator and Data Stewards to understand information quality definitions and expectations of end users * Data Modeler and Database Designer in the design of target environment data structures * Business System and Data Analyst to understand source system data and structures * Detail design of source to target data mappings * Review proposed mappings with relevant personnel, e.g. Business Analyst, Data Stewards, Business System and Data Analyst * Generate detailed design documentation for the source-to-target transformations * Create test scenarios and be responsible for their execution * Support the efforts of the Data Staging Developer(s) * Work with enterprise application integration personnel to anticipate and resolve data integration issues across applications and technical infrastructures Responsibilities: * Ability to understand complex business requirements/business goals/drivers and drive solutions aligning to technology strategy * Responsible for solutions to be implemented on large data warehouses and proven leadership in providing robust solutions for Analytics, Predictive Analytics, Pattern Recognition, Data Mining, Reporting, Web Analytics and Metadata Management * Develops solution alternatives to meet business needs and considers the costs and risks associated with each alternative * Ensures solutions developed within a domain have been properly implemented in accordance to the agreed upon application architecture. Sets direction for large complex projects and establishes technical solutions for IT project teams * Acts as the subject matter expert for the technology used in the domain to address application integration and infrastructure framework related questions * Prepares and writes request for proposals; evaluates vendor offering to determine if contract, hardware or software meets quality and cost standards * Work with Data Administrator and Data Stewards to understand information quality definitions and expectations of end users * Work with Data Modeler and Database Designer in the design of target environment data structures * Work with Solution Architect(s), Information Analyst(s) and other team members to understand source system data and data structures * Create and maintain detail design of source to target data mappings * Review proposed mappings with relevant personnel, e.g. Business Analyst, Data Stewards, Business System and Data Analyst * Generate detailed design documentation for the source-to-target transformations * Create test scenarios and be responsible for their execution * Support the efforts of the Data Staging Developer(s) * Work with enterprise application integration personnel to anticipate and resolve data integration issues across applications and technical infrastructures * Ability to communicate with EIT and Business Leaders Qualifications: * Business and system analysis and design fundamentals * Working knowledge of agile and waterfall delivery methodologies * Ability to exploit new opportunities and mitigate potential risks * 3+ years of working experience with data profiling concepts and tools such as: Informatica Data Explorer; SQL Server SQL Profiler; Business Objects Data Insight * 3+ years of working experience with ETL and Business Intelligence Reporting Tools such as: Microsoft SSIS; Informatica Power Center; IBM Datastage; SAP Business Objects; Pig & Hive * 2+ years of experience with Big Data technologies - HortonWorks Hadoop, Pig, Hive, MapR, Oozie, Ambari, etc * 4+ years of working experience developing solutions with Java * 3+ years of experience with data architecture, data modeling and data cleansing * High level understanding of XML schema and database structures, theories, principles and practices and development methodologies (e.g. RUP, UML) * Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) * Microsoft Excel knowledge to include pivot tables, graphs and presentation layers * Experience designing end to end maintenance and storage strategies for corporate reference data About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Financial Representative - Dunwoody, GA
item.description: Details: Adherence to business ethics, honesty and integrity Are you looking for a career in which you can improve people's lives, one that can also be financially rewarding? Are you looking for a career that allows you to balance your professional and personal life, giving back to your community? Are you looking for a career that affords you continual professional growth, ever increasing your knowledge base? AIG Financial Network, the Career Distribution division of AIG Life and Retirement, may just have the right opportunity for you. We are expanding operations and looking for qualified individuals to sell, market, and service our superior, differentiated insurance products to existing clients and new customers. Prior sales or insurance experience is not required for this position. We provide comprehensive, high quality training programs that prepare our representatives for success. We also provide financial assistance while attaining required insurance licenses and/or securities registrations. Our mission is to be the industry's premiere Career Distribution firm in the United States. Primary Responsibilities * Identifying and qualifying sales leads generated from a variety of sources, including networking, referrals, marketing, cold-calling, and lead databases * Setting appointments and meeting with prospective customers and business owners in their homes, places of business, or other settings * Presenting and explaining our products and services using a consultative sales approach, based on a true understanding of clients' needs and goals * Watching over clients' interests, monitoring performance and making adjustments to adapt to changing markets or the client's evolving needs * Attend continuing education sessions, designed to teach changing industry trends, new products, services, or market opportunities Competencies Needed * Adherence to business ethics, honesty and integrity * An entrepreneurial spirit * Serving your local community on one or more fronts (involvement) * Persuasion and influencing skills * Excellent presentation and public speaking skills * Ability to manage your own performance effectively; ability to deal with ambiguity and overcome obstacles * Ability to develop trusting relationships with a wide variety of individuals As a Financial Representative, you must have outstanding customer service skills, enjoy working in a sales environment, as well as possess strong communication and active listening skills. We are looking for ambitious individuals that are sales driven, self-motivated and have a positive attitude. Additional requirements include: * Minimum of 5 years successful full-time work experience in professional, sales or executive level occupation * High school diploma or equivalent (GED) required; Bachelor's degree with concentration in business discipline (Marketing / Finance / Accounting) preferred * Valid state driver's license with reliable, insured transportation * Strong organizational skills and attention to detail * Personal computer literacy; MS Office proficiency * Ability to obtain or currently possess an active Life/Health license About AIG American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading international insurance organization serving customers in more than 130 countries and jurisdictions. AIG companies serve commercial, institutional, and individual customers through one of the most extensive worldwide property-casualty networks of any insurer. In addition, AIG companies are leading providers of life insurance and retirement services in the United States. AIG Property Casualty is a global market leader, one of the few truly global property casualty franchises. AIG Life and Retirement is one of the largest life insurance organizations in the U.S., and provides protection, investment and income solutions needed for financial and retirement security. United Guaranty Corporation is the marketplace leader in mortgage insurance in the U.S. Additional information about AIG can be found at www.aig.com | YouTube : www.youtube.com/aig | Twitter : @AIG_LatestNews | LinkedIn : www.linkedin.com/company/aig

item.title: Business Analyst
item.description: Details: Seeking a Functional Analyst with IBM Emptoris experience. This is a contracted position that will move into the early part of 2015 with strong chance of an extension. GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES: The primary role of the IT System/Business Analyst is to translate business requirements into technical specifications, maintain relationships with the business, and drive standard business processes across the IT Enterprise. The IT BA should have an understanding of business priorities and the relative importance of their projects. This analyst is able to identify multiple approaches to problem solving and recommend the best case solution. A BA must conduct thorough business process analysis to understand existing workflows and systems, document current processes and systems, create requirements for new processes, develop use cases, and manage requirement changes. Furthermore, an IT BA must possess strong technical acumen with the ability to translate information and research into non-technical language as necessary to effectively communicate across teams. SPECIFIC DUTIES, ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: * Interact with Project Managers from multiple organizations to track project progress, identify risks, communicate risks and status, and assess potential impacts to the business. * Maintain project documentation such as project lists, project status reports and budget * Proactively develop and maintain technical knowledge in specialized area(s), remaining up-to-date on current trends and best practices; leverages expertise to produce solutions that enable global consistency and standardization and facilitate exceptional performance * Translate requirements, produce feasibility reports and design solutions to improve productivity and efficiency * Maintain regular contact with clients. Coordinate and report on project progress, obstacles and accomplishments * Manage requirement changes. * Collaborate with Quality Control, Project Managers, and Technical Leads to ensure Business acceptance. * Develop use cases as a key communication tool between the business and technical teams. * Document current & future state assessments. * Create and maintain functional models, process flows, and wire-frame diagrams. POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Education Requirement: * Bachelor's Degree in a Computer Science, Business or related discipline preferred Qualifications / Skills Requirements: * Ability to communicate free of technical language to the business and end-user * Demonstrate strong analytical and project management skills * Demonstrate IT knowledge and expertise in the areas being developed or enhanced. * Strong collaboration, multi-tasking and organization skills. * Strong oral and written communication skills. Demonstrate ability to speak English fluently and clearly * Demonstrate thorough knowledge of the industry and trends * Minimum of 2years related experience required * Expert skills in Microsoft standard desktop applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Exchange, Visio, Project * 40 hours of training (supplier provided) * Demonstrated expertise in iRise may be required for certain project work. * Demonstrated expertise in Rational toolset may be required for certain project work About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Donation Ambassador
item.description: Details: Job Title: Donation Ambassador Department: The Habitat Store Reports To: Store Manager FLSA Status: Non-exempt Summary Drives truck with capacity under 3 tons to transport donated materials in liquid or packaged from specified destinations such as plants, residences, offices, or within industrial yards to The Habitat Store and builds relationships with donors, vendors, customers and volunteers by performing the following duties. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Attends all Habitat-Spokane events Verifies load against shipping papers and helps coordinate pick-ups. Drives truck to destinations. Provide excellent customer service to donors, volunteers and customers. Evaluates donated items for The Habitat Store per acceptance criteria and screening for product usability Prepares in-kind donation receipts for loads picked up and turn them into Store Manager at least twice a week Maintains truck log according to state and federal regulations Maintains telephone or radio contact with Warehouse to receive delivery instructions. Communicating with Store Manager/Warehouse Coordinator regarding incoming donations Loads and unloads truck. Inspects truck equipment and supplies such as tires, lights, brakes, gas, oil, and water and picks up needed supplies for routine maintenance on truck. Performs emergency roadside repairs such as changing tires, installing light bulbs, fuses, tire chains, and spark plugs Responsible for scheduling pick-ups per working with the Warehouse Coordinator Assisting Habitat Store staff where needed Maintain an effective working relationship with Habitat staff, volunteers, Habitat partner families and customers. Works with volunteers Promotes the Habitat Store as an opportunity for donating, shopping and volunteering Promotes the mission of Habitat for Humanity-Spokane to customers, donors, volunteers and the community Supervisory Responsibilities This job has supervisory responsibilities over Volunteers assigned to help with duties making sure their experience is meaningful.

item.title: Speech Language Pathologist / Therapist (Home Health Care)
item.description: Details: Speech Language Pathologist / Therapist (Home Health Care) Take your career as an SLP to the next level with CareSouth! Known for quality care, we are the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a skilled Speech Language Pathologist who can implement the highest standards of care for speech-language pathology services. We offer workable schedules, competitive pay, excellent benefits, and advanced technology such as user-friendly smartphones and tablets. Every day, we make a difference in the lives of patients, and as a member of our team, so will you. Apply today! Speech Language Pathologist / Therapist (Home Health Care) Job Responsibilities As a Speech Language Pathologist, you will identify functional speech defects and establish a plan of care to improve patient’s function. You will be responsible for collaborating with referring physician and other organization personnel to ensure coordinated and comprehensive care that contributes to the total plan of care. SLP responsibilities include: •Conducting appropriate evaluations, assessing home environment, and identifying equipment needs relative to speech/language function •Administering speech therapy program utilizing specialized therapeutic technique and/or equipment •Recommending communication devices/aids as indicated •Participating in case conferences, in-services, and other meetings required to ensure coordinated and comprehensive care •Preparing and submitting notes per organization policy •Maintaining clinical competency in speech language pathology practice and theory •Identifying patient and family/caregiver needs for other services and refers as appropriate •Instructing patient, family/caregiver, and other Organization health care personnel in the patient’s treatment regime as indicated •Supervising home health aide in procedures directly related to the speech–language therapy plan of care Speech Language Pathologist / Therapist (Home Health Care)

Nurse Case Manager (RN Registered Nurse) Job Responsibilities As a Nurse Case Manager, you will direct and supervise all personnel involved in patient care within a specific geographic area. This involves making initial patient evaluation visits and consulting with the attending physician to establish and update the plan of care. You will be responsible for ensuring quality patient care and the allocation of agency resources. Additional responsibilities: •Assigning patients to Nurses and other members of the health team in conjunction with the Clinical Manager •Consulting with the Clinical Manager about problems concerning the admission of patients to Agency care and coordination of services •Assisting Clinical Manager in the supervision of Nurses and Home Health Aides •Reviewing plans for patient treatment and notifying team members of any changes •Participating in the nurse on-call system •Participating in staff development activities, meetings, and trainings •Initiating and conducting Care Team Conferences for patients •Completing assessments, re-assessments, and resumption of care and providing related supervision in a timely manner •Reviewing medical records for assigned case load and completing discharges •Ensuring that all records are in compliance with agency policies and procedures •Following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintaining the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI)

item.title: Florida Home Health Aide (Nursing Assistant)
item.description: Details: Florida Home Health Aide (Nursing Assistant) Job Description Experience how much MORE you can get out of your career when you partner with CareSouth! Known for quality care, we are the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a Home Health Aide to deliver skilled and compassionate care to our patients.
