item.title: Loan Specialist I/II DOE
item.description: Details: Exciting Career Opportunities at Credit Union West! Come Join Our Family- Credit Union West is an award-winning financial cooperative in Arizona with a mission to enhance quality of life. Our core principles guide our decisions ensuring integrity and trusted member service. With more than $500 million in assets and nearly 50,000 members, we are a community asset that is positioned to meet your financial needs. We have a long history of serving our community and look for employees who embody that spirit of giving. We value our members, and our greatest resource is the group of talented and skilled employees who serve them. Reasons to Join Our Team: A Challenging and rewarding work environment Opportunities for growth and advancement Tuition reimbursement Incentive pay Comprehensive benefits Credit Union West Named Top Company! We are proud to have earned a place on the 2013 CareerBuilder’s Top Companies to Work for in Arizona list. This program recognizes organizations that create quality jobs and work environments, and make Arizona a better place for our workforce. We know what makes us a great place to work... Loan Specialist I, OR II (DOE) Enhances the quality of life for our members by consistently meeting or exceeding their service expectations. Provides high quality service, defined as ensuring prompt and accurate loan processing and fund disbursements while identifying and recommending additional member benefit needs in a professional manner. Prepares loan applications for credit approval, make decision recommendations and disburses approved loans. Responsible for preparing all documents necessary to close consumer-related account loans. Delivers loan paperwork, distributes loans to branches, and coordinates closings with branch personnel. Reviews, documents, and finalizes loan closing for indirect loans initiated at all approved indirect point-of-sale locations. Communicates with related-team member and applicants to explain credit decisions and to obtain additional loan information and documentation. Prepares application and presents loan requests to lenders for loan decisions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Supports the mission of the Credit Union by enhancing the quality of life for our members. Ensures that all members’ needs are identified and the appropriate referrals or sales match the Credit Union’s services and products including, types of available accounts, special promotions, loan and deposit products, account convenience options and other related services and information. Maintains a product knowledge level that supports a needs-based referral and selling program. Actively listen to members to identify needs and cross-sell accordingly. Responsible for the effective performance of loan interviews and clerical support for all phases of the loan processing activities and promotions. Prepares paperwork for loan applications. Runs reports, retrieves credit ratings, reviews files, figures debt ratios and works up applications. Presents and explains Credit Union services and products to members and assists in meeting their financial needs. Opens and closes accounts. Completes payroll deductions and authorization forms, ACH debits, wires and collection items and accurately completes paperwork associated with each. Effectively interview loan applicants, calculate figures, verify information, seek cross-sell opportunities, complete applications, and process loans and make decision recommendations. Generate and complete analysis on credit reports including facilitating score enhancement for the members. Follows-up with applicants to obtain personal and financial data to complete loan applications for presentment to loan officers. Contacts credit bureaus, employers, former creditors and personal references by telephone, direct computer access or letter to check credit and personal references to verify credit worthiness and accuracy of credit information. Credit Union West is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Maintenance Supervisor
item.description: Details: BASIC FUNCTIONS: The role of the Maintenance Supervisor is to provide vision, planning, leadership, and direction to our Maintenance Department. The Maintenance Supervisor basic functions include but are not limited to: •Work closely with the ABC-Atlantic Leadership Team to formulate, communicate and execute our mission statement and take care of our customers •Work closely with the Production Supervisor Group and Production Manager to complete projects associated with continual improvement •Coordinate with other Nucor facilities concerning best practices •Coordinate resources and efforts concerning Maintenance teammate training •Complete paperwork including, but not limited to, work orders, inventory, and preventive maintenance forms •Monitor Maintenance group performance, coach and support the Maintenance team •Develop and monitor preventive maintenance schedules for the production facility •Negotiate pricing and service regarding acquisition of parts and machinery from vendors •Other responsibilities as designated by the Production Manager

item.title: Medical Assistant - Enfield (Part time 16 hrs/week)
item.description: Details: Outstanding healthcare opportunity If you are ready for a satisfying and rewarding career, join our team of diverse and motivated professionals at Community Health Center, Inc. (CHC). CHC is one of the country’s most creative and dynamic providers of primary medical, dental and mental health services to the uninsured and underinsured. CHC is building a world class primary health care system that is committed to caring for special populations, and that is focused on improving health outcomes for our patients as well as building healthy communities. We are one of the leading health-care providers in the state of Connecticut, providing comprehensive primary care services in medicine, dentistry, and behavioral health. With more than 100,000 active patients, CHC is the health care home that works to keep our patients—and our communities—healthy. We go beyond the traditional health services to bring care wherever our patients and clients are, using innovative service delivery models and state of the art technology. We use the latest treatments and technologies within the Patient-Centered Medical Home Model (PCMH) to care for our growing patient base. This is the growth opportunity for you if you: Are a compassionate and enthusiastic team player Have a thorough knowledge of medical assisting responsibilities Are extremely organized and pay great attention to detail Enjoy working with people Thrive in a fast paced environment As a Medical Assistant at Community Health Center, you will: Practice at the top of one's education and certification Be an integral part of the health care team, involved in pre-visit planning and the daily huddle with your patient care team Order diagnostic imagine and perform screening tests under standing orders Make urgent referrals for specialty and follow-up care Work in our state-of-the-art electronic health record system Execute quality assurance activities in accordance with Joint Commission standards Liaise with patients, insurance companies and specailists Manage patient document workflow Engage in continuing education activities

item.title: Dockworker Part Time
item.description: Details: Is your career taking you where you want to go? When it began in 1924, Saia (NASDAQ: SAIA) covered a two-state area: Louisiana and Texas. Today, Saia is one of the most successful carriers in the United States, providing regional and interregional LTL, non-asset truckload service, and third-party logistics. Much of Saia's growth has been accomplished through mergers and acquisitions. Headquartered in Johns Creek, GA, Saia is a growing corporation offering the best-in-class benefits and opportunities to inspire every member of our team. With over 8,000 employees dedicated to their jobs and our customers, you may discover your own career path at Saia. The road to a great career starts with Saia! Today, Saia's network of 147 terminals covers 34 states in the U.S. as well as Canada. Through our network of partners, we serve the balance of the U.S. including Alaska and Hawaii, plus Puerto Rico and Mexico. Through our three operating service groups - Saia LTL, Saia Truckload Plus, and Saia Logistics Services - we provide complete transportation and logistics solutions. For more information on Saia, visit the Saia website at http://www.saiacorp.com/ . Part Time Dock Worker / Forklift Operator If you’re an experienced Dock Worker with freight dock or warehouse experience, don’t miss this opportunity to join one of the most successful LTL carriers in the U.S! Saia is seeking an experienced Dock Worker / Forklift Operator for a part time position with our freight dock team. We have a network of 147 terminals, covering 34 U.S. states and Canada, extending to Puerto Rico and Mexico through our partners. Working for Saia means the opportunity to partner with a successful company and enjoy stability and security for you and your family. But don’t just take our word for it here’s what some of our employees have to say: “Saia is a company that truly knows how to achieve success. They care about the people and they care about their customers" “Great perks for the employees, the company grasps the concept of ‘take care of your employees and your business will succeed’" Don’t miss out on this excellent part time opportunity, apply today! Part Time Dock Worker / Forklift Operator Job Responsibilities As a part time Dock Worker/ Forklift Operator you will be responsible for: • Using safe lifting techniques, efficiently sorting, handling, loading and unloading freight into/from over-the-road equipment, containers, city trailers, and/or straight trucks • Using pallet jacks and forklifts in the loading and unloading of freight including shipments of Hazardous Materials freight Part Time Dock Worker / Forklift Operator Preferred Qualifications You’ve already got a positive attitude and strong work ethic but here’s what else you’ll need to qualify for this great opportunity! Our ideal Dock Worker will also have: • Freight handling experience • Forklift certification • Hazmat training • Previous freight dock or warehouse experience helpful Part Time Dock Worker / Forklift Operator Benefits At Saia, your success is our success! That’s why we work hard to provide you with what you need to build an awesome career. We are committed to rewarding superior employee performance so that when you work hard, your achievements won’t go unnoticed. We are proud to offer the following benefits to part time employees who qualify: • 401k with immediate vesting • Paid Holidays • Paid Vacation days • Paid Personal/Sick Day • Employee Stock Purchase plan • Credit Union • Weekly paycheck • Direct deposit • Scholarship program • Employee recognition programs Our Mission At Saia Inc., success comes down to taking care of the people who matter most – our customers, our employees and our shareholders. The rest will take care of itself. "Provide best-in-class service – as defined by our customers – through quality processes in an environment that respects employees, advocates safety, recognizes excellence, and builds shareholder value."

item.description: Details: Unity Concepts, Inc. is seeking enthusiastic individuals to start their career in Sales, Marketing, Management, Human Resources and Recruiting. We offer a team based and structured environment, however employees are expected to be self-disciplined in managing their own time and work schedule. · Fun, team building environment · Travel Opportunities · Leadership workshops & development · Financial management, business management, time management · Philanthropy events -- a chance to give back to the community · Recognition for top performers · Advancement to management based on performance

item.title: Automotive Sales Executive
item.description: Details: We are having a record year. Join our team and be a part of the success. Orland Park Nissan has been family owned and operated for 25 years. We have immediate openings for talented sales professionals. Qualified candidate must be well-spoken, have professional appearance, be dedicated to product knowledge and know how to deliver top-notch customer service every time. Previous automotive experience a plus but we are willing to train the right people who possess the drive and attitude we are looking for. We offer a positive and enthusiastic work environment. Busy 159th Street location, the hottest product in the US, strong management support, aggressive advertising and a pay plan like no one else including:Base salary.Commission.Bonuses. Mfr spiff programs.Demo allowance. 401k. Medical benefits package. Stop spinning your wheels. Now is the time to put your sales career into overdrive.

item.title: Personal Trainer
item.description: Details: JOB TITLE: OTF Personal Trainer OTF Overview: Orangetheory Fitness uses scientifically proven concepts to push your body to do its best. Participants complete intervals throughout the hour training session. This workout helps build strength, increase energy, surpass workout plateaus and tone and shape your body like nothing else. Job Description: The OTF Personal Trainer will lead up to 24 participants through OTF specific group training sessions. • Responsible for creating positive, high energy, OTF training sessions • Responsible for organization and cleanliness of the training floor, as well as other area of the studio when needed. • Responsible for marketing your OTF training services inside and outside the OTF studio. Examples are marketing events with your OTF team, corp events, tents and tables, etc. • Responsible for building OTF attendance and retaining current clientele • Responsible for group training program design and lesson plans to be viewed by your Head Trainer each week. • Responsible for the safety of your participants in regards to heart rate, exercise technique, posture and spine, as well as joint stress and stability when resistance training • Responsible for your scheduled OTF group training sessions including but not limited to requesting substitute trainers to cover your session, helping other trainers when available and assisting as a floor trainer when applicable. • Attend monthly fitness staff meetings and all relative, mandatory webinars and other requested corporate meetings and continuing education presentations. • Handle member concerns/feedback in a professional, objective manner with the goal of resolution and retention when applicable. • Assist Sales Associates, when needed, with OTF studio tours/sales with new prospects as well as staying abreast with current pricing options. • Must be flexible and willing to work weekends when needed and as requested by your Studio Manager and/or Head Trainer • Intermediate level knowledge of physiology, exercise technique and body mechanics. • Must have the ability to multi-task and stay organized while training up to 24 clients in one group training session. • Must have the ability to progress and regress exercises on the fly, in real time • Positive, motivating and effective interpersonal communication skills. • Must have the desire and capacity to train all fitness levels, novice to elite. • Must hold a current fitness certification from an OTF approved education company such as ACSM, ACE, NASM, NSCA, AFFA, NFPT, NPTI, etc. • Must invest 10+ hours per year in continuing education lectures and workshops outside of OTF curriculum. • Bachelor’s degree in an Exercise Related Field is preferred. • Must have current CPR/AED certification • 1+ years of professional experience teaching groups and/or personal training in the Fitness Industry. • Must understand heart rate focused training programs and the science that supports the OTF workouts. • Excellent communication and customer service skills • Must have the strength and ability to safely lift and move up to 40 lbs CORE COMPETENCIES-OT Personal Trainer Business Mastery Job Accountabilities Customer Market Knowledge x Business Acumen Strategic Thinking Global Perspective x Shape Vision and Strategy Problem Solving x Decision Making x Organizational Leadership Drive Sales Execution x Drive Service Execution x Maximize People Contributions Relationship Management Building and Managing relationships with Clients x Building and Managing relationships withStaff x Collaboration x Communcation ( Verbal / Written / Non-Verbal) x Self Management High Performance Orientation x Adaptability x Development Orientation (self and others) x Sales Skills and Strategies Technical / Functional Expertise Understand MBO systems Administrative Excellence

item.title: Assistant Director of Education/Administration
item.description: Details: Assistant Director of Education/Administration (Fort Worth) HUNTINGTON LEARNING CENTER is one of the largest companies in the Supplemental Education Industry with over 300 centers nationwide. Our exceptional people and proven curriculum are the reasons why we have shown consistent growth since 1977. Our commitment to excellence continues in our search for a qualified professional who will help us continue our success! At Huntington Learning Center there are growth and advancement opportunities. An entry level administrative position is now available in our Fort Worth location. Our TEAMS of dedicated full time and part time staff members work together in helping thousands of children do better in school each year. Across the nation, students of all ages attend our learning center to get back on track towards educational success. You can help children realize their educational potential by becoming an Assistant Director. Assistant Director Responsibilities include the following: * Develop and maintain student programs * Monitor and maintain center activity * Work closely with students: administer academic evaluations and assisting new students * Hire, train, schedule, and supervise part-time teaching staff * Schedule teachers and students for sessions, as well as appointments for parent conferences * Customer service and marketing experience is absolutely necessary * Teach and monitor students' academic programs * Organize and conduct presentations to school personnel as well as local businesses All Candidates must possess the following: * Minimum of Bachelor's degree (preferably in an education related field) * State Teacher's Certification * Excellent communication and listening skills * Commitment and desire to succeed * Strong leadership and managerial skills a must * Patience and compassion for school-aged children * Ability to multitask * Flexibility * Professional demeanor * Evening and weekend availability a MUST * Reliable transportation Successful candidates must have high levels of enthusiasm, outgoing and confident personalities, the ability to motivate others and work in a TEAM environment, and must be customer service oriented. If interested, please send a COVER LETTER and RESUME to the email address provided above. Resumes will not be screened without a proper cover letter attached.

item.description: Details: Employer is seeking candidates to join our office team, great on the phone, proficient in office tasks and with excellent analytical skills. Full-time position 40 hours/wk Some of the responsibilities include: Providing excellent customer service, Issuing purchase orders, Resolves product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution, Prepare weekly and monthly reports for internal use, Other clerical duties as assigned plus, assist other departments on an as needed basis.

item.description: Details: When is a job more than “just a job?” •When you know that you are making a difference in the lives of those around you •When you go to work every day looking forward to the day ahead of you •When the decisions you make on the job really matter to those whom you serve Assistant Store Manager When you choose a career in retail operations with Murphy USA, you are choosing to work at the heart of our business. You will interact with our valued customers and deliver the legendary customer service that Murphy USA and our associates are known for providing. To be successful as an Assistant Store Manager, you need energy, an excellent work ethic, a great attitude and a smile. Your responsibilities will include: •Providing a prompt, efficient, and courteous customer experience •Assisting customers with purchases and fuel transactions •Restocking merchandise •Supporting the Store Manager in all store operations •Helping lead the team to exceed the store’s performance goals and objectives •Performing job related duties as assigned A job is more than just a job when it’s a career at Murphy USA. item.title: Entry Level Sales, Customer Orientated Account Specialist
item.description: Details: Entry Level Public Relations - Entry Level Sales - Entry Level Marketing First Reaction, Inc. is currently offering sales and marketing positions that include comprehensive training. No prior sales experience is necessary, and we will train you to learn a variety of skills from sales and human resources to management and mentorship. Successful candidates will have opportunities to advance in to leadership and management positions. As a fast paced company in the direct sales and marketing industry, First Reaction continues to set the standard for excellence in client acquisition and customer retention. By providing direct sales and marketing services to Fortune 500 companies nationwide, we increase the market shares of our clients through a proven direct sales approach. This job involves face-to-face sales, marketing, customer service and event promotions of our clients' services. Our sales approach is not only a refreshing alternative to more general mass sales and marketing strategies, but it is also responsible for the unprecedented growth and stability of our company. We pride ourselves on recognizing top performance, integrity, and a winning mindset; we promote 100% from within our company. If you possess a great work ethic and would enjoy learning how to manage the varying dimensions of a business, First Reaction, Inc in Manhattan may be the right fit for you! to be considered for the position Responsibilities in Entry Level Include: Assisting in the daily growth and development of our company Assisting with efforts of new business acquisition Expertly managing the needs of external customers Developing strong leadership and interpersonal skills Face to face sales of services to new business and/or consumer prospects

item.title: Manager of Financial Systems
item.description: Details: We are currently performing an exclusive search for a Manager of Financial Systems for a large publicly traded company which is a leader in its industry.​ Our client is one of Tampa Bay's premier employers and is well known for outstanding work/life balance, a phenomenal leadership team, excellent benefits and strong growth opportunities. RESPONSIBILITIES: The Manager of Financial Systems will be responsible for the following: Develop a vision, implement and maintain the strategy for financial reporting in the ERP framework. Responsible for driving and implementing best practices in all financial reporting technology and ensuring that data is consistent and accurate across all systems. Partner directly with the finance and accounting team to identify the best financial reporting solutions. Spearhead initiatives to modify reporting structures and local systems to provide seamless integration with management reporting systems. Primary lead on design, enhancements (planning and testing), process improvements and new initiatives related to financial reporting systems. Responsible for subsequent operation, troubleshooting and maintenance in new process states. Ensure integrity of all financial data, hierarchies and reporting through process management. Continuously review and research opportunities to maximize utilization of relevant systems. Stay abreast of new offerings and solutions that could be of potential benefit to the business.

item.title: Nurse Practitioner - Geriatric Primary Care
item.description: Details: Nurse Practitioner – Geriatric Primary Care A Family NursePractitioner, Adult Nurse Practitioner, Geriatric, or Acute Care NursePractitioner is needed for a permanent, full-time or part-time opportunity tojoin a long term care facility in the central valley region of California. Stockton is the fourth largest city in thestates central valley region. It isconnected westward with the San Francisco Bay and San Joaquin River and is,with Sacramento, one of the state's two Inland sea ports. In and aroundStockton are thousands of miles of waterways and rivers that make up theCalifornia Delta. http://www.stocktongov.com/ Complete flexibility! Work FT or PT; create your own schedule! No call; weekends optional See 15 plus patients per day for all of their primary and preventive care needs while they are in a state of the art long term care facility Meet with the SNF nurse director daily to address high priority patients Provide continuity of care for patients within 2 facilities, one facility per day Follow-up on patients monthly for medication and care management The care team is made up of LPNs, MAs, and RNs Physician is periodically on-site; work autonomously as a leader within an established employer This is an opportunity for a self-starter, organized APRN that is passionate about the geriatric population Join a stable employer providing services to this community for over 12 years Orientation provided by an NP in the same position Work for an NP owned and operated organization! With BONUS COMPENSATION, NP’s can make $80 + per hour. Requirements: Master’s Degree Family Nurse Practitioner, Acute Care Nurse Practitioner, Adult Nurse Practitioner, or Geriatric Nurse Practitioner Licensure Current CA Licensure – Relocation assistance to instate candidates DEA License No new graduates, please Compensation: $55 per hour + productivity bonuses! Full comprehensive health benefits, vision, and dental CME, PTO, FLEX SCHEDULING Apply onlineat www.advancedpracticesolutions.com or contact Barb Schieffer at 651-600-9159 or by email at B regarding thisopportunity. AdvancedPractice Solutions is the nation’s leading healthcare staffing and recruitmentfirm with 15 years of successful experience. Visit us online for more information and a complete listing of availableopportunities.

item.title: Nurse Practitioner - Clinical Nurse Specialist - Perinatal Unit
item.description: Details: Clinical Nurse Specialist or Nurse Practitioner - Perinatal Unity A Clinical Nurse Specialist or a master prepared Nurse Practitioner who wants to obtain their clinical nurse specialist certification is needed in Perinatal Unit and would qualify for this opportunity. Job Responsibilities: Full time, Monday - Friday - NO CALL! The CNS or NP Nurse Specialist with NICU experience will be the subject matter expert and role model within their specialty, promoting and developing best practices, education, process improvement, and staff guidance. The clinical nurse specialist or NP Nurse Specialist will have the opportunity to work with outstanding physicians in a leading-edge environment featuring the latest technologies with growth potential with some direct patient care as part of a team The CNS utilizes evidence-based nursing care standards and programs of care designed to achieve quality cost-effective patient focused outcomes. The Clinical Nurse Specialist or NP will have strong collaboration and communication skills as well as a quality and patient safety attitude. GENEROUS RELOCATION ASSISTANCE GENEROUS TUTION REINBURSEMENT PROGRAM CNS or NP Nurse Specialist with use Electronical Medical Records Job Requirements: Five years of professional clinical experience in the area of specialty NEW GRADS with clinical experience welcome to apply Master of Science Degree in Nursing (MSN) Certified Nurse Specialist within specialty for 5 years -will receive a generous tuition reimbursement! NP with 5 years in the specialty area that has the desire to obtain their certification- 100% tuition reimbursement for the 18 credits required for certification! Benefits: Join this leading-edge hospital as a Clinical Nurse Specialist or NP Nurse Specialist and enjoy outstanding benefits as well as the beauty of Pennsylvania and the excitement of the east coast! http://www.visitpa.com/ Compensation: $78K – $117K DOQ PTO, PA, Holidays, and CME Premium Health, Dental, Vision for the family ST as well as LT Disability and Life Insurance Malpractice coverage Relocation assistance Outstanding Education and Tuition Reimbursement program Education Assistance and Employee Asst Program Pre-tax program and 403b with company contribution Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com or contact Barb at 651-789-4902 (office) or 651-600-9159 (cell) or by email at regarding this opportunity.

item.title: Physician Assistant (PA) - Occupational Health
item.description: Details: Physician Assistant – PA-C Primary Care Occupational Healthcare Clinic Job Description Advanced Practice Solutions is a healthcare employment agency that provides professional Nurse Practitioners, Physician Assistants, and Physicians with exceptional opportunities across the U.S. We are seeking a Physician Assistant - PA-C or Nurse Practitioner - NP to work in an occupational outpatient healthcare setting located in Dickinson, North Dakota. A Physician Assistant or Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner with Adult Nurse Practitioner, Family Nurse Practitioner, or Acute Nurse Practitioner certification will qualify for this permanent full time position. The NP / PA team works either Full-time or Part-Time NP / PA runs an outpatient clinic Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm NO CALL; NO WEEKENDS Possibility for a flexible schedule; block scheduling Full scope scheduled care and treatment of minor to moderate injuries NP / PA is responsible to see approx. 12 to 18 adult patients a day Typical visits include pre-employment worker assessments, medical care, and injury care; such as reading x-rays, foreign body removal, treating wounds, sutures, and splints Onsite training, professional development on a consisitent basis! Nearby hospital directly receives complex or acute cases with no clinic involvement Stable employment with a well-managed and friendly practice Medical Director very experienced in Occupational Health, accessible and willing to train NP / PA providers from other specialties or new graduates with a generous orientation period!!! Job Requirements Master’s Degree North Dakota Physician Assistant or Nurse Practitioner license, or immediate eligibility Occupational Health experience or familiarity with OSHA regulations a strong plus Benefits / Compensation $95k – 110k+, DOE Malpractice coverage Holidays, CME Health benefits Sign on bonus! Relocation allowance!! Temporary / long-term free housing available! Location: Just 4 hours from Billings, MT 1.5 hours from Bismark, ND in traffic! 3 hours to Bighorn National Park, located in Buffalo, MT!! Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com; contact Stephanie Doty direct at 651-600-7126 or by email at regarding this opportunity. Advanced Practice Solutions is the nation’s leading healthcare staffing and recruitment firm with 15 years of successful experience. Visit us online for more information and a complete listing of available opportunities.

item.title: RN- Cath Lab (Full Time M - F) *Seasonal Bonus*
item.description: Details: About the position This is a Seasonal position. At the end of the seasonal agreement the employee will receive a bonus based on the number of weeks worked for the season . The Cardiac Cath Lab Registered Nurses provide care for patients undergoing cardiac catheterizations, electrophysiology studies, peripheral studies/interventions and cardiac device implants. Care includes administration and monitoring of moderate sedation under the direction of the physician. This procedure integrates scientific knowledge and technical skills with effective patient interaction to provide quality patient care and useful diagnostic information. Cardiac Cath Lab Registered Nurses require a high degree of knowledge in radiologic imaging as well as anatomy of the heart, circulatory, and neuro system in a critical care environment. Prepares for and assists the cardiologist / electrophysiologist in complex procedures involving advanced equipment to aide in diagnostic testing, interventions, and device implantation into the circulatory system under acute situations. Provide care in a highly technical and highly acute environment. About the Cariovascular Cath Lab Two cardiac cath labs and one EP lab Approximately 2,400 procedures a year Cath Recovery Unit is a 10 bed recovery area About the hospital Florida Hospital Zephyrhills has been nationally recognized by the American Heart Association, the American Stroke Association, The Joint Commission, and HealthGrades for excellence in providing top quality patient care . The award-winning Heart Institute has received recognition in the treatment of coronary intervention, heart failure, chest pain, open heart surgery, and electrophysiology procedures. The Brain and Spine Institute provides brain surgery, spine surgery and minimally invasive neuro-interventions, immediately responds to acute strokes, and has been awarded Advanced Certification for Primary Stroke Centers by The Joint Commission. The hospital offers advanced MAKOplasty® robotic partial knee and total hip replacement through its Orthopedic Institute. It also offers 24/7 emergency services including a new “fast track” option, inpatient and outpatient surgical services, labor and delivery through The Baby Place®, the Center for Wound Healing, Sleep Center, Imaging Services, and the Simpson Breast Health Center, providing comprehensive breast health care services. We are located at 7050 Gall Blvd. (US 301), Zephyrhills, FL 1-855-JOBS FHZ (562-7349) opt# 1

item.title: Sales / Entry Level Sales / Marketing and Sales- Full Time/ PAID TRAINING
item.description: Details: Job is located in Atlanta, GA. Sales / Entry Level Sales / Marketing and Sales- Full Time/ PAID TRAINING J.W. item.title: Physician - Rural Health Family Practice
item.description: Details: Physician – MD / DO Rural Health Family Practice Job Description Advanced Practice Solutions is a healthcare employment agency that provides professional Advanced Practice Nurses, Physician Assistants, and Physicians with great opportunities across the U.S. We are seeking a Physician (Board Certified MD / DO) to work in Primary Care, Out-patient, at a Federally Qualified Health Care Clinic in Garfield County, Oklahoma . This well established organization has three facilities that provide comprehensive medical, dental, and behavioral health care for families and individuals, of all ages, incomes and occupations, in our community and surrounding areas. A Physician with in-depth experience in Emergency Medicine, Urgent Care, Rural Health, Internal Medicine, or Family Practice will qualify for this permanent MD position. Join this team as a permanent Family Practice Physician Work Monday through Friday Hours 8 am to 5 pm No Call / No Hospital Rounds Optional 4 day work week See patients of all ages for ambulatory medical care needs MD will see both walk in and scheduled patients Join an experienced group of Mayo Clinic trained Physicians, Advanced Practice Providers, and Support Staff Cover three state of the art practices, while working out of the Garfield County location NEW GRADUATES PLEASE APPLY 10 to 20 patients per day once fully acclimated; productivity for seeing more than 10 patients per day regularly Job Requirements: Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine degree (DO) or Doctor of Medicine degree (M.D.) Eligible for immediate Oklahoma License Maintain an unrestricted medical license to practice medicine in the United States Benefits / Compensation: $180 - $190K base salary + PRODUCTIVITY bonus averaging a total income of $240K Malpractice Insurance CME days and funds Full comprehensive health benefits RELOCATION ASSISTANCE LOAN REPAYMENT through the National Health Services Corp: receive up to $50,000 in loan repayment for committing to serve at the site for at least two years!!! Location: Located 1.5 hours from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma Located under 2 hours south from Wichita, Kansas Located 1.5 hours from Tulsa, Oklahoma Garfield, County is known as a city with vibrant shopping, amazing attractions and stories of heritage throughout our community. http://www.visitenid.org/ Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com or contact Stephanie Doty direct at 651-600-7126 or by email at regarding this opportunity. Advanced Practice Solutions is the nation’s leading healthcare staffing and recruitment firm with 15 years of successful experience. Visit us online for more information and a complete listing of available opportunities.

item.title: Adult / Family Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner - PMHNP – Acute Psychiatric Services
item.description: Details: Adult / Family Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner PMHNP – Acute Psychiatric Services Job Description Advanced Practice Solutions is a healthcare employment agency that provides professional Advanced Practice Nurses, Physician Assistants, and Physicians with exceptional opportunities across the U.S. We are seeking a Family or Adult Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner – PMHNP to work in an outpatient acute Emergency Room in Minneapolis, Minnesota. An Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner with certification as an Adult Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner or Family Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner will qualify for this permanent NP position. Work in a .80 FTE evening position Work every other weekend - with additional weekdays given off Nurse Practitioners will provide treatment of psychiatric emergencies such as acute psychotic conditions, panic states, severe and incapacitating depression, suicidal crisis, danger to others, sudden loss of memory, and situations involving grave mental disability Work in a team atmosphere willing to train new graduates that consist of psychiatrists, psychologists, psychiatric social workers, advanced nurse practitioners, and psychiatric nurses. Psychiatric team will work to prevent development of more serious psychiatric disorders by early identification of, and intervention in, potentially hazardous emotional crisis. This leading hospital system averages more than 42,000 calls and drop-in visits each year and are handled by the Acute Psychiatric Services team Job Requirements Clear NP Licensure Eligibility for Minnesota Licensure Master’s Degree New Graduates ready to work in a fast paced and supportive atmosphere are welcome to apply Benefits / Compensation RELOCATION ASSISTANCE Full Comprehensive Health Benefits 90-105K CME / Malpractice / PTO / Holidays / Retirement Location: www.exploreminnesota.com www.hennepin.us/ http://minneapolis.about.com/od/citiesneighborhoods/u/relocation.htm Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com; contact Stephanie Doty direct at 651-600-7126, or by email at regarding this opportunity. item.description: Details: Dermatology Physician Assistant (PA-C) A full-time permanent Physician Assistant is needed in Santa Maria, California. Approximately 120 miles from Los Angeles, Santa Maria Valley offers something for the entire family. This fun-filled playground is in the foothills of the Sierra Madres, is just minutes from pristine beaches, and is also a short commute to several wineries and the famous San Louis Obispo farmers market and shopping district. www.cityof santamaria .org/ • Work Monday through Friday; 8-5 • No weekends; No call • Join an established medical group with Physicians, PA-C, MAs, and front office support • Work at a state of the art facility that presents a spa type feeling • See patients for dermatological visits, cosmetic injections, minor surgical procedures, and laser treatments Requirements: • Master’s Degree • 3 years’ experience as a Physician Assistant in Dermatology • Immediate eligibility for CA licensure • Clean licensure • Ability to work autonomously Compensation: • Full comprehensive health benefits • CME dollars and days with additional on-site training for newest treatments • Very competitive salary and additional bonuses Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com or contact Stephanie Doty at 651-600-7126 or by email at regarding this opportunity. item.title: Physician Assistant - PA-C - Occupational Medicine
item.description: Details: Physician Assistant – PA-C - Occupational Health - Primary Care Job Description Advanced Practice Solutions is a healthcare employment agency that provides professional Advanced Practice Nurses, Physician Assistants, and Physicians with exceptional opportunities across the U.S. We are seeking a Physician Assistant/ PA-C or Nurse Practitioner / NP to work in an outpatient setting located in Williston, North Dakota. A Physician Assistant or Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner with certification as an Adult Nurse Practitioner, Family Nurse Practitioner, or Acute Care Nurse Practitioner will qualify for this permanent full time position. The NP / PA team works either Full-time or Part-Time NP / PA runs an outpatient clinic Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm NO CALL; NO WEEKENDS Possibility for a flexible schedule; block scheduling Full scope scheduled care and treatment of minor to moderate injuries NP / PA is responsible to see approx. 12 to 18 adult patients a day Typical visits include pre-employment worker assessments, medical care, and injury care; such as reading x-rays, foreign body removal, treating wounds, sutures, splints, etc. Nearby hospital directly receives complex or acute cases with no clinic involvement Stable employment with a well-managed and friendly practice Medical Director very experienced in Occupational Health, accessible, and willing to train NP / PA providers from other specialties or new graduates with a generous orientation period!!! Job Requirements Master’s Degree North Dakota Physician Assistant or Nurse Practitioner license, or immediate eligibility Occupational Health experience or familiarity with OSHA regulations a strong plus Benefits / Compensation $95k – 105k+, DOE Malpractice coverage Holidays, CME Health benefits Sign on bonus! Relocation allowance!! Temporary free housing available! Location North Dakota is home to many wildlife refuges and is a great place for the outdoor sportsman and all who enjoy four seasons www.ndtourism.com Williston, ND is nestled in the northwest corner of North Dakota, just 60 miles from the Canadian border and 18 miles from the Montana border The economy is enriched by the oil and gas industry, agriculture and the service sector Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com; contact Stephanie Doty direct at 651-600-7126, or by email at regarding this opportunity. item.title: (CNS) - Clinical Nurse Specialist - Critical Care
item.description: Details: Clinical Nurse Specialist - Critical Care / Relocation assistance A Full-time Clinical Nurse Specialist (CNS) is needed in Critical Care at one of the leading Hospital systems in Southeast Pennsylvania. The winner of numerous national and local awards, this Magnet Hospital has a high level of CNS commitment. The bucolic area boasts country or city living, a comfortable cost of living, all within an hour’s train ride to Philadelphia. With easy access to DC, Baltimore, New York and New Jersey, living in Southeast Pennsylvania puts you in the heart of New England living with plenty of choices for nightlife, kids and families, and parks and recreation. http://www.visitphilly.com/ Full time, Monday - Friday NO CALL The CNS will be the subject matter expert/role model within their specialty, promoting and developing best practices, education, process improvement, and staff guidance. Some direct patient care as part of a team 6 EP Physicians and 3 EP labs The clinical nurse specialist are educated as advanced clinical practioners, educators, consultants, researchers, and role models The CNS utilizes evidence-based nursing care standards and programs of care designed to achieve quality cost-effective patient focused outcomes across the three spheres of influence: Patient/Client, Nursing/Nursing Practice, and Organization/Systems Requirements: Master of Science Degree in Nursing (MSN) Clinical Nurse Specialist (CNS) certification in Specialty, or immediate eligibility High level of clinical technology such as TAVR, LVAD, and very serious CHF management Five years of professional clinical experience in the area of specialty Three years of clinical experience as advanced practice provider a plus NEW GRADS with clinical experience welcome to apply Compensation: $85, 000 - $100,000+ PTO, CME Comprehensive benefits Relocation assistance Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com or contact Barb Schieffer (o) 651-789-4902 ext 309 (c) 651-600-9159 or by email at regarding this opportunity. An Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner with certification as an Adult Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner, Family Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner, or Psychiatric Clinical Nurse Specialist with a true desire to work in Public Health or Corrections will qualify for this permanent position. Work Monday through Friday 40 hours per week NO CALL; NO WEEKENDS Psychiatric team will work to prevent development of more serious psychiatric disorders by early identification of, and intervention in, potentially hazardous emotional crisis The mission of Hennepin County is to enhance the health, safety, and quality of life of our residents and communities in a respectful, efficient and fiscally responsible way This facility is maximum security and holds 330 inmate housing beds; across the street in City Hall, there are an additional 509 inmate housing beds Annually this facility houses an approximate 40,000 inmates per year with approximately 5,000 visits to the Psychiatric Service Team Clean safe environment in outpatient clinic setting Supportive atmosphere; new graduates will be trained Nurse Practitioner or Clinical Nurse Specialist will collaborate and consult with Psychiatrists and medical staff in providing direct care to patients in the Adult Detention Center See approximately 15 - 20 patients per day Work in a team atmosphere willing to train new graduates that consist of psychiatrists, psychologists, psychiatric social workers, advanced nurse practitioners, and psychiatric nurses. Job Requirements Clear NP Licensure Eligibility for Minnesota Licensure Master’s Degree New Graduates ready to work in a fast paced and supportive atmosphere are welcome to apply Benefits / Compensation RELOCATION ASSISTANCE Full Comprehensive Health Benefits 95-105K CME / Malpractice / PTO / Holidays / Retirement Location: www.exploreminnesota.com www.hennepin.us/ http://minneapolis.about.com/od/citiesneighborhoods/u/relocation.htm 2 hours South of Duluth, MN 35 minutes West of Hudson, WI Apply online at www.advancedpracticesolutions.com; contact Stephanie Doty direct at 651-600-7126, or by email at regarding this opportunity. item.title: Truck Driver Class A – Lease Purchase
item.description: Details: Class A CDL Truck Driver Experienced Truck Drivers — get your career moving as a regional or OTR CDL Truck Driver! We know what it takes to make money in trucking. We designed our lease purchase program to assure you make money from day 1! We have 5 trucks open. Looking to fill these trucks with drivers that are serious about their career and that are dedicated to being successful. We have a great program in play, now we need you! About the Lease Purchase All newer 2012, 2014 and 2015 Freightliners with APU's and Inverters Drivers will earn $1.00/mile on ALL miles both loaded and empty!! Drivers will be paid 100% FSC on ALL loaded and empty miles!!! The truck runs a Bumper-TO-Bumper warranty!!! We HAVE MILES! Expect to run 2700-3300 miles per week! Average length of haul is 980 NO COST FOR BASE PLATES AND PERMITS Family Atmosphere If you are looking for a company to call home, look no further and apply today! Transportation / Class A Main Expenses Truck Payment = $120.00/week plus .21CPM Fuel = Varies each week based on miles ran and MPG Maintenance = .10CPM (This covers the BUMPER to BUMPER Warranty) Bobtail ins = $36.50/week Occupational Accident - $36.00/week Rider Insurance $9.50 NO COST FOR BASE PLATES OR PERMITS Transportation / Full Time

After a proven track record, an opportunity for advancement into a Branch Manager position will be provided. THIS IS AN ENTRY LEVEL POSITION - NO EXPERIENCE IS NECESSARY!!!!!

item.title: Clinical Psychologist (part time)
item.description: Details: Beacon Therapeutic Diagnostic and Treatment Center is a private not-for-profit, social service agency serving the metropolitan Chicago area. Our mission is empowering children and families by helping them find their way to a better future by providing accredited educational, mental health and social services. The agency was founded in 1968 under the leadership of a group of parents desiring to provide special education services to children with disabilities. Presently Beacon operates several programs that provide special education, diagnostic, therapeutic and outreach mental health services to high-risk children and families. Our Homeless Services Program provides services to clients in homeless shelters. We have an Elementary School in Chicago plus a High School in Calumet Park, IL that is operated year round. This position is located at Outreach Services office at 11740 S. Western Ave in Chicago Administer standardized tests, interpret scores and provide written assessments and feedback to participants and staff. Meet with families and staff to communicate test results. Provide individual/family therapy to outpatient and outreach participants. Provide Psychological consult and direct minutes for IEP's. Perform psychological assessments both on-site and off-site, including at homeless shelters. Assist in staff trainings and clinical oversight committee.

item.title: Staff Accountant
item.description: Details: Fast growing HOA Management company seeking highly motivated staff accountant to join our team. Required responsibilities and duties as follows: Primary Responsibility: Provide accurate and timely financial statements for Evergreen Lifestyles Management clients. Assist Corporate Controller in all aspects of accounting for management, accounting staff, property managers, and the Board of Directors of Evergreen Lifestyles Management clients. Essential Duties: Prepare accurate and timely financial statements for multiple clients Record month end journal entries for multiple clients Reconcile balance sheet accounts on a monthly basis Prepare and file monthly sales and use tax returns Reconcile all bank accounts on a daily/weekly/monthly basis Prepare year end audit packages for multiple clients and interact with external auditors Analyze and communicate monthly budget variances relating to income statements Assist property managers with annual budget preparation Prepare cash flow projections and developer subsidy requests on demand Oversee the timely delivery of Form 1099s to pertaining vendors and Form 1096 to IRS Ability to meet deadlines within scheduled hours Review all outstanding items on monthly bank reconciliations Verify accounts payable and accounts receivable postings Research and resolve discrepancies on accounts receivable items Prepare and file annual tangible tax return Must be a team player, detail oriented with the ability to multi-task while working under pressure to meet deadlines

item.title: Load Quality Inspector
item.description: Details: Is your career taking you where you want to go? When it began in 1924, Saia (NASDAQ: SAIA) covered a two-state area: Louisiana and Texas. Today, Saia is one of the most successful carriers in the United States, providing regional and interregional LTL, non-asset truckload service, and third-party logistics. Much of Saia's growth has been accomplished through mergers and acquisitions. Headquartered in Johns Creek, GA, Saia is a growing corporation offering the best-in-class benefits and opportunities to inspire every member of our team. With over 8,000 employees dedicated to their jobs and our customers, you may discover your own career path at Saia. The road to a great career starts with Saia! Today, Saia's network of 147 terminals covers 34 states in the U.S. as well as Canada. Through our network of partners, we serve the balance of the U.S. including Alaska and Hawaii, plus Puerto Rico and Mexico. Through our three operating service groups - Saia LTL, Saia Truckload Plus, and Saia Logistics Services - we provide complete transportation and logistics solutions. For more information on Saia, visit the Saia website at http://www.saiacorp.com/ . Load Quality Inspector / Loading Manager / Operations Manager (LTL / Transportation) Job Description Ready to take your career in the transportation industry to the next level? Join one of the most successful LTL carriers in the U.S! Saia is seeking a Load Quality Inspector to change behavior to improve the quality of loading in major dock operations to improve exception free delivery and claims. We have a network of 147 terminals, covering 34 U.S. states and Canada, extending to Puerto Rico and Mexico through our partners. Working for Saia means the opportunity to partner with a successful company and enjoy stability and security for you and your family. But don’t just take our word for it here’s what some of our employees have to say: “Saia is a company that truly knows how to achieve success. They care about the people and they care about their customers" “Great perks for the employees, the company grasps the concept of ‘take care of your employees and your business will succeed’" A great management career is waiting for you! Apply Today! Load Quality Inspector / Loading Manager / Dock Operations Manager (LTL / Transportation) Job Responsibilities As Load Quality inspector you will be responsible for changing behavior to improve the quality of loading in major dock operations and insure exception free delivery and improve claims. Additional responsibilities: • Inspects and corrects load quality defects in freight loading, movement, or handling prior to the load closing. • Insures proper utilization of dock tools and equipment and assists with managing load quality equipment (bars, straps, dunnage and bags) to insure maximum utilization and minimized cost/consumption. Monitors and inventories quality equipment to insure adequate supplies are available. • Completes training of new dock employees including: Quality Five, forklift training and hazmat training. • Inspects processes for Overages/Shortages/Damages (OS&D) to insure proper procedures are followed by dock workers and supervisors. • Coaches, counsels and administers progressive discipline to dock employees. • Fosters relationship with operations team to achieve quality objectives. May travel to nearby terminals for dock training and load inspections. • Communicates with the Regional Claims Prevention Managers on accounts that adversely impact claims and Delivery Before Exception (DBE) results.. Load Quality Inspector / Loading Manager / Dock Operations Manager (LTL / Transportation) Job Requirements You’re a natural leader. You thrive in a fast paced environment. Inspiring others to achieve goals is what you do best; and that’s why we want you on our team! Here’s what else you’ll need to qualify for this exciting management opportunity that reports to the Regional Operations Manager: • Minimum 3 years LTL freight industry experience • Knowledge of proper loading, handling and movement of HAZMAT freight • Experience supervising, coaching, counseling and w/ progressive discipline • Available to work an extended/flexible schedule including nights/weekends Load Quality Inspector / Loading Manager / Dock Operations Manager (LTL / Transportation) Benefits At Saia, your success is our success! That’s why we work hard to provide you with what you need to build an awesome career. We are committed to rewarding superior employee performance so that when you work hard, your achievements won’t go unnoticed. We are proud to offer the following benefits: • Health Insurance with Medical, Dental, Rx & Vision • Free Life Insurance • Free Short-term Disability • 401(k) with immediate vesting & Company match • Immediate eligibility for Holiday Pay • Paid Vacation days and Personal/Sick Day • Employee Stock Purchase plan • Credit Union Load Quality Inspector / Loading Manager / Dock Operations Manager (LTL / Transportation) Our Mission At Saia Inc., success comes down to taking care of the people who matter most – our customers, our employees and our shareholders. The rest will take care of itself. "Provide best-in-class service – as defined by our customers – through quality processes in an environment that respects employees, advocates safety, recognizes excellence, and builds shareholder value."

item.title: WebFOCUS Business Intelligence Developer
item.description: Details: TEKsystems is looking for a WebFOCUS Business Intelligence Developer to join our team with an expanding telecommunications company in downtown Denver, Colorado! Ideal candidates will have the following skills: WebFOCUS Business Intelligence Development and Administration experience Administration experience - configuration, installation, server administration, working with user-interfaces & designing databases Experience designing and developing reporting solutions for executive management Experience communicating with IT and business teams; i.e. developers, IT management, business leaders, stakeholders, etc. Experience working in an analytical and highly communicative work environment Windows server experience Experience working in a UI environment Experience creating/working with WebFOCUS dashboards *Experience in the telecommunications industry is a plus! *Experience working in an enterprise-level organization is preferred. *Will consider out-of-state candidates! HOWEVER - employer will NOT pay relocation costs. As a WebFOCUS Developer this candidate will engage in various projects to design and develop solutions which provide business clients with operational performance information delivery systems or applications which streamline work within a service center environment. Don't miss this unique opportunity to work with an expanding telecommunications client in the heart of downtown Denver. Key WebFOCUS development responsibilities include: - Developing user-driven reporting applications with web interfaces, parameter-driven reports, drill-downs, multiple output options, access control, database design and administration. - Developing procedures to load reporting data marts - Developing analytical dashboards and portals - Developing scheduled WebFOCUS procedures which produce and deliver output to clients, or load data into reporting data marts - Collaborating with other WebFOCUS developers to work on larger, multi-part projects - Mentoring other WebFOCUS developers in best practices, coding techniques, interface design, database design, problem-solving and troubleshooting, peer reviews, and testing methods - Supporting existing applications and WebFOCUS procedures - Writing documentation to support applications and processes - Communicate with all stakeholders throughout a project to gain clarification of requirements, provide project status, identify gaps, identify issues, discuss schedules As a WebFOCUS Business Intelligence Administrator this candidate will provide various levels of support for the server environment and to other developers on the team. Key WebFOCUS adminstration responsibilities include: - Support WebFOCUS server environment as one of several administrators on the team - Provide periodic on-call support for the WebFOCUS server environment in a rotation with other administrators - Respond to alarms generated by the servers and troubleshoot issues when required (24x7) - Work with the vendor when needed to resolve issues or research product capabilities - Create data connections, generate File Descriptions (MFDs), troubleshoot data connection issues - Maintain user/developer access control within the WebFOCUS environment - Move other developer's finished code to production - Work various type of administrative requests submitted to the team through an online tool - Upgrading the WebFOCUS server software and supporting software Please contact me ASAP if you - or anyone you know - may be interested in this position! My contact information is listed below. I greatly appreciate any referrals, as WebFOCUS is a very niche skill! About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Java/J2EE Developer

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES: Prepare reconciliations of balance sheet accounts, including intercompany, interdivision and inventory accounts, as required by the corporate calendar. Analyze, identify and resolve all variances on a timely basis and assure that balance accurately reflects the asset or liability based on Generally Accepted Accounting Principals (GAAP). Analyzes financial transactions to ensure they are recorded to the appropriate general ledger accounts and makes any necessary corrections to journal entries as needed to properly reflect the financial position of the Company. Prepares reconciliations of bank accounts on a monthly basis. Resolves all general ledger variances on a timely basis and assures that stale checks are resolved timely per office procedures. Reviews financial reports and prepares all necessary accrual entries to ensure financial statements are complete, accurate and in compliance with GAAP. Reviews prepaid balance sheet accounts monthly and ensure that all necessary entries are complete to produce financial statements that are accurate and in compliance with GAAP. Identifies and investigates intercompany and facility out of balance issues as needed on a monthly basis and coordinates with appropriate personnel to resolve and make any necessary corrections. Prepares non-income tax returns, ensures timely payments of tax bills and prepares accounting entries necessary to provide for timely recognition of expense. Sets up new employees on Insperity HR System. Maintains and supplies payroll input. Prepares cost per treatment analysis, reviews inventory packages and resolves discrepancies with facility staff, and prepares book -to -physical adjustment entries, ensuring that medical supplies expense and inventory are reported accurately in accordance with GAAP. Prepares monthly financial statements and ensures the accuracy of reporting and compliance with GAAP. Prepares monthly local purchase/project reconciliation as well as maintaining the fixed asset system. Maintains knowledge of new applicable laws and regulations that apply to the accounting function and healthcare industry. Completes special projects and other duties as assigned by management. Record Retention Responsibility Insurance GL, Property, D&O, Cyber Other duties as assigned. item.title: CANE PROCESSING TEAM LEADER
item.description: Details: POSITION IS LOCATED IN CLEWISTON, FLORIDA Cane Processing Team Leader Position Summary : This is a front-line, salaried-exempt position, responsible for supervising a rotating shift of bargaining unit employees in the planning, implementation, and coordination of shift maintenance and Milling production as directed by the Mill Manager, Shift Manager, Operations Supervisor, and Maintenance Team Leader. Incumbent will be required to routinely work nights, weekends, and holidays, and be assigned as emergency on-call supervisor. Essential Duties : Supervise and direct the safe and efficient Milling operations to accomplish target grind rates, sucrose recovery, and reduce the potential for lost Milling time by coordinating operations with supporting departmental management. Supervise and direct the planned and preventative maintenance of all Milling equipment in a safe manner, using personal and professional mechanical knowledge and experience, by managing material inventory and assigning repair work in coordination with department management and planners, using the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS). Use SAP to schedule work assignments, record and approve time, and order materials. Train, coach, and motivate employees to conduct work assignments and accomplish goals in accordance with Operational Excellence and continuous improvement guidelines, with consideration for overall operating costs. Coordinate with outside departments the daily production targets in reference to: the amount of cane needed for consistent operations; weather conditions; and maintenance and other operational issues. Communicate effectively with employees to promote a positive work environment while promoting procedures and enforcing Company policies. Maintain budgetary inputs and training records necessary for the development of budget decisions and Company goals.

item.title: Maintenance Shop Technician B
item.description: Details: With general supervision from a Lead Technician, Maintenance Supervisor, or Maintenance Manager, a Technician B performs all drive train component work (on diesel and non-diesel equipment and trucks), as well as suspension and steering systems repairs and maintenance on heavy equipment and, where necessary, can perform basic tire work, such as replacement, tire rotation, etc., and checks torque specifications and replaces, where necessary, wheel end components, such as bearings. This position requires advanced mechanic type knowledge of engine drive trains, suspension and steering systems, electrical and hydraulic systems, advanced knowledge of air brake and valve systems to be able to perform advanced-level repair and maintenance on a variety of heavy equipment in the shop and on the road under emergency conditions. • Maintain advanced knowledge of a vehicle’s drive train components, including differential, drive shaft and transmission, suspension and steering systems, air brake and valve systems, as well as the electrical and hydraulic systems to perform advanced preventive and repair maintenance functions, on site and on the road, including: • Advanced drive train component repair and maintenance; • Advanced knowledge of vehicle body control systems, including hydraulics and electrical systems to maintain and repair the vehicles in a timely and safe manner; • Advanced knowledge of air brake and valve systems to effectively diagnose and repair complex braking and valve systems in the vehicles in a timely and safe manner; and • Safely repair vehicles that have broken down on the road to ensure that the Company’s equipment is returned to operation in a safe and efficient manner. • Identify the source of the malfunctions using a variety of electronic tools. • Refer more complex repairs to a Technician A, Lead Technician or Maintenance Supervisor. • Completion of applicable Company training programs. • Performs other job-related duties as required or apparent. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required by personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company. Republic Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

item.title: Reg Business Systems Analyst
item.description: Details: The Regional Business Systems Analyst acts as a liaison with business operations stakeholders to analyze the needs of various functional business areas while enhancing software and reinforcing business process standards. Based on knowledge of and experience with systems and design processes, the Regional Business Systems Analyst partners with information technology experts to design, develop, document and test solutions that meet business requirements. The Analyst ensures that solution requirements are clearly documented, communicated and validated. The Analyst is also responsible for knowledge transfer through effective user community training. • Serves as the primary liaison and point of contact between IT and assigned functional business area for routine software development and enhancement projects. • Conducts detailed reviews of divisional billing, cash application, and revenue generation processes. • Develops, implements and delivers system applications training. • Coordinates functional requirement gathering from Regional Subject Matter Experts. • Performs research and analysis for proposed projects in order to determine feasibility and presents findings to management. • Reinforces corporate standards in use of applications and business processes. • Facilitates system enhancement requests and coordinates the related application enhancement release schedule. • Works jointly with other IT personnel to create detailed project workplans • Creates detailed documentation of functional, system (non-functional), user and reporting requirements that may include but is not limited to: Use Cases, Logical Models, Process Flow Diagrams, Report Specifications and Data Mapping & Flow Diagrams. • Coordinates status meetings and produces progress reports. • Responsible for knowledge sharing with the IT Customer Support team. • Provides support to functional and user acceptance testing groups. • Performs other job related duties as assigned. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required by personnel so classified.
